author: {'steamid': '76561198377383336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1634987459}
review:
Its an interesting read. I would recommend it if you would like to read something very heavy and very long. Do note that it actually is even less of a game than most Visual Novels; this "game" is more like a book as you don't get any choices, and the art is very minimal. You don't do anything apart from read, so it doesn't hurt to just turn on the auto-dialogue option and read it like a book. Although it might sound boring, drab, and un-interactive, the stories are written well-enough that it sucks you in and maintains your interest throughout the runtime, even though the characters fall kinda flat from time to time and there are some unresolved issues, [spoiler] such as how the hell did the guy steal his dad's car, take another hospice patient with him, and not cause a massive shitstorm? [/spoiler]

The problem I found with the "game" is that sometimes it is incredibly hard to follow and understand. It doesn't do a good job of telling which character is talking, and if what is written in the dialogue box is actual dialogue or a way for the game to describe a scene or the thought of a character. The VA does alleviate some of the problems, as they only talk in actual dialogues, but there are lines that looks to be actual dialogue but have no dubbing, and the dubbing is mostly relegated to Narcissu 2, and even then, sometimes its incredibly hard to tell who is actually talking because they sound way too similar, especially Yuka and Himeko.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209022040', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1634431877}
review: Narcissu is a beautifully crafted visual novel that brings us through the feelings evoked by life and inevitable passing. Despite it's minimal art and interaction, it tells a story that brings out your emotions and sticks with you long after you complete it. The feeling of longing it's melancholy environment shows us is unlike anything else, and brings you to understand the characters limiting situations, and the harsh reality life sometimes brings. A free, short novel that shouldn't be looked over.

author: {'steamid': '76561199074199103', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1705073402}
review: 让留下来的人笑着活下去，让内心痛苦的人尽快站起来，濑津美和姬子想传达的两句话可能在我看来也是水仙想要表达的，即便是没有未来的未来，即便是没有选择的选择，她们依旧按着自己的方式，按着自己的想法走完了一生，她们改变第七楼，用最平淡的叙说写出最悲伤的故事，可却让人无法留下泪水，但正因如此我们才能从中看出作者想要表达的东西而不是一味的悲伤，也是以为这样水仙这部作品才能给我留下很深的感触，一段灿烂的回忆，一个冬日的故事，晚安濑津美。

author: {'steamid': '76561198287809528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1638428349}
review: 第一部整体的悲伤氛围非常棒，以平淡的口吻讲了一个始终环绕在悲伤中的故事。第二部气氛弱于第一部，更感人一些，也是第一部的前传性质的补充，但还是先建议玩第一部。两部的音乐都非常棒，剧情上完美体现了短小精悍，是我心中的神作

author: {'steamid': '76561198324486049', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1630728507}
review:
剧情：3 / 5
 一段灿烂的回忆，一个冬日的故事，病危少女抵达她的小小目标的物语。
Side 2nd是比故事还要长的注脚，让前作中散落的细节绽放光芒。

音乐：3 / 3
非常优秀，极其优美的旋律搭配角色很短的对白以及图片部分的演出。

画面：0 / 2
宽屏，CG数量很少，这种残影式的表达使得主题更加深刻，突然间切成全屏的濑津美简直惊艳。

综合：6 / 10
时隔6年，用英文再读"水仙"，对Side 2nd有了更深的体悟，果然当初先看2再看1是完全错误的×
从姬子，到濑津美，再到1代主角，绝望的第7层规则，被以添加了祝福与祈祷的形式传递下去。
这是丧失未来的人们的故事，没有扭转乾坤的神迹，也没有抵抗命运的强运。
960公里的赴死之路，22载空虚的终结，淡路岛水仙怒放的倩影，翡翠色的大海前少女最后的微笑。短小精悍，含蓄动人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198218141715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1630705075}
review:
~Spoiler Free Review~

Despite being a VN/LN lover, I hadn't heard of Narcissus until one of my fave developers mentioned it, saying that it was an inspiration to him and was part of the motivation that caused him to start writing for VNs too.  I figured his taste was trustworthy, so I sought out Narcissus and gave it a go, and I'm so glad I did!

First off, I want to mention that the experience is best done by reading the novels in reverse release order; Narcissu 1st was the original VN, and then Narcissu 2nd, despite being released afterwards, is actually a prequel that sets up the events of the first game.  You get SO MUCH MORE emotional meaning if you read the prequel first - otherwise the weight of the events isn't anywhere near as hard hitting.  So I'd recommend reading 2nd before 1st.

As you may have seen from the description, the story centres around people who are in a hospice and already know that they're not going to survive their illnesses - their imminent deaths are not the be all and end all of their lives.  It's how they choose to approach those deaths, and how they live in the moments between, that tell this story.  Narcissus is a really good portrayal of that kind of scenario.  It has relatable moments, feels very real, and is a pretty accurate depiction of mindsets that people tend to have when they're in dire circumstances.  It also manages to portray this without being super depressing, or by relying on trying to throw massive emotional moments at you every five minutes - it's kinda just real.  The emotion comes through in the little things, and the characters are also written well enough that you feel for them as people, so those little things really count.

Since this is quite an old game, the visuals are a little lacking; it's not like a typical VN in that there are plush backgrounds with moving sprites overlaid, and fancy text boxes - it's very basic.  Despite this, the story was good enough that I found myself not minding this at all, and to be honest, it made the moments you actually did see characters on screen so much more compelling, because they were hardly present.  What keeps you in the moment is the great voicing, as well as the story itself.  The soundtrack, although not very large, is actually pretty effective and makes you get attached to the pieces in a positive way, cancelling out much of the potential monotony of a small roster of pieces.  I also like that there are multiple vocal tracks.

A little drawback is that, since there is no typical VN textbox/GUI, you can't see how to do certain things, like switching auto on, which is a big problem for some people.  If you want auto mode on, press A.  The game doesn't tell you this, which is a bit crappy - I read it in the reviews before playing, luckily, so I'll keep passing it on.  Oh god, I'm passing the rules on...  (play the VN to know why that's so noteworthy)

Overall, Narcissus is a relatively short experience (about 10-11 hours legit playtime for me), and though the graphics and soundtrack are somewhat limited, and it's a kinetic novel with no choices to be made, I really enjoyed it.  It really makes you think about life, and might even make you well up a little bit, but among all the sadness, it might just make you smile too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307549234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1703244507}
review:
O que falar de Narcissu?

O game tem uma história consideravelmente longa, principalmente se levarmos em consideração a 2°Parte. A história toma um rumo que pode não agradar muitas pessoas, já que ela se desenvolve lentamente, além de possuir muitos diálogos (o que se espera de um game desse estilo e gênero). Porém, por mais que seja uma história lenta, à diversos momentos emocionantes, principalmente na 2°Parte. Os gráficos ou o estilo de arte é simples, mas bem feito. A trilha sonora é muito bonita e é um jogo que muito provavelmente ira lhe marcar, recomendo muito para aqueles que querem uma experiência diferente, e que talvez faça com que você tenha mais interesse em conhecer esse gênero que muitos tem preconceito!

NOTA: 8,0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199014390909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1627220040}
review:
不由自主的想起《可塑性记忆》的开场白。
“要是自己寿命的长短，从一开始就已经被定下来了的话，我会怎么去接受这事实呢。”
不同的是，《Narcissus》中所表现出的是平静和从容。
濑津美的平静和从容。
"你现在…希望我拉住你吗？“
“呵呵，我自己也不知道啊。”
……就这样，我们960公里的旅途结束了……

author: {'steamid': '76561198967004630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1710357815}
review:
I am rewriting my review, since a plot summary is not what a review is supposed to be. Enjoy a slightly better review.

This was one of my first visual novels, and what a great one to start my journey with. These stories will break your heart in the best ways imaginable. With a premise so depressing, like being a terminal patient in a hospice and escaping said hospice, or meeting someone weeks from their death, and forming the tightest of bonds before they die-- these two brazenly sad stories are some of the best stories I have read. Even now, after 10 VNs on my record (and especially then, when this was my second,) this game hold a very special place in my heart.

This game deals with death, depression, suicide, illness, and choosing between dying in a hospital, or surrounded by your family. It is heavy stuff. But that's why it's so good. They handled these topics near-flawlessly, with just words and simple pictures. Even through silence, you can feel emotion between every character. There is no romance to be found; just companions who want to help each other through their limited time. This game shows you that even in the darkest of times, joy can be found, catharsis is achievable, and the good vastly outweighs the bad, if you simply let it. 

The order I played these two stories greatly affected how they felt. I played the second story -- the one with the unnamed MC, first, meaning the money envelope was a mystery. Then I played the first one. At the end, I was crying for two reasons: because the envelope made sense now, [spoiler]and, of course, the death of Satsukis best friend.[/spoiler] I prefer the Second story, personally, but the first one had me good. I still get chocked up about the envelope, [spoiler] Satsukis and her friend's death, and MCs final "speech" about Satsuki.[/spoiler]

I do want to talk about one scene in particular, and how it was reprised at the end. Spoilers for the end, of course.
During MC and Satsukis road trip, they would stop by a beach, for Satsuki to stare off into it. One of these times, MC walks up to her, confused as to why she does this. She says something along the lines of "If I were to walk out into the ocean to die... would you stop me?" To which, he responds "I don't know... we'll just have to see what happens." Then, they both return to the car. I still think that would be the LAST thing you should say to someone who is fucking suicidal, but that's not my point here. At the end, MC and Satsuki do a bit of a photo shoot with a disposable camera, showing Satsuki in a swimsuit; the only recorded moment of her being happy. After which, she takes of her white wristband (meaning she's a resident of the hospice,) and begins toward the ocean. MC calls out to her to ask her one last thing: "Do you want me to stop you? Or, perhaps, you want me to give you a little push?" Satsuki smiles at him, replying "I'm not sure." and walks backwards, into the ocean, disappearing from sight. MC takes the wristband and developed photo, and drives off. I cannot remember exactly what his monologue at the end pertains, but all I know is that is was a strong ending to a Melancholy and Depressing story. The flawless callback to a small yet important scene makes the ending feel so much more impactful, and like a real climax to a sad story. And, the fact that who said what was switched; HE asked, and SHE didn't have an answer. Simply remarkable.

This game has a couple grammar errors, and I really wish the CGs existed, but I feel like they didn't want any colour in their story, unless it was important. That and the response MC made to the heartbreaking question needs to be fixed. Outside of that, there are no issues.

I don't cry. But this game made me cry. I'm welling up writing this, and it's been almost a year! This incredible game will leave you a changed person. I was going to give this a nine, but on second thought, I think it deserves better...

10/10, you won't be the same again...

author: {'steamid': '76561198398559052', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1663199154}
review:
游戏没有选择的余地，我认为这不是要让我们这种旁观者来替他们选择自己的人生，不管现实如此还是游戏如此。
以一己之私而让他人艰难的活下去，本身就是个自私的选择。
我只是一个旁观者，看着他们的平淡的却又特殊的一生，只觉得感到无尽的凄凉。

author: {'steamid': '76561198960398212', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1642906580}
review:
水仙系列的第一、二部合集，免费游玩非常良心，且有民间汉化补丁。两部适合一口气或者连续的读完，大概需要2小时左右。
第一部是同为7F安宁病房的男主阿东优和女主濑津美的故事；第二部剧情发生的时间在第一部之前，是姬子姐姐与濑津美的故事；前两部玩完还会解锁一个很短的第二部终章。两部作品之间有相当密切的承接联系，按顺序玩即可。
此外st还有一个非免费的十周年纪念合集，本体是上述内容（貌似多了些场景），还可以购买dlc以浏览各补充章节。水仙3有但st上没有。w
无集卡，有五个成就，看完有/无人声的第一、二部（可按ctrl快速跳过文本），看完第二部终章即可获得。

[b]这世间有石壁般凝固着的歌声。有比眼泪更多情理的佳酿。[/b]
[h1]亦有淡落从容的水仙，为另一个世界的故事寂寞绽放。[/h1]
心死人死，夫哀莫大，却若白驹过隙，忽然而已。
[spoiler]欢迎扩列[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198987102637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1625304122}
review:
我记得在5，6年前是就玩了手机版的，这次偶然在steam发现了这游戏，二话不说马上下载来玩。

我只能说，玩完了后，这游戏带给我的依然还是满满的空虚和惆怅感。它并非与其他的文字小说会有happy end，而是不断在游戏中灌输对这个世界的无奈、不公平、诅咒。虽然明白了濑津美的遭遇，但我还是忍不住想要说些什么正面的话，不过正如游戏里面说的一样，这些正面的话并不能有效地帮助她，反而好像是我逼迫她去那样想，这样的结果不是我想要的。

尽管如此，从这游戏中我还是学到了一件事，那就是陪伴。不论是游戏还是游戏的原型里，正是因为有了他人的陪伴，她们才能在这几乎绝望的世界中感受到一丝丝的温暖。与其和她们不断诉说世界有多好，不如珍惜和她们当下一起相处的时间，对我来说，更有意义。

author: {'steamid': '76561199048342733', 'num_games_owned': 3368, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1699075301}
review:
几年前有玩过ons版本，但也只是浅试，因为我觉得我的心理状态并不适合去尝试这个游戏……
今天在找游戏的时候才知道steam上有水仙，还是免费的，中文可以通过打补丁获取，另外的十周年版本有汉化进程，可具体进度不明，不排除因为变故放弃汉化计划的可能性（？）关键这个系列确实致郁……喜欢水仙的人一定会是感性的，对于翻译人员更是如此，在一遍遍的翻译润色中更容易落入抑郁的情境当中，真心对默默付出不求回报的汉化组们致上最崇高的敬意。

还是想在冬天的时候通，那种极寒刺骨的温度更能契合这部作品的氛围，也能更清醒的透过阴霾的表象去思考属于自己的人生观，价值观，和生死观。

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1624112073}
review:
Questa visual novel è composta da due giochi separati. Il primo è narcissu, ed è la storia di un ragazzo, il protagonista, che ha una brutta malattia che lo costringe a rimanere in ospedale. Qui incontra Setsumi, anch'essa con lo stesso destino del protagonista. Il protagonista decide di non aspettare in ospedale che arrivi la fine, perciò decide di prendere l'auto del padre e insieme alla ragazza, vanno in giro per le località giapponesi con l'obbiettivo secondario di trovare un campo di narcisi, i fiori preferiti dalla ragazza. I pregi di questa visual novel sono i disegni e le musiche, i difetti sono la lingua e il fatto che è più un libro che una vera visual novel, non ci sono scelte, dovete solo e continuamente cliccare con il pulsante del mouse per mandare avanti la storia. Oltre che, se avete il joypad attaccato, questo va in conflitto con il puntatore del mouse. Nel secondo gioco che è un prequel, impersonate la ragazza co-protagonista del primo titolo, un pò di anni prima degli eventi narrati precedentemente. Lei, mentre sta facendo una visita di controllo, incontra Himeko, e tra le due nasce una grande amicizia che viene raccontata in questo capitolo. Ma non solo le sole, conosceremo anche l'amica e la sorella minore di Himeko. Anche qui, ci sono gli stessi difetti e pregi del primo titolo.

Per finire. E' un buon titolo gratuito con ben due visual novel. Ma, se non capite un minimo di inglese è presso chè inutile farlo partire, anche se è gratuito. ^_^

P.s: Bellissima e malinconica la canzone finale del secondo epilogo del gioco. ^_^ Questo epilogo si sblocca una volta terminati entrambi i giochi. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198076879959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1588319352}
review:
很高兴我找到了一款令我青少年时期无法忘怀的一款游戏
遗憾的是，它免费了，我无法为它补票，最开始接触的时候是买的盗版盘时送的一个小游戏
当时连游戏名字都不记得了就进去玩了。以为是一款怎样有趣的游戏（并不了解文字冒险类游戏）
无尽的对话，最开始令我十分不爽（因为没玩过），但是看着看着就入迷了。记得那时候我的电脑没有网络，每天还需要就九点半上床睡觉，梦里都是他们的旅行过程。第二天放学迫不及待的继续他们的故事，因为玩电脑的时间有限，还是没有看到结局，后来真的按奈不住，半夜起来打开电脑，看着他们的故事走到了结尾。头一次为文字游戏落泪，头一次知道悲伤如此之痛苦。
小时候很喜欢rpg，很喜欢那时候的男欢女爱的隐涩情怀，但这个游戏真的直击我的心灵，那是一种难以言喻的感情，那种同病相怜的故事真的令我无法忘怀，我好想感同身受在其中，以至于我没有办法再去外第二次。那夜玩完这款游戏一夜未眠。
直至近13 14年后我在发现，又玩了一次还是久久无法平静。
最后希望大家依旧热爱这个世界，热爱自己。
有一点小小的可惜就是没有官方汉化，评论区里倒是有补丁链接，就不在复制了，推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198407256174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1645541806}
review:
[h1] 　　　　を失ってしまった人の物語[/h1]
私たちは当たり前のように日々を過ごしている。
目標を持っている、希望がある、夢がある。日々それを抱いている。
それに向かっていろいろ試して、あがいて立ち向かっていく。
もちろん努力や時間、お金もかかる。
でも本当は知らないうちに未来の一部を支払っているのだ。
損失がないから自覚がないだけでそこには必ず未来という、
本来の代価とは違ういわゆるゲームでいうところのスタミナのようなものも支払われている。
誰もが持っているはずのそれ、
この物語はそれをある日突如なくしてしまった。
人の物語である。

author: {'steamid': '76561197981124829', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1521729023}
review:
так вот, что я вам скажу, котяточки.
я взрослый (по крайней мере, по паспорту) серьёзный (иногда) мужик, и я буду рыдать над оригинальными "нарциссами" столько, сколько посчитаю необходимым.
огромное спасибо команде insani в целом и gp32 в частности и их соратнику Hæleth за перевод этого шедевра на ангельский. Agilis... не, ему не буду: у него перевод, на мой взгляд, не вышел.
минималистично оформленная кинетическая новелла с атмосфернейшей музыкой (жаль, аранжировка трека из Shuumatsu no Sugoshikata ~The World Is Drawing to an W/end.~ в OST не включена по правовым, вроде бы, причинам) и приятной озвучкой героини. история неизлечимо больных парня и девушки (по деталям можно предположить, что у них рак лёгких), решивших напоследок увидеть море нарциссов. очень трогательная и грустная вещь.
это было про оригинал.
Side 2nd - приквел, про который можно сказать всего два слова: "Слишком много".
слишком много повторов.
слишком много самоповторов.
слишком много слёз.
автор, на мой взгляд, перегнул палку.
кроме того, некоторые истории должны оставаться нерассказанными.
впрочем, всё равно палец вверх. как минимум - за первую часть. да и вторая, если рассматривать её в вакууме, не так уж и плоха.
со временем возьму платную сборку, хоть и слышал, что истории там слабее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198404841260', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1623705252}
review:
「未知生，焉知死」這是孔子的一句話。
被告知自己的生命在不久後就要結束，「死」期到了，要從這個世界消失，在這時候才能感受到何謂「生」嗎？
故事中的人物皆為沒有選擇的病人，她們正在最後的時光為「生」而掙扎，然後笑著離開，不帶遺憾，做不到的話至少也有去追尋。
那有選擇的我們呢？難道就倒過來：未知死，焉知生？
其實死亡離我們不遠，配合時事我這句根本就是廢話。我不知道多少人有想過自己活著到底是了甚麼，如果有想過而想不通的話，Narcissu１＋２值得你去仔細品味，去慢慢思考。沒想過的話，起碼不要留下太多遺憾，讓自己不明不白地活過這近有一次的人生吧？

既然我們是兩手空空來到這個世界去體驗人生，那請別忘記不要抱憾終生，要珍惜自己的時間，還有，照顧好自己的身體健康吧，
別讓自己只剩自宅和善終療養院這兩個地方回歸天空。

author: {'steamid': '76561198214175976', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1651028586}

author: {'steamid': '76561198419773684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1565865042}
review:
10/10 amazing and heartwrenching.❤
Made me cry. I wish I could buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070744330', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1648677015}
review: 《水仙》，外表朴素的精品，多少溢美之词用来称赞它都不为过，不过嘛本文不是来吹《水仙》的，而是用来弥补笔者遗憾的——我看了不少有关于《水仙》的杂谈文章和视频，但貌似都把生与死放在了对立面，在我看来《水仙》的故事不是关于两者的故事，生与死是补完这部作品的调味料，片冈真正想要重点刻画的笔者认为是将生与死联结起来的“传承”——明面上是第七楼的规则，在这之下是一种态度，说是渴求太过极端，说是希望又太过正面，不仅是因为游戏中的文字无时无刻不在体现着一种疏离感与冷漠感（还有我直接看的英文，更加剧了疏离感），还因片冈说过他只是将一个故事呈现在大家面前，并没有想要博得大家的眼泪，所以笔者在玩的时候总是意识到“我只是一个观察者”，姬子、濑津美、阿东优，他们只是存在于这个世界上的普通人而已。

author: {'steamid': '76561199010073946', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1691122697}
review:
哀而不伤，结束了之后只让人感到一种淡淡的空虚感
没有任何刻意煽情的语句，只是静静的看完几位花季少女走向注定的结局，平平淡淡却又引人深思
世界上只有一种英雄主义，就是在认清生活真相后依然热爱生活

author: {'steamid': '76561198409963879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1623071253}
review: 水仙二：与其说是讲了一个故事，不如说通篇更类似于叙事性散文。被疾病所注定的绝望与迷茫掩藏下在平淡的文字和零零碎碎的事件展开下。一种略带克制的惆怅贯穿整个游戏。这个故事不存在社会责任这类格局的命题或者批判，也不存在拼死挣扎顽强不屈的热血主题。希望从最开始就被磨灭在了时光中，这只是个被半切断社会联系的病人们被动选择生命中最后一点尊严和平静的故事。这个故事里对于个体情感的描绘比重很高，我个人感觉还是合情的。总的来说，哀而不伤，却又动人心魄。

author: {'steamid': '76561198805227152', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1622629869}
review: Понравилась новелла тем,что автор не просто давит на жалость тем,что герои умирают в конце, как в какой-нибудь To the Moon или "Виноваты звезды"(упс,спойлер),а раскрывает некую идею. Минималистичный стиль не слишком понравился,но зато проходится на одном дыхании. Рекомендую,если хотели небольшую,милую и трогательную историю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322949304', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 189880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1710773852}
review:
就这样，我们960km的旅途结束了。

对我来说是15天，对她来说则是22年的旅途结束了。

她以自己的意志逃出七楼与家的选择。

她的血型是O型，名字叫濑津美，22岁，女性……

塑料识别手环颜色是白色。

这就是属于她的一切。

……但是，我知道。

她其实很喜欢比基尼，比导航系统更加熟悉道路，睡相超差，喜欢车……

甚至拥有自己的驾照。

尽管总是面无表情，也很少会看我一眼。

但偶尔，也会露出那种好似害羞好似倔强的神色……

在翡翠色的大海前……

她会兴奋地，喜悦地，宛如偶像明星一般地对着我微笑.……

遗憾的是……她的笑容，却仅仅是被记录在了一张由一次性相机拍摄的照片中。

……但是，尽管是仅存的一张照片……

它也是我们留下的痕迹……

author: {'steamid': '76561199013328089', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1678341482}

author: {'steamid': '76561199000332928', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1625544250}
review:
推完了 1 非要打个比方的话 感觉这就是一杯咖啡 
入口微苦 过后却只记得那依稀的香味
最初就是男女主对死亡 这个沉重话题的讨论
在后面的剧情中却又让人渐渐遗忘 
直到她哭的那一刻 道一句 さよなら 才又回想起来 仿佛回到了那7 Floor 
但是这里却不是留下了悲伤 只有一份陪伴和一种超脱 就好像涟漪一样 有波动但是迅速消失不见
我看作者自己也有写 说也不是为了表达什么 
感觉这只是平淡地叙述着一个故事 
但正是这份平淡营造了一种无限接近现实的实感 感觉近在眼前却又那么遥远
                                                                                                                               它是一个带着悲伤的伪悲剧

author: {'steamid': '76561197969880352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 2050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2050, 'last_played': 1585634073}
review:
This is a super traditional visual novel. I was hoping for something more, but there isn't much here beyond reading. And if that's all it is then the writing better be worth it. But neither the composition nor the story is all that great, IMO.

Your time is probably better spent reading a book that's actually enjoyable or playing a game that's actually fun. Narcissu is free, so I probably shouldn't be complaining. But free doesn't mean good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180553653', 'num_games_owned': 1536, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1618148953}
review:
关于死亡，一直以来都算是我最为忌讳的事情。
因为在我的理解来说，死亡即是终结。或许从科学层面来说，这个世界是客观存在的，并不会因为你个体的存亡而产生根本性的变化。但是，对我们一个个个体来说，一切关于世界的感知，与人的羁绊，与事物的喜好，都只是因为我们活着而所能感觉到的东西。那么，这一切在我们个体消亡的时候，在大脑停止活动的时候，如果没有所谓的灵魂的存在继续保存我们的记忆与感知，那么，我们在生活中所得到的一切就会像是被风吹散的沙砾，不复存在，你生前的一切对于你来说都没有任何意义，因为，对你来说，一切都仿佛没有发生过。而所谓的你我，其实也如果没有存在过，因为我们不会再有任何的对于万物情感波动与记忆。
所以，我对与死这个字眼总是莫名的害怕。尤其在前年我的奶奶离世过后，当我从无数的记忆中回忆起，却无法再从现实中找到那么一个与之对应得人得时候，我对死亡的抗拒更加加深了。
而对于濑津美等人的偶遇，我很难产生一种共情感，因为，我对于他们的处境是处于一个绝对禁忌的状态。但是当濑津美走进大海的时候，我却是能够感到一种释怀。或许我是明白了我如今挣扎的无意义，或许我也从中得到了某种神秘的答案，只是现在的我无法解读。
希望有那么一天，我能彻底理解”人啊，遇到难以接受的事实的时候，也许连自己本身的事情也能客观来看待也说不一定“这句话吧，到那时，或许我也能够得到我想要得答案了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199032082421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1620615160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146245872', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1620553003}
review:
《水仙1-2》所讲述的是两段深刻又无能为力的故事。
在被告知自己生命只剩这最后一刻，我们想做的是什么？
亦或是等待自己即将迎来的命运，亦或是到某个地方去，亦或是.....祈祷
水仙的花语“珍爱自己”，如果有自己想做的事情，那就去实现吧。
窗前的水仙花，依旧随着风摇摆，可欣赏它的人，已经去了远方。
这是一款好游戏，希望大家能够去玩一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198798300799', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1619643608}
review:
死亡与宿命不可以被战胜
但是人们一定要去反抗自己的命运？
生活充满了绝望和悲伤
当一开始就放弃的时候
就再也不会痛苦
但是为什么不尝试一下呢？
说的很美好，但我也大概做不到吧
生命到底是什么？
也许不能战胜这一切的话
那就面对着就好了
内心虽然痛苦
但是这些都是要终面对的
痛苦永远是得到了再失去来的更加直接
绝望是在希望之后才能感受的到
这也许就是一种淡淡的悲伤吧
没有什么逻辑，纯个人感想，想到哪写到哪
因为我对原本没有期待，所以也就不会感受到痛苦
但是有了目标之后，就能够为了目标而行动

author: {'steamid': '76561199022463681', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1619758405}

author: {'steamid': '76561198969666504', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1654231170}
review:
首先，从名字就能看出来：
这部Narcissu 1st &2nd是两部游戏的合集。
但实际上我现在的3小时游戏时长是只玩过第一部的时长。
不得不说的是，只是推完这一部我就已经产生了想要写评测的念头。

然后，这是一部气氛的渲染非常优秀的AVG，原谅我第一次并没有一口气推完以至于浪费了大量的时间。
实际上第一部的通关时间完全不需要两个小时，我这次一口气推完只花费了70分钟。
可能是这一次完全静下心来了，我完全没感觉这70分钟的漫长，反而感到意犹未尽。

steam的评测只让我评测推荐或者不推荐，实际上要我打分的话，满分100分，这部Narcissu可以打到85分以上。
不管是文本，还是音乐都是值得我去反复欣赏的。
以个人观念来看，音乐撑起了这部游戏的半边天。也因为这个原因，游戏的气氛渲染十分到位。
这部游戏的音乐让我理解了人物的内心世界，了解了作者想要表达的到底是什么。
我并不能做出非常专业的评价，但我很愿意将这部游戏精心渲染出来的气氛称为这部游戏的核心、灵魂。
如果不是因为这个，单凭游戏的文本我极有可能推不下去，就像我第一次尝试Narcissu一样，两个小时全都像打了水漂一样。
这真的是一部优秀的作品，但是需要沉下心来细心感受。

刚才也说了，我并不能作出很专业的评测，但是我能记录下我玩完这部游戏之后即时的感受。
这或许也是这部评测唯一的意义吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198267348529', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1561628367}
review:
有些东西，不同的时间来看，会有不同的感觉。
到也确实，时间一长，回顾过去的片子，常常有这种感觉。

这部作品如何评价呢？
要是另辟蹊径，与众不同，特立独行的来讲的话。
我就说：“ 这玩意儿就是一个 ‘ 电子海洛因 ’ ” 。当然，要加引号。

Why？ 因为现实不会这么美好。什么意思呢。
就是不会像作品所传达出来的那种感情，那种思想，那种世界观。
这类作品拿来逃避现实倒是最好不过，我不听我不听。
但最终还是要面对可悲的现实。也没办法的事情。

不过毕竟是 “ 电子 ”，也不过是虚拟罢了 。

也罢，去掉这层特立独行，
这部作品也算是中规中矩吧，不错的一个故事。
所以我推荐吗？当然是的，顺带一提，我喜欢那首歌《ここにいる》，至于为什么喜欢嘛，推荐听一听。

author: {'steamid': '76561198168805186', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1658942246}
review:
我们有地图，酷派，药，但是我们没有时间，没有未来。
我们可以祈祷，然而不存在奇迹，或许离天空太远，神明无法回应，或许只是报应，是主对我们罪孽的惩罚。
面对生而被判不知执行期的死刑，我们可以祈祷，可以诅咒，可以对一切不报以期待，但对死亡这一结果，我们无能为力。
我们唯一能做的，不过是逃离家和7F，选择水仙花盛开的海滩，为自己行刑。
连同22年来，不断经验所累积的虚假的知识，陌生到熟悉到陌生的故人的回忆，15岁那年无可改变的回答，对所有给予和接受爱的人的温柔和谎言，一切的一切，在我们死亡的那一刻，随着自我存在的消解没有了任何意义，仅有部分存在的碎片，寄托在他人的存在之中，仍温暖和刺痛着，无法消解。

author: {'steamid': '76561198136155660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1618148801}
review:
Na początku trzeba zaznaczyć że Narcissu bardziej przypomina książkę niż typową grę. Jest to po prostu opowieść, z fantastyczną muzyką oraz ładnymi ilustracjami, bez podejmowania wyborów lub ścieżek fabuły. Nasza rola sprowadza się do przewijania linijek tekstu.
Czy to oznacza, że ta powieść wizualna nie jest warta uwagi? Absolutnie nie!
Siłą tej produkcji jest bardzo dobrej jakości historia, podzielona na dwie części, a każda z osobna dostarcza nam niesamowitych emocji które mogą doprowadzić do łez. Zdecydowanie nie żałuję ani minuty spędzonej z tym tytułem, a jeśli lubisz wartościowe i pouczające opowieści które mogą wzruszyć, to jest to dla Ciebie.
Podsumowując uważam że każdy powinien spróbować przeczytać tą opowieść, szczególnie że jest za darmo, więc jedyne co musisz poświęcić to swój czas. (przejście dwóch części powinno zająć około 4-5 godzin)
Warto zaznaczyć że istnieje również spolszczenie, słowa podziękowania w stronę Polish Route!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1617557665}
review:
OMFG, 4h+ of pure NOTHINGNESS. The whole game could be summarized in a page and a half, yet the authors felt the need to loop conversations with slight modifications for OVER 4h!!!! I'm not talking about 4h of character development, with some plot twist, some revelation, some moral of the story at the end. It is not that. It is 4h of nothing happening for the sole purpose of nothing happening. 

- four hours, you said?
- yes...
- uhm...
- four hours...
- who'd have thought uh?
- hm
- do you like hours?
- not really
- what about minutes?
* the girl stares through the window *
- hm?
- I don't know if I like minutes
- I like minutes
- hm
- you wanna hear why I like minutes?
- not really?
* the boy sinks his head *
- I like minutes because they make up hours
- hm...
- and I like hours
- oh...
- but my favourite are days
- I see
- because days make weeks, months, years
* the girl gets sad *
- what is wrong?
- nothing
- I will take you to a clock museum, maybe that'll cheer you up
- okay
- do you wanna come?
- not really...

Linux port was flawless, achievements are redundant but okay. The only good thing about this "game" is me removing it from my "to play" list once and for all. I recommend it only to my worst enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333338660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1617635579}
review:
很久很久大概是7-8年前玩过了，当时接触的原因还是一首歌，因为它的旋律太抑郁了，听的我这个人都抑郁了，就好奇查了下，一进贴吧时候就被全剧透了!
剧透我倒是不怕，因为相当于预防针。
然后听说故事是基于真实的事件改的我更好奇玩了下。
只能说这样的悲剧每天都在上演，只是我们没身在其中而已。
这游戏对我有用的是活着比什么都好，我曾经被搞残了健康，那段日子简直痛苦，只能说好好珍惜你身边人，也许某一天它可能会永远消失在这世界上，在名为地球OL的游戏上。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009356603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1619018963}
review:
I completely agree with the other popular negative review on here. This VN is a grind. It's so hard to get into because the girl is so depressed that she doesn't say much, doesn't really do much, and is constantly gloomy.  It becomes unbelievable that her companion is constantly shrimping over her.  Why? She wouldn't even look at him in their first few encounters and then he decides to [spoiler]run off [/spoiler]with this gloomy child of doom. Realistically, if someone doesn't even look at you when you talk to them, you would probably stop talking to them. But no, his mission becomes trying to please the deep gloomy void while trying to figure her out. She depressed bruh, it doesn't take 8 chapters to figure that out.  

Thumbs down, feels like dragging a dead body across a desert.

edit: 1st visual novel so I wanted to keep going. Part 2 is better than part 1; however, I felt it was way too long. It's pretty much double the length of 1.

review: It's been a really long time since I've completed this hidden gem. An unforgettable story to look back into after going through suffering in this cruel world. We probably don't think much of our lives or maybe even think that we are worthless... but please remember that many other people out there are living lives filled with suffering greater than ours and that is why we should never let our life go to waste - live on, fight with your everything to oppose this world's darkness, and become the change that you wish to see in this world: a beacon of hope for those who have fallen to despair.

author: {'steamid': '76561199068739556', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1614996096}
review:
▽実績コンプ時間
約4時間
▽得点評価
70/100

[hr][h1]総評[/h1][/hr]
選択肢の無い一本道のストーリー、題材がホスピスに入れられ死を待つしかない患者たちの死生観を描いたものになっています。パッケージやCGからは萌えゲー的な雰囲気がありますが、主人公がすごい持てたり大どんでん返しが有るわけでもなく迎える結末は一つしかありません。
リリースが2005年ということもあり、ゲームを構成するUIやゲーム本編に登場する用語等は古臭いです。
文字化けする漢字等もありますが、文脈から大体察することができるのでそれほど気になることはありません。

1stが1時間。2ndが2.5時間ほどでしたが、どちらも良くできたストーリーだとは思いますが、心境ゆえかヒロインの子が少し冷たい印象を持たれるかもしれません。2ndは特に残す者と残される者の心情をよく表しています。
ストーリーの構成上キャラクターに感情移入はしづらいと思います

[hr][h1]実績[/h1][/hr]
ボイスありとボイスなしで4つで後日譚で１つです。
最後のエピソードから再生すれば残り反対側の実績も獲得できるので4周する必要はありません。

[hr][h1]値段[/h1][/hr]
無料でこのボリュームのゲームなので言うことはありません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198064553521', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1615026179}
review:
Симулятор умирающего куколда
Главная проблема новеллы в том, что протагониста нельзя назвать персонажем -- он просто функция, которая служит для иллюстрации Загадочности главной героини. Психическая одеревенелость ГГ настолько сильно бьет по нарративу и стилю, что читать дольше 40 минут про этого человека-функцию невозможно. 
ГГ после череды навязчивых (с его стороны) попыток заговорить с главной героиней, продолжает проглатывать односложные ответы в стиле "бецуни", и никаким образом не развивается. У него нет своих мыслей, его прошлое накидано схематично, да и то, по сути, только для того, чтобы можно было смутно представить, что он человек. Притом, этот приемчик не работает на "более глубокую идентификацию" читателя с персонажем(если так задумывалось), а наоборот нагнетает отчуждение, так как новелла Кинетическая. В итоге, приходится прокликивать унылые мысли бревна, который не думает почти ни о чем кроме полузнакомой девушки, которая совершенно не хочет с ним общаться. Притом, думает о ней гг даже не в любовном смысле, а просто так. 
Просто без этого исчезло бы ощущение "необыкновенности" происходящего. И наружу бы вышли простые люди со своими страданиями и жизненными неурядицами. Может быть, новелла не позиционировала себя как более или менее психологически достоверный текст, возможно, будет более уместна поэтическая интерпретация, однако, если это так, то ценность новеллы падает еще ниже, так как вся поэтичность здесь строится на плохо построенной главной героине, которая может вызвать очень слабый художественный интерес. В пользу психологической трактовки говорят скромный визуал и сносная драматичная музычка, без мистических изысков. Но как ни крути, новелла вышла посредственная.
При всем этом, новелла могла бы стать лучше, если бы гг в принципе вырезали из повествования, оставив только героиню. Можно было бы раскрыть ее душевные переживания напрямую, даже такое грубое решение сыграло бы новелле в плюс. Вообще можно было придумать миллион вариаций для хорошего сюжета, так как выбранный сеттинг позволил бы закрутить тяжелейшую драму. Однако у авторов был другой взгляд. Ну и бог с ними

author: {'steamid': '76561198300707845', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1614952900}
review:
假如从一开始就放弃了希望，自然也不会有任何的失望。
 消极的人生的确不会快乐，但同样也不会痛苦。
从开篇，都能感受到扑面而来的无力感，面对既定命运无可奈何的哀伤
明明仅仅只是平淡的讲述着故事而已
最初的也是最后的旅途，对世界最初的也是最后的反抗
浪漫而凄凉
即使命运将她的人生破坏的一塌糊涂，即使没有了未来，
她最终至少还能选择自己如何凋零
哪怕是含着眼泪

而我什么也做不了
只能平静的见证她最后的绽放
亦最后的凋零
默默为生命的逝去而流泪
濑津美，愿你来生健康而幸福
我只能如此祈祷

author: {'steamid': '76561198182878878', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1705219792}
review: 这三五个小时的故事能讲个啥？能讲四代病人的三次传承，能讲面对注定悲剧的故事，能讲普通人可能永远没有的生死思考。

author: {'steamid': '76561198247879232', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1614521857}
review:
[h1] 一段灿烂的回忆...一个冬日的故事... [/h1]

[i]『那么...你又怎么样呢？』
『...我？』
『嗯，你哭过吗？诅咒过自己的命运吗？』
『...............』
『...我平静的接受了一切』
『...为什么？』
『...因为我从一开始，就从没有抱过任何希望...』
『...因为我放弃了一切』
『是吗...』
假如从一开始就放弃了希望，自然也不会有任何的失望。
消极的人生的确不会快乐，但同样也不会痛苦。[/i]

review: More of a book and less of a game, Narcissu is an excellent work. However with its very dark tones and plot, i found it in the sort of category that I cant recommend to everyone, you should be wary if you get very emotional from empathy with characters and cant get to the happy part. But to everyone else this is an amazing book.

review: 人有无数种可能性，但其中大部分都是被个人的个性所支配的。所以人一般都会选择相同的选项。然而，当千百遍地重复着同一个情景时，从概率上来说也有采取极端反常行动的可能吧。我是这么想的。我试图采取极端反常行动

author: {'steamid': '76561198845488966', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1708957880}
review:
唉，貌似是一年前玩完的，一些图片现在还是我的qq资料背景图，真是凄美的故事啊，生命在得知快要失去之时可能才会觉得珍贵。（下面字密密麻麻一团还请见谅，觉得麻烦就随意略过吧~~）


过于沉重的话题，哪怕是一段时间内只玩一小节都能让自己冷静并沉默许久，故事结局之后也久久不能释怀，所以只能靠时间来冲淡回忆从而忘记故事的内容，如果是在日常中充满了过多的喧闹和静不下来的心，不妨试试这个故事吧，哪怕像是在利用工具来“自律”一样，无论对你还是对更深刻的理解这个故事都有帮助，好的故事或许能够洗涤人的心灵，至少它让我看到了，这吵闹的人世有哪些是真的值得去做、去珍惜、去体会的，希望每个想要活着的人都能够少一些迷茫于这世间，能够不断地走下去。


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

说个有些巧合的事，小时候在意林一本儿童文学杂志上看到了一个插图，让我很是喜欢，背景是城市大桥边樱花树下身着粉色上衣、裙子的黑色长发女孩，很让我心动和喜欢，那本书可能现在还在我家中，但我着实是找不到了，曾经也在网上偶然见到了有人用那个图片中的女孩做头像，也没有刻意保存，但女孩的形象一直存在我的脑海当中，小时候一个人无聊也有过许多幻想，也一直把那个女孩看作自己很重要的人（甚至是第一个重要的人），后网上见过高清大图之后可能也忘记存了，基友也用过这个女孩作为头像，但我知道，无论那个图片有没有存下来，那个女孩都已经活在我的心中了，直到后来，玩了本作，觉得女主甚是忧美，看到了社区内容中的几张图，好奇着去搜索引擎搜了Narcissu，发现了一个东西，不由得愣住了，感觉一切都变得很奇妙了，我儿时看到的那张图片正是这款游戏的女主 濑津美 的同人图（应该是），尽管有些差别，但还是让我感慨万分，这部作品也间接的连接了我人生的两个性格近乎完全不同的时间点，就个人而言，这部作品还是很重要的，有时也不由得感叹，自己的直觉真好，但自己总是不相信一开始的直觉，反而变相走了许多弯路，最后又回到起点重新开始，十周年版本，我也会找一个机会欣赏下去的。
图片链接是这个，左上角的标签是Narcissu https://cn.bing.com/images/search?view=detailV2&ccid=OS%2fuCN7u&id=ED0C0DBD31046EDE6F2ACA97B6EA5558D252B182&thid=OIP.OS_uCN7uI3faGGvbLmxCNwHaEu&mediaurl=https%3a%2f%2fwallup.net%2fwp-content%2fuploads%2f2016%2f05%2f14%2f33522-Narcissu-manga-anime-anime_girls.jpg&cdnurl=https%3a%2f%2fth.bing.com%2fth%2fid%2fR392fee08deee2377da186bdb2e6c4237%3frik%3dgrFS0lhV6raXyg%26pid%3dImgRaw&exph=2230&expw=3500&q=narcissu&simid=608013004441325042&ck=B889E17B8419904DFDF65C0CF586B166&selectedIndex=89&FORM=IRPRST&ajaxhist=0
实际上用bing搜索引擎搜Narcissu就可以在图片选项里找到这张图片了

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

（一些奇怪的话）
如果有可怜的人存在着，无论是否知晓其存在，我都将牢牢记住他们并时不时怀念着，即使可能无法传送到这份思念，我也会默默为他们祈福，“自欺欺人”地安慰着这那些可能永远都无法相互知晓的人们，无论他们有多么孤独，我都想告诉世人，我会永远记得他们，我希望能给除我以外的所有人在绝望之时带来一丝安慰，尽管这可悲的泛爱亏待了他们，但我还是会继续这样做下去，愿人类能够真正幸福着。

author: {'steamid': '76561199016429499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1613750270}
review:
It´s a really, really wonderful visual novel, that deals with themes such as death, illness and friendship. I simply can not express in words how much I love this game. 
You don´t have any decisions to make, so it´s just reading text all the time, but both of the stories are really touching, well written and emotional (even though I gotta admit I slightly prefer the first one). There might be not that much artwork, but I personally like it that way and the pictures that you get to see are well drawn and aesthetically pleasing. And the soundtrack is just wonderful... Immediately fell in love with it.
The characters are charming and I felt really bad for them sometimes. 
This game will make you cry probably. But please give it a chance and play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116696941', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1613594842}
review:
В начале, я действительно ожидал супер-поворотов, множество персонажей, но, шло лишь [u]спокойное повествование[/u]. Даже когда они [spoiler]убегали из больницы[/spoiler], повествование оставалось тихим и неспешным. И так до конца.
На самом деле, новелла этим и чудесна. Чтобы не происходило - оно происходило умеренно, неспеша, словно убаюкивая, рассказывая сказку. Грустную. Реальную.
В конце, когда вроде бы надо рыдать в три ручья, мне было просто грустно и...спокойно. Персонажи сделали то, что хотели. Они смогли насытиться последними днями.
Это прекрасно, как по мне.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821623833', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1691329502}
review:
玩的网上民间汉化的版本，过来补个好评。
虽然是很多年前的老作品了，但跟现在的作品比它的剧情和音乐依然算是十分优秀。
短小而精致，让人能感受到淡淡的忧伤。
其实还有3，感兴趣的可以去网上下载。
虽然1的开端的日本大量的人无法接受心理压力而自杀而想到去写这个故事，
但后面的作品更充分的对设定进行了补充和人物心理和现实客观的描写，
而3更充分的写明了在那个年代7楼的“安抚医疗”的状况。
因为缺乏医疗手段而得不到医疗的病人们，医生的视角，病人的想法。
比起直面死亡，我觉得更多的是对生命的珍惜。
“让留下来的人，笑着生活吧。”

author: {'steamid': '76561198272596054', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1611654063}
review: I like it

author: {'steamid': '76561198165593933', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1613372290}
review:
...让留下来的人...笑着活下去...
假如生命自始至终都要面对无法触及的愿望，假如向神明祈祷也仅仅会带来内心的罪恶感，这个过程也依然值得去经历吧？

从《泡沫冬景》跑过来的，感触相当之多，不得不说片冈智老师太棒啦！
难得有作品能将“生死观”作为主题，相当的致郁，本系列两部作品都相当优秀也各具风格，配音和音乐是大加分项！
1st，绝望虚无的氛围相当之重，文风是一大特色，更多的是感性表达。
2nd，没有前作那么虚无，文风比较常规化，对宗教、多个人物的刻画，对现实进行了理性的探讨。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198349211258', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1646666395}
review:
能接觸到水仙這部作品完全是因為以前Google Play上架商品還不受限制盜版遊戲氾濫的關係，因緣之下看到了手機板低配水仙，便下載了下來，就算低配的配樂從頭到尾僅只用了7樓的BGM，文字的敘述仍令我欲罷不能深入其中，帶入感十分強烈。今天成功找到漢化重新體驗這個遊戲，再次讓我想起了當初結局帶來的感動。

兩人的旅程雖然短暫但早已刻印玩家心中，結尾結的實在非常漂亮。雖然短，但在心目中還是保有非常前面的位置。

非常推薦可以購入小說，雖然已經絕版，但還有不少二手，補足了非常多遊戲內沒帶到的細節故事，讓整個故事可以更完整，非常推薦入手，尤其封面實在是太好看了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199085857048', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1612317841}
review:
Soul-moving novel about illness, life and death. 
There's no comedy and no romance here (although there's character bonding).

You should know: the 2nd part is actually a prequel to the 1st. The author suggests reading them in reverse. 

This is more a text-based novel than a visual novel. Get it if you actually like to read. 
It uses minimalist atmospheric images, optional voice acting and leaves the rest to your imagination.

The music is very good and emotional.
It's mostly piano tracks, but some compositions have vocals and are fully orchestrated.

It touches spiritual/religious themes such as theological doubts and the loss of faith, so beware of this in case you're sensitive.

If you ask me 1 word to describe Narcissu I choose "tragic". 
YOU WILL CRY if you are able to immerse yourself in the story.

The word "narcissu" refers to a kind of flower that Setsumi -the charming girl you see in the cover- likes, as it reminds her of Himeko, a very important person in her life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106908042', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1612982559}

author: {'steamid': '76561198360391528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1612597220}
review: 推完了，日语不是很难，跟平常的gal不一样不必说，就是偶尔搞不清视角谁是谁，好在没有造成太大影响，总体来说讲了一个少见并不错的故事，可以让人有所体会，引起思考。文字与美术音乐组成在一起具有别样的美感，结局突如其来的结束给观众带来的涨然若失 与 尾声男主回到7楼连接两部的故事令人意犹未尽， 。

author: {'steamid': '76561198142170883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1611033905}
review:
(Narcissu covers sensitive topics which might not be suitable for everyone, so be advised)
Absolutely amazing visual novel. The stories are so well written and manage to address sensitive topics in such a fluid and emotional way. The characters feel so genuine and it's so easy to get attached to them. The music and artwork truly tie everything together. Take your time with the story and play with the music on, it makes the experience all the better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198982455097', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 10091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1613356471}
review:
第一章。7F。

7楼是这所医院之中，
唯一一处不进行治疗活动的地方。
这里只是等待生命燃尽的地方。

即便如此，也不是让病人到死为止都要一直留在7楼。
尽管无法医治的结果不会变，
但状态较好的时候，也会让病人们回到家里去。
不过，当病情恶化时，又要再次回到这里来。
...就是在这样的来来回回中等待着死亡。
或者是在家中...或者是在7楼...
二者之中，一定会在其中一处迎来死亡。
没有谁能够逃脱这种命运。

「第3次暂时出院的时候，就做好心理准备吧。
不会再有第4次了，已经无法再回到家里去了。」


『啊...可以叫你濑津美吧？』
「......」
『你怎么了？濑津美？』
「...为什么要直呼我的名字？」
『啊？』
「你明明比我年纪小...」


「呐，你愿意选择哪一边？」
『选择什么？...』
「...会选择在哪一边死去？」
『......』
突然听到“死”这个词，
我不由地搪塞了起来。
『我也不知道...还从来没想过这个。』
「...是啊...你还只是第1次哪。」


「...Narcissus...」
「这种花叫做Narcissus...」
说着...她第一次转过头来面对着我。
她摇动着齐腰的长发...
指着电视上的花朵，凝视着我。
卷在手腕上的白色塑料手环，映衬着她雪白的肌肤，
如同画面中的花朵一般。
从她那第一次凝视着我的表情中...
我似乎看到了一丝淡淡的微笑。


第2章。银色的酷派。

濑津美：
「...我的时间静止了...」
在这个只看得到自己的世界里...
我送走了不知多少个季节...多少次下着梅雨的苍白天空...
...在空想中寻求着安乐...
只有庞大的知识积累在头脑中...
它们罗列在一起，构筑起了毫无意义的价值观...
「冰冻住时间，冰冻住内心，在心口留下巨大的伤痕...」
「但即使如此...我依然痛感到自己这22年的人生是如此可悲...」


午前，万里无云。
透过挡风玻璃，我凝视着一月的霜空。
不知为何，我从那片湛蓝中感到了一丝忧伤。
...我们并没有明确的目的地。
那一天，车身在寒空下跟随着离合器不断颤抖。
那一天，我们身穿睡衣，驱车向国道驶去。
...那一天，一切都融入了冬日的气息中...


『那么，这里的...也与电视里那种不同吗？』
「...恩，严格说起来不是同一种。」
『是吗？这么说来它还真是种少见的花啊...』
「不...在哪里都有可能找到的。」
『那么在哪里才能找到啊？』
「......」
「...西边.....」
『西边？』
「淡路岛...是以它闻名的...」

 

第3章。地图。

濑津美：
「我的时间停止了。」
只是不断积累着知识，构筑起毫无意义的价值观，
只是试图从屏幕中寻求各种资讯...
在不知不觉中失去了现实感，成为了虚无的存在。
「但是，我喜欢可那地图...」
我喜欢那些能够把我带到远方去的汽车和列车。
在窄小的床上展开地图...
在无数的线路间一次又一次地换乘...
赛旦、酷派、康博芝布...
也曾经乘坐过各色各样的汽车。
...在看不到尽头的1号公路上，
我不停地、不停地驾车飞驰着。
湛蓝色的天空与迷人的海岸线。
我在这如梦境般的背景下飞驰着...
绕过弧线优美的海崖...
在烈日的照耀下，驰骋在雪白的沙滩旁。
...只要闭上双眼，我就可以漫步到任何地方去。
幻想着从未见过的景色，
幻想着我绝对不会踏上的土地...
「只是不断积累着毫无意义的知识...」
「...在虚无中，不断地汇聚着自己的憧憬...」

 

冰冷的风吹在海滨与夜空之间。
我们走出车外，注视着黯淡的大海。
她依然面无表情地注视着远方。
漆黑的海水与天空，在视线尽头融为一体。
在凝视了片刻后...
她慢慢地向海水走去。
「呐...你认为会怎样呢？」
『...我也不明白你在问什么啊。』
「......」
「...假如就这样走进大海的话...会轻松地死掉吗？」
她背对着我...
一边缓慢地走向大海，一边向我问道。
...第3次将会是最后一次。不会再有第4次了。
只能从7楼与家里两个地方选择其一。
至今为止还没有任何人逃脱过这种命运。
这是她曾告知我的。
并且，她已迎来了第2次，还说过既不喜欢7楼也不喜欢自己的家。

「那么...假如我现在走进海里去的话...」
「你会...拉住我吗？」

『...你希望我拉住你吗？』
听到我的话，她在距离海浪几步远的位置站住了。
强风卷起雾状的水花，拍打在她的脚上。
『如果你希望我拉住你的话，我就会拉住你。』

 

第4章。翡翠色的大海。

濑津美：
「冰冻住时间，冰冻住内心...」
「每一天，都在脑海中罗列着空虚的资讯...」
每一天，都要摊开地图，然后闭上双眼，
就这样神游在未知的城镇间...
有一天。
那是一本我每月都会购买的月刊。
封面上的那张偶像照片深深吸引住了我的视线。
那是一个身穿漂亮泳装的女模特。
她正在沙滩上摆着诱人的造型。
站在我所憧憬的，翡翠色的大海前，
迷人地微笑着。
...我想，她的年纪一定与我差不多吧...
她展示着优美的体形，
开心地对我微笑着。
...我并没有嫉妒她。
何况，我既没有泳装，
也没有必要去拥有一套泳装。
...我只要有一件睡衣就足够了。
「在这个只看得到自己的世界里...
我送走了不知多少个季节...
多少次下着梅雨的苍白天空...」

 

第5章。一号公路。

濑津美：
我有泳装，也有地图。
但是，我却没有未来。
世界的的确确就存在于窗外。
但却找不到能够切身体会的“现实”。
尽管闭上双眼，我就能置身于虚构的世界中。
但是，这并不意味着身边的世界会就此消失。
我心里很清楚这一切。
我明白，空想中的世界将伴随着自己度过终生。
「为什么...就不能让我自由地选择一次呢...」
在低声呐喊的瞬间，我感到冰冻的时间似乎在颤动。
在早已冰冻的内心中，我感到了一丝痛苦...

 

她一次次地拿起各种服装，
一次次地查看着标价牌。
每一次试穿后，都会跑到我的身边来...
「...怎么样？」
『很合身的嘛。』
「...看上去不奇怪吗？」
『恩，感觉挺好的。』
每次试穿后，
我们都会重复一次这样的会话。
尽管她没有笑，也绝对不会将心情显露在脸上，
但看得出来，她一定是很兴奋的。


往常，她总是会静静地注视着窗外。
但今天，她却一次又一次，高兴地注视着自己映射在反光镜中的身影。
时而也会偷偷地观察我的目光。
「...怎么了？」
『没什么，你看上去好象很喜欢这身衣服啊。』
「......」
「不...没有的事啦。」
说完，她将视线从反光镜上移开了。
但没过多久，
她便再次开始偷偷地照起了镜子。
...原来，她也有可爱的一面啊...


假如从一开始就放弃了希望，自然也不会有任何的失望。
消极的人生的确不会快乐，但同样也不会痛苦。
但是，我感到这种想法本身就非常的悲哀。
还是说，对她而言...
已经没有其他的选择余地了吗...

「从前看过的一部电影中说过...」
「狼只能活3年」
「但是...驴却可以活9年。」
「听说，驴之所以会活得更久」
「是因为人们需要它...」
她凝视着窗外。
这就是她...为了让自己接受一切，
为了让自己放弃一切...
而编织出来的理由吗...

 

第6章。艾歌。

『女朋友...吗？』
『好象被他们误会了哪。』
「......」
『莫非，我们看起来真的很像情侣吗？』
「......」
我有些半开玩笑地说道。
因为感到很开心，
便继续这样说了下去。
『呐，你认为...啊，不...』
『呐，濑津美，你认为呢？』
「......」
「...什么嘛...你明明比我年纪小...」
但她没有搭理我的话，
还是在静静地凝视着窗外。
丝毫也没有转头看我一眼的意思。
但是...
我想，她并不是在眺望着远方，
而是在遮掩着自己的害羞。


第7章。那耳喀索斯。（Narcissus）

『...你冷吗？』
「...恩。」
『那就再靠近一些吧。』
「诶？...」
『别在意，到这边来吧。』
看到她在助手席上发抖，
我指了指自己的膝盖。
『这样肯定会比较暖和的。』
「......」
「不必了...我没事的。」
尽管嘴上这样说，但她却仍然在打着哆嗦。
呼出的白雾，说明她显然是在逞强。
「...莫非，你是因为冷才希望我过去的吗？」
『恩...哦，就算是那样吧。』
「......」
「那么，好吧...」
她慢慢地挪了过来，
犹犹豫豫地趴在了我的膝上。


「那耳喀索斯是一位被万人追求的美少年...」
「妖精艾歌也是他的追求者之一。」
「但是，艾歌只能重复与对方相同的话语...」
「所以...假如那耳喀索斯不对自己说出“我爱你”的话」
「艾歌就永远无法传达自己的爱意...」
「但是...那是绝对不可能的。」
「无论怎样幻想，怎样憧憬，艾歌的心愿绝对不可能会实现...」
「最后，她对那耳喀索斯施下了诅咒」
『...就是那个有名的，爱上自己映在泉水中的倒影的诅咒吗？』
「那耳喀索斯不眠不休地凝视着自己的倒影...」
「就这样，化成了美丽的花朵。」
「这种花的名字...那耳喀索斯就是这样诞生的。“
『那么艾歌又怎么样了呢？』
「已经不在了...在施下诅咒的那一刻，她就消失了。」

 


濑津美：
「...究竟是从何时开始，我变得如此孤独了呢...」
「尽管闭上双眼，身边的世界也不会就此消失...」
即使堵住耳朵，雨声也不会停止。
我心里很清楚这一切。
无论是比基尼泳装，翡翠色的大海，
还是满脸微笑的偶像封面...
...都不会使我感到嫉妒。
在闭上双眼的世界中，
即使没有车和地图，我同样可以漫步于任何城镇。
即使没有心口的伤痕在时刻提醒着我，
即使这世界就是那耳喀索斯的化身，而我则扮演着艾歌...
「...即使如此，我也不会去憧憬他...更不会去诅咒他...」
我本已选择了这条道路...
但现在...
我的心却动摇了。
冰冻的时间再次开始了跃动。
可现在，即使这样去做，
所有的一切也都即将结束了...
「伤口...
越是深，越是重，
愈合所需的时间也就会越久...」
「那么，长久以来慢慢分开的东西，是否就再也无法复原了呢？」
「那样的话，已经活了22年的我，究竟又会如何呢...」

 

「...我又怎么可能变得积极呢...」
「对事物充满憧憬，努力地追求，
  假如心愿真的能够实现，当然很好...」
「但是，假如无法实现的话，又该如何呢？」
「我根本没有那么坚强，
  能够微笑着安慰自己...」
「我所能做的，
  只有从一开始就放弃一切，不去追求任何事物...」
「我只能告诫自己，这是不可能的，
  只能够以冷漠的眼光来旁观着自己啊...」
...她第一次哭泣了。

「我只能对自己说...
  假如那个时候试着去追求过...或许就会有不同的结果...」
「只能将这些作为对自己最后的安慰啊...」
「因为我从一开始就明白一切都是不可能实现的...」
「所以...我只能选择这样做啊...」
玻璃的另一侧是无尽的夜空。
在这黎明前的时刻，连月亮也不见了踪影。
只能听到远处的海潮声，
和她低沉的哭泣声。
...或许，她的境遇正如同艾歌一样吧。
只能够重复与他人相同的话语。
自己却什么也无法倾诉，什么也无法追求，什么也不会关心...
...她所能做的，只有放弃。
对她来说，拒绝从7楼和自己的家中进行选择...
或许..这就是最初也是最后的反抗吧...

 

第8章。白石建筑公司。

『我再提最后一个要求...』
『...笑一笑...』
『...笑一笑吧，濑津美...』
「......」
「...什么嘛......你明明比我年纪小...」
...说着...她第一次对着我笑了。
她穿着心爱的裙子，
与白色的比基尼...
在一次性相机的最后一张照片中对着我笑了。
在翡翠色的大海前对着我笑了。
仿佛偶像明星一般，对着我笑了。

尽管相机中已经没有胶卷了，
但我依然不断地为她拍着照。
在用尽了胶卷的相机对面，
她对着镜头欢快地笑着。
尽管弱小的身躯在风中颤抖着，
但她却依然没有忘记那刚刚学会的笑容...



 

「...该道别了...」
『恩...哦，时间已经到了吗...』
「恩...」
说着，
她像从前那样慢慢地走向了大海。
「啊，对了，驾照...」
『没关系，你就留作纪念吧。』
「恩，明白了...」
她点了点头，将驾照收进了口袋里。
那是我送给她的驾照，
是本来早已失去了作用的驾照。
之后，她从手腕上摘下那只白色的塑料手环...
...将它递给了我。
『怎么...要送给我吗？』
「恩，送给你...」
『是吗...那么我也就收作纪念了。』
我接过那只手环。
也把它收进了自己的口袋。
随后，她再次向大海迈出了脚步...
面对着她的背影，我最后问道。
『呐...可以最后回答我一个问题吗？』
「恩。」
『你现在...希望我拉住你吗？』
「......」
『还是...希望我鼓励你呢？』
她在波浪中背对着我停下了脚步...
强风将浪头变作飞沫，
拍打在她的身上。
慢慢地，她转过身来...
「...是啊...谁知道呢。」
「呵呵，我自己也不知道哪。」
说着，她对着我，最后又微笑了一次。
尽管冰冷的飞沫拍打在她的身上，
尽管眼中含满了泪水，
但她仍然对着我微笑了一次。
从前，在浪边停下的脚步...
这一次，却再也没有停下来。
...所以，我想，这就是她的回答吧...

「那么...再见...」

...就这样，我们960Km的旅途结束了...
对我来说是15天，
对她来说则是22年的旅途
结束了。
她以自己的意志逃出了7楼与家的选择。
成为了2005年度推算自杀者人数3万5千人中的一位。
她的血型是O型，名字叫濑津美，22岁，女性...
塑料识别手环的颜色是白色。
这就是属于她的一切。

...但是，我知道。
她其实很喜欢比基尼，比导航系统更加熟悉道路，
喜欢车辆，甚至拥有自己的驾照。
尽管总是面无表情，也很少会看我一眼，
但偶尔，
也会流露出那种好似害羞又好似倔强的神色...
在翡翠色的大海前...
她会兴奋地，喜悦地，
宛如偶像明星一般地对着我微笑...
遗憾的是...
她的笑容，
却仅仅被记录在一张由一次性相机拍摄的照片中。

...但是...尽管是仅存的一张照片...
...它也是我们所留下的痕迹......

author: {'steamid': '76561198848389477', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1697297796}
review:
水仙这个游戏，在我看来是非常特别的游戏。我玩过的gal不多，但也只有eden和水仙真正走进了我的内心。最初想玩这个游戏，是被它的题材和风格吸引了，我还没玩过以绝症病人为视角的游戏，并且我这个人是对氛围很在意的，不知道为什么，它几张简单的图片能给人种寂寞的感觉。目前只玩过水仙1，就先评论了吧。

初入游戏，相比其它游戏，就有一种肉眼可见的简陋感，cg基本少的可怜，画面也很粗糙，但一听到bgm，就发现绝对不止这么简单，它的bgm算是我游戏生涯听到过最震撼的几种，绝美的旋律配合悲伤的故事，相得益彰。片冈的文风实在太强了，简直难以相信只是这样的叙述能有如此高的表现力。通篇下来给我的感觉，那些简单正好完美营造出了一种朦胧感，对，整个故事给我感觉就是朦胧的。语言是朦胧的，平白的叙述正添加了别样色彩；故事是朦胧的，我一样的健康人难以接触到的情景；人物是朦胧的，形象似乎充满了意象感。整个下来，就是我感受到的忧郁的氛围，故事令人绝望，但描述和结构却让人感受不到悲痛欲绝，简简单单的，一个绝症女孩和一个绝症男孩出逃，开端到结局，没什么波澜，直道最后的一幕，眼泪仍然没能掉下来，但忧伤的基调，贯穿始终。

这或许就是悲剧美，相比于大团圆，这种形式张力更足吧。我又想起clannad结局中团聚的情景，也许没有最后那幕会更令人悲伤，但谁又不喜欢大团圆结局呀！我也想看到濑津美和阿东优能突然治好病，我也想看到eden里诗音能自由生活下去，但这是不可能的，没有奇迹，没有神。我有时也会想水仙的故事停留在他们去淡路岛的途中，eden的故事停留在送走最后一艘殖民船的时候，那样至少还有念想，没准还有奇迹发生，但它们就是忠实的把故事的最后记录下来，无可避免的走向最后注定的结局。

水仙里的主角，也许象征了更多的人。在失去了未来后，唯一剩下的还能是什么。“我没有未来”，这句或许是最让人绝望的一句台词了。我想身患重病应该不是一个孩子能承受，病痛到还在其次，最难的也许是拖累了自己在意的人的负罪感还有在旅途之初却已逼近迟暮的绝望。出逃的行为并没有什么意义，还可能会让短暂的生命更加短暂，但这代表了一种反抗的态度，幼稚的反抗，就像是小孩子撒娇式的抱怨，没有作用，却令人心疼。面对困难时，总会坚持好死不如赖活着，只要活着没什么过不去的，但连活着的资格都被剥夺后，走向海中的举动，就代表了最后的态度吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198191262317', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1615100475}
review: 《水仙》是我20多年来接触的第一款Gal游戏，与其说是游戏，不如说是一本可以边看边听的短篇小说，内容虽然平淡，但绝不平庸。说真的，往往一提到Gal游戏，大部分人都会联想到“黄油”、“后宫”、“色色的立绘”等词汇，然而《水仙》恰恰是极少数涉及生死话题的这么一部作品，没有曲折跌宕的剧情，没有催泪的煽情情节，也没有奇迹般的结局大翻转，一切的一切在开始时就已经注定了，整个流程下来后感触颇多。一句话，没有玩过《水仙》的人是幸福的，而玩过《水仙》的人是幸运的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198331411585', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1614031069}
review:
[b] Side 1: [/b]

I knew how this would end.

[i] This is the story
of a girl whose heart was standing still
and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,
both of whom die. [/i]

I knew how this would end, so why? Why am I crying this hard? Maybe because it's not about the destination, but the journey itself. To surrender, to resign. Will you, knowing your end is near, fight? or will you accept it as it is? A beautiful tragedy, bittersweet until the end, masterful in its subtlety, "Narcissu" is a work worth your time. Realistic to the core, it will make you go through a concoction of emotions accompanied by the gorgeous background melodies and minimalist imagery. What are you waiting for? - our time on this earth is short, so enjoy it while you can.

[b] Side 2: [/b]

The 2nd side of the story ties the first one excellently. Every small detail in the first side makes now sense. The love for maps, daffodils, rules passed, curses - everything. [i] "If I were a saint. If my prayers weren't just for comfort. Then now, a miracle would happen...". [/i] Beautiful in its sadness, Narcissu 2 ties everything together perfectly, making for a complete narrative, bittersweet until the end. A serious theme presented in a flawless manner. I loved this story, and I wish for you to do too, because.. 

[i] in those dazzling days, those winter days, in times like these, it's okay to cry. [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198415555971', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1607870636}
review:
“假如那尔喀索斯不对自己说出【我爱你】的话...”
“艾歌就永远无法传达自己的爱意。”
没有未来的濑津美走进大海的那一刻就是这个冬日故事的结尾。
Narcissu意味的就是最深的孤独罢了。
是两个人相互面对，相互扶持，相互走向彼此的死亡。
因为选择了结束，所以走的不带犹豫，也请带着刚学会的微笑的艾歌在另一个世界里走下去。

author: {'steamid': '76561198355316398', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1575232856}
review:
Narcissu is one of a small number of games that made me cry. It is such as heartbreaking and beautiful game, and I'm so glad I got to play it.

Narcissu is split into two stories: Narcissu 1st and Narcissu 2nd. Narcissu 1st is about a man who is admitted to 7F, the seventh floor of the hospital, due to his terminal illness. There he meets Setsumi, a woman who is also terminally ill. The man finds out that 7F is the hospice, where the terminally ill come to be treated until they die. Additionally, he finds out that other than terminal illness, he and Setsumi have something else in common: both would rather die elsewhere other than in 7F or at home. Thus, they leave the hospital and set off on a journey, the final journey of their lives.

Narcissu 2nd takes place years before Narcissu 1st and follows a younger Setsumi, before her admission into 7F. Setsumi meets Himeko, a terminally ill patient, and the two strike up a friendship. From Himeko, Setsumi learns about cars, maps, and adventure, and in spite of her illness, Himeko's spirit seemingly never waned. Himeko's backstory is also revealed, in which she used to help other patients in 7F before her diagnosis of terminal illness. In similarity to Narcissu 1st, Himeko wants to take one final journey, and thus she and Setsumi set off to do so.

Both stories deal with the effects of terminal illness and loss. It is not easy to deal with the fact that someone close has a terminal illness. The entire livelihood of the one diagnosed with the illness is changed, and he/she will have to experience a slow but eventual death. The person's family and friends have to deal with knowing that loss will come in the near future, for there is nothing they can do to prevent death and raise the person's spirits to the fullest potential. The man, Setsumi, and Himeko realize these facts all too well. 7F should not be the place to die, where they're surrounded by medical staff and equipment in a setting that is all too familiar and painful. Home also should not be the place to die, where they're surrounded by family and friends who can only watch them fade away, who then must face the pains of loss right in front of them. There must be a better option.

When I read the game description, I was reminded of a famous line in William Shakespeare's [i]Romeo and Juliet[/i]: "A pair of star-crossed lovers take their life." Shakespeare literally tells his audience in the intro of his famous play that Romeo and Juliet will inevitably take their lives. The game description does the same: "This is the story of a girl whose heart was standing still and a boy whose breath was being stolen away, both of whom die." Now that sounds depressing, but despite the fact that death is inevitable, why does this game exist; why does [i]Romeo and Juliet[/i] exist? Then I remembered: a story is never just about the resolution, and an adventure is never just about the destination. They are about everything in between: the preparation, the journey, the setbacks, the miracles, the seemingly little things that culminate into something memorable. During their road trip, the man and Setsumi bought clothes, had their picture taken, and slept under a roof that was neither a hospital's or a home's, before finally reaching flowers, beaches, and open water. Before their last goodbyes, Setsumi and Himeko had food and drinks together, read maps, and climbed a mountain to reach out to open skies. Yes, death is inevitable, especially under the circumstances of terminal illness, but it is the time spent beforehand that truly matters.

In the end, the interactions and development of these characters, followed by their drive to truly live before they die and their subsequent journeys away from familiarity culminate into an absolutely sweet, heartbreaking, and above all, beautiful game. It is true that we will inevitably say our goodbyes sometime later, but it is important to live in the now. Time is precious, so make the most of it, and life will become that much sweeter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313895508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1613315613}

author: {'steamid': '76561198437509458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1609394255}
review:
I don't even know what to say. It's heartbreakingly sweet..

Edit: This vn is cruel, I hate it. I didn't know I'd end the year with a river of tears.

Edit (2): I have read hundreds of visual novels but this remains to my top favorite. It is beautiful in all ways possible, heart wrenching, and depressingly bittersweet. I always find myself going back to this from time to time. It genuinely makes you contemplate life and death, friendship and love--just human stuff. I will never ever get tired of reading this over and over and cry about it for hours. Thank you, Narcissu, for helping me feel what it's like to be truly human again.

author: {'steamid': '76561199011697204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1603188309}
review:
没想到这么有名的gal居然免费上的steam，于是抱着试试看的想法开推（有汉化补丁，不影响拿成就）。
两部都推下来用时并不多，给我的感觉就是音乐很美，剧情给人一种说不出来的绝望感（据说剧情是以片冈智身边人的经历改编的？），作为同人游戏算是不错的了。只是backlog过于简陋，在不开声音的时候你甚至很容易没法分辨一句对话是双方哪个人说的（相比起来fata馆的系统就好多了）。

author: {'steamid': '76561199057414677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1606677705}
review: Absolutely classic, it's good to just read it for some extra knowledge. Like other comments said, it's a story about death and suicide, and there is very limited artwork with no choice in the game. Therefore your feeling of this story really depend on your own understanding of these topics. 1st is a delicate realism story and a good example of using sound track properly, even though the story does not make sense in multiple way. 2nd... I could not say it's boring or disappointing, but it's much longer than 1st and more anime-ish. So. I would suggest to spend 1 or 2 hours on 1st then have a rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097351680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1662499037}
review:
This a very sad story.
Although it is a short one this one was filled to the brim with character development as well as with memorable scenes.
It tackles a very hard topic and thankfully doesnt shy away to show how cruel or better to say unfair our world can be. 
For me it was a very genuine story which i have to admit made me cry more then i would like to admit, there were some moments where i had to stop reading because i basically couldnt stop crying. Music is amazing and cant listen to it without getting tears in my eyes. All in all I give it a 10/10 although it gave me a little bit (better to say a lot) of depression where I look around me and ask my self what the hell I am even  doing, I will never regret that I read this story. I can only recommend it to everyone to atleast read it once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399961550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1605015970}
review: 玲珑的艺术品，合适的止痛剂。narcissu与《我与地坛》，一个是饱经折磨后选择死亡的故事、一个是饱经折磨后选择活下去的故事，我无意用对比试图给两部作品拉近距离或分个高下，仅仅只是个人感叹。1是浑然天成的艺术品，短小精悍的剧本和给予人生之勇气的音乐让我折服，片冈用本就美化现实苦难的avg载体，再进一步将一个充满苦难的故事对焦、剥除现实的浓郁苦素，带来了这个气质如其名的优秀作品。水仙2要比1逊色一点，不过补完了濑津美的故事，又另外为我们创造了姬子这个圣人，我也许永远也无法成为如此坚强的人，永远只能隔着一层雾眺望虚拟的灯塔。

author: {'steamid': '76561198447425978', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1606622286}
review:
一段灿烂的故事，一个冬日的回忆。
一个关于死亡的故事，一段对生死的探讨，水仙系列无疑是我近些年玩的最优秀的gal之一，没有令人眼花缭乱的cg，没有一波三折的情节转折，但水仙，却凭借其优秀的氛围塑造和配音，讲诉着一位临终病人最后的旅行。
“让留下来的人，笑着活下去”
10/8.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198129176333', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1603856411}
review:
Feel free to comment with the similarly sad-ish VNs, if you know any
Possible Spoilers ahead (probably not, but continue on your own risk)
Somehow i never got myself to play the 2nd, so my comment is about the original(Insani Translations), hope the 2nd will delight me as much, if i ever make myself to read it. Works great when you want to think of how ordinarily sad life can be and to give yourself a push forward.

A great story, reasonably short, recommending to read it in one sitting, it will take about 3-5 hours depending on the rate of reading. Get some hot tea or drink of your choice and get comfortable.

I first read it about 10 years ago and i read it for about 5th time since then and it is as good as it ever was for me. Sure i wish there was more CGs, but it's laconic enough to get away with what it has:
Great Semi-Sad Story of two people who had their life shortened in all meanings, but still helped one another to get a taste of it. I only wish for a bit more of the protagonist's view and feelings on the situation as a whole. 
(Might read up on the 2nd soon, maybe it will get me what i didn't get in the original)
Great Music, i listen to it till this same day
Great, albeit a bit few, style
Great, laconic writing
Great at putting me in a good kind of semi-sad hopeful mood, good for a chill read

author: {'steamid': '76561198278041323', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1603211666}
review: 八九年前我第一次接触到这款游戏，对那时刚刚步入青春期的我来说，生命的价值、信念、追求，包括成人世界的种种都极为遥远和模糊，但对那个我来说死亡的主题却是无比震撼且清晰的。在人生尚且无忧无虑的阶段，死亡对我而言不过是深夜忽然袭上心头的一瞬慌张，是流落街头的幻想带来的片刻恐惧，数年间尝尽人世种种滋味后，我再次打通了这款游戏，这时的这个我不再站在听音乐品剧情的角度来结束这段寂寞夜晚的短暂精神旅行。我费尽气力，试图从这次遨游里捕捉到一丝安宁和希望，聊以滋润早已干涸，变作一谭淤泥的心田，聊以稍稍宽慰孤独、空幻、在平庸中白白消耗的人生

author: {'steamid': '76561198815259684', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1603296436}
review: 我多想和你一起，进行一次想去就去的旅行，没有目的，也没有终点

author: {'steamid': '76561198418714786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1612676334}
review:
2确实补足了1中的诸多细节，总体氛围与1稍有不同，虽然是一样的悲伤绝望，但2不仅是在补足1，更是对全作主题的补足。
「不管是怎样的挚友，阿洛伊斯都无法成为帕德」
片冈先生用《福兰德斯的狗》这部作品里的三位角色来代表了将死的人、陪伴的人和被留下来的人这三类人，正如上句所说，生者与死者再无交错的机会，生者仍要留下，承受死者无法承受之痛苦。他们是父母，是兄妹，是挚友，或者只是病护、熟人。但他们都尚还有选择选择的余地，还有未来。
如福音所说「旷野和干旱之地必然欢喜,沙漠也必快乐,又像玫瑰开花。必开花繁盛,乐上加乐,而且欢呼」，即使在绝望如一无所有的荒地，也有可以诞生出鲜花这样的欢喜...如果在未来,真有繁花盛开这一日，那更是喜上加喜。正如在万木凋零的酷寒一月，水仙依然可以盛放一样。
在遥遥无尽的高空的神明到底能不能听到我们的祈祷，没有人知道，只有身边的人无数次听到过我们的祈祷。但他们依然无能为力，这样的祈祷只是在徒增留下的人的痛苦。
所以，住在7F的他们最后想要传达的是：
「往生之人，笑着活下去吧。」
神不爱世人，世人自爱，如水仙一般，珍爱自己，珍重。

author: {'steamid': '76561198338026236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1568200481}
review:
小时候玩过，第一次玩这类游戏，我感到了震感，对，在当时是非常震撼的。

玩的时候我感觉我也坐在了车里，仿佛是我、男主、女主三个人一样，用我的视觉去看待。结局后，我真的玩不了第二遍了，这其中也有对女主的惋惜吧，我想如果是我，我可能不会放任女主去海里吧，因为我发现我已经喜欢上女主了，我受不了她第二次离我而去的那种绝望感受。不愧是绝望的回忆。

我必须给好评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198368202358', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1664730053}
review:
Wooow... This was a roller coaster of emotions packed into a stunning visual novel. I cried. A lot. More than what I was expecting.

Short kinetic visual novel Narcissu has two stories that each deal with a terminal illness. All I can say is that you will experience strong gut-punches from emotions as you read this novel. Playing this and hoping to disappear into a fantasy world is not going to happen. The story of this visual novel is unadulterated, unfiltered, and stays true to the difficult, painful truth it explores.

If you want to read through this exquisitely written visual novel, there are a few things you should take into account. The narrative is divided into two stories. Although the second story takes place quite before the first story chronologically, reading the stories in either order won't significantly alter the reading experience. In addition, it is important to note that some of the content may bore some readers. This vn is rife with slow storytelling, a lack of character growth, and character CG. Narcissu might not be for you if you prefer watching the characters interact throughout the entire narrative and don't want to be stuck staring at still images of clouds, hospital rooms, and all the other background CG used.

Personal thoughts:
I really liked this visual novel, so I wasn't bothered by the slow pacing at all. I think of it as the reader taking on the role of the storyteller and gradually feeling the suffering that the characters we follow are experiencing, as well as the slow, monotonous life that they are forced to lead by the circumstances of their lives. I really liked how little character-specific computer-generated imagery was used. I felt lonely and depressed as a result of it. It fit in well with the way Narcissu is attempting to tell its story. That is, at least, how I see it.

As a final note, sadness with a large portion of crying and heartache is all you'll know when you finish this visual novel…

author: {'steamid': '76561199029022305', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1602350077}
review:
偶然间朋友推荐的游戏，看是免费就玩了玩，玩了就停不下来，很难过，很无力，我原以为催泪的我看挺多的，这次应该顶得住，没想到还是崩了。
以下内容有些剧透
[spoiler] 第二部里的那个姬子陪护的小孩真的太让人难过了，明明连死是什么都不知道，却要被迫接受一天一天靠近的死亡。还未盛开的花朵就凋谢，最令人痛心 [/spoiler]
不过，虽然这个游戏很悲，很难过，却没有那么丧，就像最后的那个愿望：让留下来的人能笑着活下去。斯人已逝，我们剩下来的人不应该沉溺于过去的悲痛，而应该带着那人的一份，好好的活下去
[spoiler] 有点语无伦次，因为是刚通关写的评测，情绪波动有点大，不好意思不好意思，反正极力推荐这部作品2333 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198323539288', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1596463839}
review:
Narcissu is a VN about the lives of three people with a terminal illness. It has two parts and I'll talk about both of them.

Narcissu 1st follows Yuu Atou, a man who, due to his worsening condition, is sent to be taken care of on the 7th floor of the hospital. This is where he meets Setsumi Sakura, a girl who also has a terminal illness, and discovers that the 7th floor (referred to as "7F") is where patients with illnesses like theirs are sent to die with no hope of ever getting better. In an effort to find some meaning and closure in their lives, Yuu and Setsumi set off on a road trip, determined not to die on 7F.

Narcissu 2nd is the prequel to Narcissu 1st and follows a younger Setsumi, before she is admitted to 7F. She meets a young woman named Himeko Shinohara in a hospital, who has been admitted to the 7th floor. Himeko is a rambunctious young woman despite her illness, loves cars, maps, and adventure, while Setsumi is quiet, stoic, and reserved. Despite this, they become friends and share a commonality due to their illness.

Both parts deal with a common theme that most people can relate to, which is loss. It's handled very well, so well I cried near the end of both of them because the imagery, writing (besides some spelling errors), and soundtrack is so good that it hits just the right notes to replicate the feeling of loss. It's what a good story does ― it develops the characters and makes them real enough for you, the reader, to care about them, and this is what Narcissu does very well.

It took me around 8 hours to finish Narcissu (which is quite long for a free VN), but it depends on how fast you read and whether you have voice mode on and you're just listening to the story rather than reading it. All in all, I recommend this VN, especially if you enjoy great characters and writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198445544982', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1691710949}
review:
I recall once a line by Thomas Bernhard that everything is ridiculous when one thinks of death. I forgot exactly how he articulates the idea but it more or less expressed how much changes when one is confronted with the specter of illness and mortality. What truly matters and what can anyone outside understand about lives developed in the face of death, year after year?

I can’t help but think the same whenever I read Narcissu. At its core, it is extremely minimalistic and short, having few of the accoutrements of most other VNs. A cast of two, few backgrounds and CGs, and an anemic playtime for anyone used to the marathon lengths of the likes of Fate/Stay Night or Muv Luv. But in many regards, this allows for a concise focus on the simple but poignant center of the VN, two terminally ill patients and what it is that matters, that anything matters alone on the precipice of death. 

The narrative itself is simple, two patients steal a car on their way to a place away from the hospital or home, a death away from the hospital or home. We are succinctly told that

[i]This is a story of so many things.[/i]
[i]But most of all ...[/i]
[i]This is the story[/i]
[i]of a girl whose heart was standing still[/i]
[i]and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,[/i]
[i]both of whom die.[/i]

There is only one inexorable conclusion. But knowing the events themselves says nothing about the VN, it is how it conveys the gravitas of death. Mortality and illness rob the two of any normal life, it makes even the smallest, trivial actions a bare struggle during their journey. But there is no melodramatic self-pity, no (excessive) soliloquys, no convenient surrender, it may not be boldly defying fate but it stands upright in its resignation. For a VN so occupied with death, it expresses the greatest appreciation for the smallest, most insignificant moments that make up life.
Perhaps not for everyone, but certainly worth the small time commitment for anyone with a remote interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561199041192877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1598432353}
review: 汉化补丁https://keylol.com/t131270-1-1如果要我选gal里最喜欢的十个剧本，我觉得我的选择里会有《水仙》的一席之地。＂生如夏花之绚烂，死如秋叶之静美＂，我觉得这是个会让人悲伤的故事，水仙的bgm更是不需要过多评价，上上乘不足为过，给整个故事增色了很多。片冈老师的小故事的确是很舒服的，致郁我倒觉得还好，或许更重要的是在八年中，在七楼这个地方，濑津美所形成的生死观。或许濑津美父母对她的爱，变成了一种压力。文字很优美，准确说会是凄美。作为一篇直线型短篇，剧本里重复的语句，以及多次出现的逻辑对话，让整个剧本更加紧凑。七楼，银色酷派，淡路岛，960千米，叫做水仙的花。结束了的俩人15天的旅程，随之结束的也是濑津美22年的人生。用克制的笔法平静的文字渲染出的压抑气氛，我哭不出来。濑津美穿着比基尼泳装消失在海洋中可能会让我终身难忘。“如果我现在走进海里，你会拉住我吗？ 你希望我怎么做呢？ 我也不知道呢。”短小的adv并不是他的缺点，短小但是可以富有韵味，这才是他知名度高的原因。个人感觉一比二好，不知道二是不是因为长了，少了一那种孤注一掷的感觉，不如一，但是玩一下还是值得的。二的话我觉得有些拖沓，催泪程度因人而异吧。或许比起一，二更加的真实。可能还是因为商业化的缘故，二没有一的气氛凝重。虽然气氛不如前作，但是立意或许更广更深刻。正因为这个，他所传达的东西就有些不如一清晰有力度了。不过，我还是觉得，一和二的结合才是完整的水仙。

author: {'steamid': '76561198270969269', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1597913689}
review:
Ever wanted to play a game that felt genuine? Ever wanted to see characters forming small relationships and having character development? Ever wanted to just laugh and smile upon seeing the characters monologue only to cry while reading the lines? Then this is the game for you. 
Upon first seeing this game I was pretty excited and anticipated a lot from this as upon looking at the synopsis I could see that it was going to be a beautiful story. And I can confidently say after finishing both the games, it was perfectly delivered and deserves to be read by more players. I don't really get why this game is free as it has rich characters, story and amazing music which helps with the feels but I can see that it was from long ago which is understandable. ( 2005 and 2007 ).
I recommend this to people who likes heartwarming and beautiful stories.
10/10 -Kimskerem, If I could erase my memories and reread it. I would in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399590082', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1690266468}
review:
[b]相见恨晚，真的，再次体会到这种感情转眼间已经是13年后了[/b]
 一个冬日的故事，一段灿烂的回忆。
面对这个只有自己的世界，我不知送走了多少次季节，多少次下着梅雨的苍白天空。
而我们现在有了地图和交通工具，想去哪里就去哪里，
我们现在也有了钱，不用担心挨饿；
但是我们没有时间，我们没有未来 ，
[b][spoiler]正因为明白这些，我才觉得更加伤悲。[/spoiler][/b] 
—夜色逐渐逝去，广阔的白色花丛在淡路岛这片净土上肆意盛开。
无垠的百合花在晨光中起伏着。
我们的心中原来没有任何目标，但现在，我们却追逐到了自己的目标。
那就是，
[b]“让进入7F的每一个人，都能够笑着离开。”[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198412680068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1615692740}
review: 留下来的人带着离去的人的信念 活下去

author: {'steamid': '76561198090490140', 'num_games_owned': 2043, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1606896051}
review: 比起常见的对本作的解读，个人认为《水仙1》从另一种角度上来说，有着对个人命运的无常的反抗的层面。面对自己生命几乎注定的结局，濑津美由最初的绝望和逃避，到鼓起勇气去寻找属于自己的人生意义，再到完成心愿、从容不迫地走向大海。用死亡来对抗和超越死亡本身，可以说她人生的最后是绚烂而令人动容的。与此类似的是田中罗密欧的《加奈~欢迎回来~》，不过，不同于本作的是，它始终在积极的意味上阐述着死亡这件事对于生者的意义，以及在此之上如何去面对人生，推荐有兴趣的朋友可以尝试一下。

author: {'steamid': '76561198375029180', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1594515406}
review: Praticamente um livro digital para reflexão por conter uma história muito marcante e fzer vcê pensar sobre a vida e como seria horrível estar com uma doença terminal e o qe faria para aproveitar os últimos dias qe lhe restam... vivendo uma última aventura cm outra pessoa também na mesma situação e decidindo jntos o qe fzer até qe o fim chegue... decidindo também o local em qe vai qrer descansar eternamente – no hospital ou no mundo afora. Enfim, com toda certeza recomendo essa leitura gratuita qe afeta muito no emocional e te faz valorizar mais a vida no geral – o único detalhe é qe é tudo em inglês (ou japonês).
