author: {'steamid': '76561198205649491', 'num_games_owned': 2571, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1498607787}
review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd，[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/348950/Ame_no_Marginal_Rain_Marginal/]雨的边缘[/url]

她们的世界与命运，真的难以想象如果发生在我们自己身上的时候，我们能否这样坚强

这两天似乎看了太多的悲剧，也想起现在正在热播的Re:C，这位作者片岡とも怕不是要被打死

我坐在桌前，戴着耳机，用鼠标度过了十个小时

读完之后我是什么感触呢，其实更多的只是告诉自己：下次咱不玩悲剧了（还有个十周年版没玩呢。。。）

我不敢说我读完这三个悲剧故事后我能怎么怎么样，我想这也不是作者的本意

7L的故事会一直延续下去吧，这世界上有像她们一样的尼洛，阿洛伊斯也不会少

有的人选择自己承担痛苦，而不想让别人为自己痛苦

最起码，她们都有一个人愿意陪她们完成自己的愿望

narcissus真的是自恋吗，我看到的是她们对周围人的爱

医院里的narcissus，淡路岛的narcissus，这份爱，这份温柔，会一直延续下去的吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198097996432', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1497085272}
review:
I'm not really into visual novels, but this one, even don't having choices or interaction, it's, imo., a very meaningful piece of art.

You might think [i]"what's the point of playing a book?"[/i] But this visual novel uses everything to turn the simple read into a great experience, the passing, music and visual choices (like the choose for less, but more significant, area of illustration) are all great in setting the theme and touching the emotional of the reader, in a way that neither a book, audio-book or a pack of illustrations could do by their own. And that's what art is all about, using the media to provoke feelings and thoughts, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198367136732', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1497079147}
review:
[h1] 每一下都能敲击到心里的配乐中 知道了两个有关水仙的故事	[/h1]

配乐和CV加上简单的图片 再搭配以想象力 才能完成整个故事
二零一七年 这是水仙系列的第十年
屏幕上最后一个字消失的时候 是一种哽住了喉咙想哭却哭不出来声音的悲伤
悲伤之后余留下来在记忆中的 却又是一种温馨得让人不由得想微笑的力量
喜欢一个人最认真的姿态 就是到最后活成了她的样子 或者是她希望的样子吧


[h1] 濑津美的水仙与比基尼	[/h1]

对普通人来说 我的存在只是一个累赘
从那时我的时间 就静止了

你是第几次了 第几次来到七楼了
这是不成文的规矩 那么仔细听我说 我只说一次 接下来的话要仔细听好
第三次暂时出院的时候 就做好心理准备吧 不会再有第四次了 已经无法再回到家里去了
假如想逃走的话 不要到A车站去 而要到B车站去
什么也不要吃 这是最快捷的手段 同时也是减少家人负担的最佳方法

那么我们就一起走吧？
我也不喜欢家 同样不喜欢七楼

只是不断累积着无意义的知识
假如就这样走进大海 会轻松的死掉么
那么我现在走进海里去的话 你会拉住我么
你希望我拉住你么

我有点想去淡路岛看一看啊
冰冻住时间 冰冻住内心
但是 心口上那道长长的伤痕在奉劝我 劝我放弃这些念头
它在奉劝我 将空想的世界作为余生的伴侣
我有泳装 也有地图 但我却没有未来

我再提最后一个要求 笑一笑吧 濑津美
驾照就当做纪念吧 她从手上取下白色的手环 把它递给了我
你现在希望我拉住你么？

这样我们960公里的旅途结束了 对我来说是15天 对她来说是22年
她的血型是O 名字叫濑津美 22岁 女性 塑料识别手环的颜色是白色
她其实喜欢比基尼 比导航系统更加熟悉道路 喜欢车辆 甚至拥有自己的驾照


[h1] 姬子的十字架和汽车	[/h1]

辉夜姬的姬 小孩子的子 顺便一提 天秤座AB型
我想要个和我年龄差距很大的朋友呢

不过这可不是温柔哦 虽然你大概还不能够理解的吧
反过来说的话 只要有5万日圆 就可以去日本的任何地方哦
你看 虽然你总是都穿着校服 不过我觉得这种衣服应该也很合适吧
愿主的恩惠和祝福降临于你

那个 姬子
嗯 我知道的
那么 再见了

我祈祷她能幸福 就算未来已经被封闭 也希望不要有任何遗憾
然后剩下一半是 隐瞒一些事情 自己本身被宽恕的请求
希望你不要再来这里了
明明是博士却什么也回答不了

对不起姐姐 如果没成为朋友就好了 明明在规则里也有这条
所以停下吧 你不会得到救助的 不管怎么做 都会死的
没什么 我已经没有关系了 只是希望哭泣的姐姐 停止哭泣而已
早一点恢复一如既往的微笑 只是为了这个而祈祷

至少希望 一直为我痛苦的人 可以重新站起来
即将去世的人 对于留下来的人的愿望吧

长达40天的夏日结束了
名字是姬子 辉夜姬的姬 小孩子的子 血型AB 23岁 天秤座 女性
塑料识别手环的颜色是白色
归还了连衣裙 收到了地图 然后地图里夹着一个信封 里面放入了五张一万日元的纸币


[h1] 到了最后还能保持微笑么	[/h1]

最后附上汉化 http://pan.baidu.com/s/1c02eKhU 下载覆盖即可
如果有情怀请自行在STEAM上搜索NARCISSU十周年版

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2464, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1496059236}
review:
주인공.... 왠지모를 답답함이 느껴지면서도 알 수 없는 동질감이 느껴지네요.

그저 화면을 누르면 됩니다. 그러면서 지나가는 시간들을 바라보죠.
눈에 보이는 지문을 읽고 음성판이라면 음성을 들으며. 그러면서 자신도 모르게 동화될지 모릅니다.

자신의 현재 상황과 비슷하다는 느낌에 또는 혹시모를 나의 미래가 되지 않을까 하는 생각에.
하나의 챕터를 끝내면 이야기 속 인물들이 느끼는 감정이 떠올라
다음 챕터를 나아갈 용기가 생기지 않기도 하더군요.

간간히 주인공의 답답하거나 이상한 행동 또는 여주인공의 예상치 못한 반응에 미소가 지어지기도 하지만,
이어서 등장하는 슬픈 상황이나 말들에 슬픈 미소로 변하곤 합니다.
그래서 더 진행하기가 힘든건가...

챕터 하나의 플레이 시간은 10~15분 가량 됩니다.길다면 20분 정도?
아무 말없이 플레이한 게임은 처음인 것 같군요.


가벼운 마음으로 시작하여
무거운 마음으로 진행하고
슬픈 미소로 끝을 맺게된다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345876506', 'num_games_owned': 1519, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1655796022}
review:
"人活一世，草木一春。"生命各有长短，但是死亡终会作为生的一部分，伴随生的结束而到来，这是自然的规律。

但是当你得知自己将要死了的时候，你会哭吗？亦或是平静接受呢？
也许会记起很多没能实现的愿望，或回想起过去生活中的遗憾，又或想起以前同行过却又慢慢回归各自人生轨道的人们。
如果有的选，当然是想要继续活下去啊，可惜没有给你选择的余地，你的时间已经不多了。
你可以出于恐惧选择哭泣，因为你害怕失去那些人生历程中宝贵的东西；
也可以平静的接受死亡的判决，去做人生最后的挣扎，留下自己存在过的证明。
无论怎么选择，死亡终会带来平息。


一朵水仙，两段故事。
片冈老师带给我们的不止是感动，还有对死亡这个严肃话题的探讨。

故事的叙述方法并不出众，甚至有点平淡，但是却极具感染力，随着故事的推动我的心境产生了很大的变化，从[spoiler]两人出逃后，海边津赖美的那句“你会拉住我吗？”的[/spoiler]治愈，到[spoiler]第一章节结束，由主角陈述津赖美22年人生结束时的[/spoiler]致郁，再又[spoiler]被最后姬子和津赖美在雨后山中的关于生死的对话感染[/spoiler]重归平静。生与死都有它的定数，除了接受，别无他法。

而且配乐和文本契合度相当高，配乐给故事加了很多分。


同时推荐一部摩根·弗里曼出演的电影《遗愿清单》。

review:
The VN that started my journey to the land of VNs. 10 years later and I still haven't looked back.

Thanks to Tomo Kataoka and stage-nana for the VN
Thanks to insani for the wonderful translation

The later games may not be into your taste, but if you've read this far then I'd recommend to play the original narcissu 1 and using insani's translation. It is what led me into the land of VNs and this is back in 2005 I believe. Time sure flew a lot since.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122244584', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1493008284}
review:
Well, first... let me just explain my surprise and what grey areas there are in calling something a "Visual Novel". 

I know that, as far as credibility among gamers go, visual novels are among the lowest, most "casual" rung in reputations. However, there are some games I enjoy very much which are often referred to as visual novels. [i]Ace Attorney[/i]. [i]Danganronpa[/i]. To an extent, [i]The Walking Dead[/i], though it is more commonly referred to as something along the lines of an "interactive movie". Even some rpgmaker games, such as the line of games: [i]To The Moon[/i], [i]A Bird Story[/i], and, I assume, the coming sequel [i]Finding Paradise[/i]. 

But the thing is... these "visual novels" normally come with some kind of interactivity. Moving around, examing objects, quick-time events, dialogue options, even some mini-games. They gain the title of "visual novel" from the intense focus on story and that, at times, all you can do to advance the story is to continuously press the button to move to the next line. But they have other features. [i]Narcissu[/i], on the other hand, does not.

That is what surprised me about [i]Narcissu[/i]... That there was literally no gameplay and you just clicked your way through all portions of the story. I'm not going to hold this against the game. It was clearly tagged as such under "visual novel". I'm simply used to, I guess, games that are in the same realm as visual novels, but not quite. So I had a hard time maintaining interest. That, however, does not mean I regret reading through the story. 

[i]Narcissu 1st[/i] I found exceptionally compelling. The thoughts of life and death are rather similar to my own. The tedium from inaction at the thought of wasting away in a hospital, terminally ill. The unbreakable spirit in doing what you want in life and dying on your own terms. Every person's right to die when they want or feel they need to die. I found myself to be rather fond of Setsumi's perspective. [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] wasn't a bad expansion upon the characters, but it is longer and I didn't feel as interested. However, the epilogue ties things up nicely. 

I kind of liked this story, and I loved the sentiment behind it. As long as you know ahead of time that this is a true Visual Novel, then there would be no reason not to enjoy it. And if you're the emotional type, bring some tissues.

review:
Narcissu is game which i would highly recommend since, 
1. Its free
2. Easy achievements
3. Touching story
4. Great Soundtrack 

The story tells us about 2 characters who are suffering from terminal illness and who they are going to prepare to die like where the would die etc. This visual novel conveys a strong emotion sense which can make you cry or shed tears. 10/10 would recommend. All aboard the feels train! Next stop your heart!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160208055', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1499261779}
review:
故事在“一号线”的ED中结束，曾经还在面前的个鲜活的人，最后却仅仅只是为统计数据中加个1。游戏里的两条故事线都是简短的故事。没有过多的时代背景友人之类的相关内容，仅仅只是从7楼开始，但却把主角那对生的渴望及希望，但是所换来的只有绝望描写的痛入心扉。故事非常细腻，带着一种日式特有的自杀美学和难以形容的绝望却又给人一种希望。个人比较喜欢有语音的版本，因为这样比较有代入感。说老实话我对免费表示有些良心痛。可以说这真的是良心作。
附上汉化补丁：http://pan.baidu.com/s/1c2cmKE0

author: {'steamid': '76561198113208948', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1493121172}
review:
Представьте, каково это, жить в тесной палате, каждый день смотреть в окно, видеть бурлящую вокруг жизнь, видеть огромный мир по ту сторону стекла и не иметь возможности прикоснуться, почувствовать? Каково каждый день, снова и снова, проходить через бесконечный цикл из уколов, процедур и проверок? Каково быть окружённым людьми, которым нет до тебя дела, которые скорее всего даже не помнят твоего имени? Осознавать, что когда-то у тебя была своя жизнь, полная ярких красок и эмоций, были друзья, были мечты и устремленья. Каково понимать, что этого уже не вернуть, чувствовать пустоту внутри себя, чувствовать боль и отчаяние и быть окружённым такими же обречёнными, как ты? Каково продолжать жить, не имея надежды?

Это история про живых, которым ничего не остается, кроме как умереть и умирающих, которым ничего не остается, кроме как жить дальше.

Эта простая история о многом, что мы предпочитаем не замечать…

И конечно же… Это история о девушке, чье сердце остановилось, и о молодом человеке, чье дыхание вот-вот оборвется…

review: 一款比较旧的游戏，10多年前的回忆，可以当作是花一个小时去看一部意义深长的小说，故事单纯却深刻，没有华丽的CG图，没有庞大的世界观设定，没有背负宿命的主角，更没有意有所指的说教。只是平静地描述一个平凡女子最后的人生旅程。这样的故事并不特别，然而却很真实。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096320151', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1466103775}
review:
♥ Français en dessous ! ♥

My review may have a "knowledge bias", but I didn't like this kinetic novel (kinetic meaning you have no choice to make) for its lack of accuracy. It is a very liked game so I know I might face a shitstorm, but well...

I have heavy chronic diseases, and I worked in a hospital  before having to stop working.
This kinetic novel (two stories) is about young people who know they will die, and just wait for their end in a special floor in a hospital (... or try to give life a sense one last time). 
Well, even if they will die, as hospital staff you don't let people watering flowers under a hard sunny sky, or just fooling around like they want. Hospital is not a hostel. You never, ever, let drugs in a hospital without watch and being locked with a key, you never have a floor with just no staff around.
When you are really sick (and even more when you will be dead soon), you can't f♥♥♥ing take care of flowers under the sun, you just vomit because you can't stand the weather anymore. You can't drive, because you are so tired you can not even read, or think. You can't walk a mountain (!!), because just walking a bit makes you feel dizzy. No matter how hard your will, how high your spirit, your body stays broken. So you try to reflect on life, to be with your close ones, to be happy for your last moments, while being in your bed, in your room, because that's all you can do.
And as a reader, I don't know how to feel empathy with a girl just saying "betsu ni" during 80% of her story, with all the little things you learn about her having a root in the second story (a prequel) like this girl never had family, friends, influences, character in her life before that; and I can't stay focused on a story with so many false things and just have the clear attempt to make you cry. (oh, and also, I have a strong Faith. Well, some Catholic people seems to have been touched by the way the topic is touch on this story; but I didn't as well, it wasn't deep enought, philosophically and emotionally, for me).

It's just a novel by, and about, normal people who won't die (and never worked in a hospital), thinking of how it would be to die soon and young. You may get the feels if you don't know anything of it, but if you are in this case, it just feel untrue and a bit pathetic.

Some good points for this game:
- good voice acting.
- free.
- easy tophies for trophies hunters.

That's all. HF.

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
Frenchy French time !

Bon, donc pour commencer, j'ai des biais "de connaissance" qui expliquent sans doute mon impression négative pour ce kinetic novel (histoire visuelle sans choix à faire, juste lire, écouter et passer les pages), aussi aimé soit-il: j'ai des maladies chroniques bien handicapantes, et avant de tomber malade, je bossais dans un hôpital. Et je me suis dit qu'avoir un avis "de l'intérieur" pouvait être intéressant.

Du coup, mon avis sur le jeu est confronté à la réalité. Par exemple:
- Quand on bosse dans un hôpital, jamais un étage n'est laissé sans aucun personnel. On ne laisse jamais les médicaments sans surveillance, et sans être dans des armoires fermées à clef. On ne laisse personne aller et venir librement, même s'ils vont bientôt mourir -bonjour la surveillance des constantes vitales- et encore moins faire des choses comme aller arroser des fleurs en plein cagnard.
- Quand on est très malade (et encore plus quand on est à quelques semaines de mourir, hein.), on ne va pas arroser les fleurs en plein aprem l'été, parce qu'on ne supporte plus les températures et on est trop occupé à vomir. On ne peut pas conduire, parce que la plupart du temps on est déjà trop fatigué(e) pour comprendre un livre, et même penser des fois c'est limite. On ne va pas faire des balades en pleine montagne (......) parce que même marcher un peu donne des vertiges. Peu importe le moral, le mental qu'on a, ça ne répare pas le corps magiquement (malheureusement). Alors on essaie de réfléchir à sa vie, d'être avec ses proches, de régler ses papiers, de profiter du temps qui nous reste, dans notre lit, notre chambre, parce qu'il ne reste que ça.

Après, on peut me dire "ouiii, mais c'est une histoire, c'est touchant". Ouais, sauf que quand on "connaît", on est sans cesse choqué(e) par le fait que... c'est une histoire écrite par des gens qui vont bien (et n'ont jamais bossé dans un hôpital), sur des gens qui vont bien en fait, mais qui s'amusent juste à imaginer ce que ça ferait de mourir jeune et bientôt. C'est juste une histoire plein de choses pas vraies, pas cohérentes, dans le but de faire pleurer.
En tant que lectrice, je ne vois pas comment m'attacher à un personnage qui passe son temps à dire "betsu ni" ("rien de spécial") 80% de son histoire, et qui en plus pour le peu de caractère qu'elle a, tient tout de l'héroïne de la seconde histoire (une préquelle) comme si elle n'avait elle-même jamais eu de famille, d'amis, d'influence d'aucune sorte ni même de caractère avant de la rencontrer. Personnage bien construit donc. En tant que personne ayant une forte spiritualité, même si certains Catholiques semblent avoir été touchés par la seconde histoire, pour moi ce n'était pas assez profond ni philosophiquement, ni émotionnellement.

Bref, une histoire lente, pas crédible, pas creusée. Il faut ne pas connaître pour de vrai ces sujets pour être touché(e), honnêtement. 

Mais je vais donner quand même quelques points positifs (juste, pas du tout suffisants, pour moi, pour mériter une recommandation):
- le doublage est très bien fait, et le jeu est de bonne qualité.
- gratuit.
- trophées ultra-faciles pour les chasseurs.

Et c'est tout. Amusez-vous bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226609248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1485260860}
review:
Nem húzom hosszúra, nem érdemli meg.
Egy ilyen regénynél az ember elvárná a karakterek ábrázolását ám itt örülhetsz, ha 10x látod őket a két rész alatt, kapsz helyette ablakot, eget és autóbelsőt idegesítő hangefekttel és sírással. No, ha a sírásról van szó, nem fogsz sírni, annyira rossz az egész történet felépítése, hogy se időd se türelmed kapcsolódni a szereplőkhöz, hogy aztán a sorsuk miatt elmorzsolj egy könnycseppet. Persze szomorú, de meh... gyenge. A második rész próbál hozzáadni a dologhoz azzal, hogy az egyik szereplőnek elédtárja a háttértörténetét, de egyszerűen nem képes még ezzel se felépíteni egy karaktert. Persze, halálos betegség meg élje át az ember mielőtt leszólja, de ez van, az írás maga csak ponyva szinten van, a félreütésekről nem is beszélve. Egy ilyen gyenge írást nem tudok komolyan venni még úgy semmilyen szempontból.
(Van egy másik kiadása is a regénynek ahol részenként kell fizetned a történetekért, egyrészt ez egy borzasztó irány másrészt a Narcissu 1/2 után már semmi remény nincs abban, hogy a többi történet jó lesz.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198240898030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1489801992}
review:
Ich habe gerade mal knapp eine Stunde gespielt und muss sagen, dass es mir jetzt schon sehr gut gefällt.
Die Musik ist einfach unfassbar fantastisch und man merkt schnell was für eine traurige/krasse story hinter dem ganzen steckt. 
Zwar ist es auf der Visuellen Ebene echt nichts krasses und man bekommt nur diese kleinen Bilder zu sehen die (zumindest bisher) meisst ziemlich unspannend sind. Die wundervolle Musik gleicht das aber ziemlich aus und...ja man sollte sowas eben wirklich wegen der Story spielen und nicht großartig wegen den Bildern. Für Grafik kann man dann gerne Animes gucken, aber ich finde es hier nicht sehr schlimm. Man muss auch immernoch bedenken, dass es kostenlos ist und, dass es von 2007 ist.

Bin auf diese Teile übrigens durch den 3. Teil gekommen, da dort viele gemeint haben, dass der 3. Teil hauptsächlich was für Fans des 1. und 2. Teiles ist. Wenn die Story dort auch gut ist/bleibt und die Grafik im 3. auch ein wenig interessanter ist (wahrscheinlich auch wenn nicht) kann ich mir gut vorstellen mir den 3. Teil zu kaufen.

Probiert es einfach mal aus, immerhin ist es ja kostenlos! Für mich ist es die 2. Visual Novel, wobei ich bei der ersten (Sweetest Monster) auch erst sehr wenig Spielzeit habe.

Achja was das Englisch angeht: Ich muss mit den Englisch-Kentnissen die man bis Klasse 9 so hat und die ich bei meinem Dasein im Internet so erlangt habe schon immer wieder mal den Übersetzer nutzen, allerdings ist das meisstens nicht zwingen nötig, sondern nur wenn mans ganz genau wissen will. Mit dem meissten komme ich also klar (im gegensatz zu "Sweetest Monster", da ist es sehr viel mehr "Fach-Englisch".

LG :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015151479', 'num_games_owned': 2341, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1489772233}
review:
Una delle novel più toccanti in cui mi sia mai imbattuto. 

Installata giusto per curiosità data la sua natura gratuita e i molti pareri positivi, me ne sono davvero innamorato in poco tempo. Ho apprezzato in particolar modo Narcissus 2nd, sorta di prequel della storia originale, che pur affrontando le medesime tematiche della prima offre una visione più ampia e meno circonstanziata, con un cast più allargato ed assortito e personaggi, a mio giudizio, meglio caratterizzati ed empatici. Ma resta solo una mia particolare preferenza, dettata probabilmente anche da una maggior aspetto "moe" che la permea rispetto alla più fredda e laconica Narcissus 1.

Sia come sia si tratta di un'opera che, pur non brevissima come ci si potrebbe aspettare (circa 10 ore di gameplay), vale assolutamente la pena giocare. 

Bei personaggi, storia toccante, buon ritmo, tanti *FEELS* , comparto grafico molto gradevole, e una OST a dir poco magnifica e che potrete ascoltare a piacimento tramite il comodo jukebox integrato una volta terminata la novel.

Cosa si può volere di più? Ah si. Narcissus 3rd ovviamente :D

昨晚通关后睡觉时和今天一直都在无限循环op，脑海里无限重复着最后男主给濑津美不断的拍照和濑津美的笑容就莫名的心塞。换衣服时的羞涩，对于胸口伤痕的自卑，买衣服时候的兴奋，悔恨的泪水以及最后拍照时的笑容无时不刻的触动着我，能接触到这个游戏真的是太好了。

[spoiler]“笑一笑吧，濑津美”[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198165225821', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1495558123}
review:
剧情上分了多个章节来讲述不同的事情，每个章节里都有一个很明确的内容，虽说 chap1 就已经告诉了最终结果，但是中间每个章节发生的事情还是能激起个人「曾经想要尝试却未曾尝试的感觉」也挺好的。
bgm 上可以当做工作时来听的水平（还有淡淡的忧伤）。
最有趣的是画面，全程没有出现所谓的现代主流的配置方式，全程下来之后会有种「一旦接受了这种设定，那很棒哦.jpg」不过在『创作理念』栏里作者也说了为什么会这样子去做，在看过 Extra Notes 之后，也能感觉到作者想要表达出一种和「其它的」并不一样的东西。

记录之外：
水仙是听过很多人说过，但是一直没有去玩，因为种种偶然这次推了下，目前在用的公交塑料卡套就是水仙的（projectlights），嘛，其实最主要还是想看一看剧情到底是什么样子就是……关于医院中的病人在做什么事情，最终还是取决于自身所拥有的「自由」与「希望」，大概对窝来说，主题就是这样，以上。（至于中间出现的那种让自己时不时想起也想做类似的小动作，甚至能让自己稍微激动下的地方也是まじやばくね。）

author: {'steamid': '76561198090413183', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1496395255}
review:
通过贴吧的汉化版玩过了水仙1，通过此剧情无可避免的会想起了eden中的末世情节，水仙1比起eden的气氛渲染有过之而无不及，而且更具现实意义。

我有位女同学也曾进过重症监护室，大概询问过她当时的感受，或许也与剧中人物相似，不知道是在面对死亡时依旧没有实感，又或是打击太突然，以致于看起来像是别人的事一样。不过已经不重要了，虽然她现在依旧体弱多病，但比起濑津美，我们都已经获得了太多太多。

是否我们在那一天到来之日也能像濑津美那样微笑着，怀着感恩的心走向死亡呢？

author: {'steamid': '76561198362551190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1487172941}
review:
總體來說會推薦這款遊戲.
非要說缺點的話, 2nd 的序章應該挪到extra, 正章完結後才開啟, 能使整個故事的風調更加一致.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156819556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1486994968}
review:
死亡本身不可怕，可怕的是等待死亡。

水仙1、2合集，情节上2代是1代的前传。2代比1代内容更多，也详细解释了女主在1代中行为的原因。
总阅读量较小，以小标题划分不同章节。
steamcn有分享的汉化，可以解锁steam成就。

购买dlc可以库存加一，dlc是原声合集（主题曲挺好听的，有爱可以入）。

成就很好完成，分别用有语音模式和无语音模式看完1、2两代（用一个语音模式完成一遍后，第二遍重新开始游戏时直接选择最后一个小标题用另一种语音模式ctrl快进即可），解锁4个成就。最后一个是看完两代，在游戏初始界面增加一个新的章节，阅读完即可解锁隐藏成就。

author: {'steamid': '76561198098371909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1561996598}
review:
I finished reading the Visual Novel for the first time on my PSP when I was looking for  a good ported VN for PSP. I was so drawn into the story that somehow my depression suddenly vanishes and gives me a new reason to live my not so good life. Narcissu is a story about terminally-ill people who somehow, even though there's no more hope in their life, carried to do something that every terminally-ill people want to do. And that is to die where they want to die.

I bought the copy of the Light Novel in my own language when it was on sale on some local anime convention. And I can proudly say that Narcissu is one of the best linear VN out there that's also great for people who want to play VN for the first time. I bought the 10th Anniversary Anthology Project because I want to support the developer to make a jewel that is on par with Narcissu.

In short, Narcissu are one of those story that can change your life forever.

review: Got to say when I first came across this vn I scrolled the comments first. Seeing all the teary-eyed comments had me going, it cant be that bad. Gladly, I was proven wrong and found myself blubbering by the end. Had to walk away a couple of times (almost as bad as *eden). You know what your getting yourself into and its like a slowed down version of a recorded crash, (you can forsee the end at the beginning and you know its coming but there's nothing you can do to stop it).  Emotional rollercoaster 10/10 I loved it and will look forward to the creators other works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356583618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1528513403}
review:
结束960km的旅程，结束两人15天的旅程，也结束濑津美22年的旅程……

bgm给人一种安静略带一点压抑的感觉，十分符合游戏气氛..就算单独拿出来听也是很棒a..

[spoiler]人们之所以追求希望是因为他们知道只要努力就有可能达成梦想，但是我一开始就知道我不可能达成，所以我放弃了一切。[/spoiler]

剧情很短，但是感触很深..

author: {'steamid': '76561198281036688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1486266627}
review:
个人Steam上第一款全成就的游戏 ——《Narcissu》（水仙），一个关于2个人，15天，960km旅程的故事，一个平静而又普通的故事，一个感（zhi）人（yu）至深的故事。此时此刻，在地球的另一边，淡路岛上的水仙如今正在灿烂地绽放吧。

《水仙》应该是这两年我看过最打动人心的短篇小说（我一直不把这类游戏视为“游戏”），放在文学领域这也是短篇小说中的精品。搭配文字的BGM满分，可以说视觉小说是文学、音乐和绘画三类艺术的完美结合。这其中的体验就好像是你一边看带有插画的小说一边听轻音乐。一个人在夜晚静静地看完这部作品是最好的，故事只是平静地描述一个平凡女子最后的人生旅程，其中没有出现痛哭流泪的场景，只是淡淡叙述娓娓道来，更能引发读者对于生命的思考。这样的故事并不特别，然而却意外地打动人。满分的音乐配上忧伤的文字，看完之后有种说不出的惆怅感。后来查了一下才知道作者片冈智晴是根据自己身边发生真实事件改编的，果然艺术都是源于生活而高于生活啊。

翻了好久的测评也没有看到这篇自述式散文，这里就贴一下链接。文章是片冈写在ラムネ （ http://bgm.tv/subject/2358 ） 的staffroom里面的，由bangumi ID：七文（R大）翻译，原文链接： http://bgm.tv/blog/47028

散文回忆了1980年发生在作者身边的一些事情。当时片冈13岁，里面出现的S美是《水仙》女主濑津美的原型。另外怕会影响理解这里说明一下，片冈的全名是Kataoka Tomo，文中S美对他的称呼从K到T是一种变得亲近的表现。

author: {'steamid': '76561198349859182', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1485525824}
review:
Narcissu  2nd 的最后4章，我是除夕这天晚上才推完的，即使前面的剧情早在几天前就看到了，最后的部分，从姬子那严肃的语气开始，我就不忍心看下去了，于是我用了CTRL，完成了剩下的3个成就，本来可能，我觉得再也不会去碰它的，但是这是今年的最后一天。[b]让她们绚烂的留在这烟花之夜，似乎也不错吧？	[/b]

于是我又打开了它。老实说，2真的比1触动的多，因为它连结了所有的部分。那样奋不顾身进入大海的，拥有五万日元的记下日本地图的濑津美，那个洒脱温柔的姬子，那个男主角，他们每个人都相连，给我们讲述了 这一个故事。

本来我想，我再怎么也不会哭的，后来，终章的最后的最后，我还是眼泪冒出来了。
[h1]她/他说:
"…让留下来的人…笑着活下去…" 	[/h1]

[b]所以，也请你笑着活下去。
因为我们足够幸福。	[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050385684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1485284535}
review:
J'avais une idée très négative des VN jusqu'à.. ..Narcissu

Et là..
wow... Il faut un peu connaitre la mentalité japonaise et être sensible un minimum pour apprécier la réelle profondeur de cette histoire courte d'une petite dizaine de petits chapitres très digestes, très émouvant..

Ce n'est pas le style littéraire qui fait l'oeuvre ici, mais la sincérité de l'écriture et des personnages que l'on y trouve...

Bravo! Bravo! 

j'ai pris la version FR disponible sur le site officiel http://kawasoft.fr/narcissu/telechargement.php

author: {'steamid': '76561198305808904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1591844475}
review:
this game completely and utterly OBLITERATED me emotionally. i shed so many testosterone filled tears i feel completely drained. if someone wants to know what having your soul crushed in the vice of vengeful god feels like then look no further than this visual novel.
dispite having minimal character visuals it has god-tier writing and music to more than make up for it. i can't recommend this enough. anything that can emotionally devastate me like this i hold to the highest regards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300846558', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1484640190}
review:
死生観と日常がテーマの一本道ノベルゲーム
死生観に対する様々な価値観が交錯し、どの登場人物の心境を辿っても胸を抉られる。読み手次第で意味が変わってくるであろうセリフが多くあるので、考えさせられるものや込み上げてくるものがある。
ゲーム事態は小一時間で読み終わるボリュームにも関わらず、ずっしりと重たく中身のある内容に仕上がっている。bgmも素晴らしく好く有るノベルゲー特有の中だるみもなくテンポ良く進むので 読み物が苦手な人でも読みやすいはず。

EDでのBGM先輩仕事しすぎです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198257740218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1463762885}
review:
Narcissu is very well known amongst those who play visual novels, whilst the style of a kinetic novel may not suit everyone, the story will definitely keep you captivated.

Death is inevitable for everyone, seeing it from the perspective of someone who knows they have very little time left and not being able to understand how to feel about it really makes you think about life and death and what they really mean.  I highly recommend Narcissu, the story is wonderful and will leave you upset, yet somewhat content and accepting of the situation the characters are in.

review:
经过十个小时的游玩，或者说阅读更合适吧，看看停停，读档回味，终究还是打完了，从姬子和小女孩，到濑津美和姬子，再到优和濑津美，最后千寻和优，每个主角交替着扮演阿洛伊斯和尼洛的角色，眼看着他人的离去，再到自身踏上死亡，不断承受着悲哀，连我这位看客也感受到无比的压抑。
笑一笑吧，濑津美……

author: {'steamid': '76561198123895876', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1433370263}
review: Naricasu was one of my favourite animes in the entire world. I am a huge light novel reader and have read many editions of "Cory in the house". I believe that this takes Cory in the House to a whole new level. Cory Baxter was my idol all through my adolescent years as I was beginning to experience change. Cory's struggles with the presidents daughter always led me to think... why? Why... The thought that goes into everyones mind while reading/watching the show(only hardcore Cory lovers read the novels)... But thats when it came to me. Naricasu. The same writer as the writer of the Cory in the House novels. Naricasu was made FOR Cory in the house! All the evidence is here... Naricasu makes you think of Cory, and Cory makes you wonder why... Why... 3 letters in why... 3 sides of a triangle... ILLUMINATI? No, it couldnt be... But now that Im thinking about it, it all makes sense... the evidence was in front of our face the entire time and we didnt even know it! Cory is black. 5 letters in black... 5 + 5 gives us 10... 10 letters in Illuminati! Still not convinced? I wasn't either. But this last fact will surely make you believe me. NARICASU rhymes with DONT EAT MY SOUP... Dont eat my soup rhymes with hoola hoop... Yes, this is surely the final step... If we take the word HOOLA and take away the letters H, O, O, L, and A away, and then write hte word ILLUMINATI, we get the word, ILLUMINATI. Coincidence? I think not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206988028', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1586469251}
review:
[h1] Добро пожаловать в «стерильно чистое, белое место, где потолок выше обычного, а окна открываются не более чем на пятнадцать сантиметров» [/h1] 

[i] Мой разум всегда будоражила мысль о способности всякой истории повлиять на мышление человека, его эмоциональное состояние или об умении просто задержаться в его голове. И до некоторой степени безумно, что история помещена туда абсолютно посторонним человеком, но не теряет из-за этого в близости тебе.
Но как так происходит? Почему абсолютно любой может повлиять на тебя со своим сказанием, каким последнее должно быть? А всё очень просто и сложно одновременно: необходимо быть искренним и вложить частичку себя.
[b] Stage-nana [/b]  самые что ни на есть обыденные и "повседневные" разработчики, которые выпустили в 2007 году заурядную, на первый взгляд, кинетическую новеллу.
Они оперировали саундтреком, небольшим объемом текста и весьма регрессивной картинкой на тот момент, но им, в отличие от множества других разработчиков, в действительности удалось подарить мне пропасть приятных воспоминаний, рой мыслей и великое множество нежнейших чувств. Отсюда моё восприятие затуманено, а рука рисует лишь положительную картину мира этой игры. [/i] 
[b] Но я попробую быть объективным. [/b] 

[b] Сюжет  [/b] [i]  в Нарциссах повествует о двух больных людях, девушке и парне, которые покорно ожидают свою неизбежную смерть, в следствии неутешительного диагноза, на белых и стерильных просторах, особого, 7 этажа. Но что-то происходит и ситуация кардинально меняется. [/i] 

[b] Графическая составляющая, [/b] [i] как я писал выше, на действительно среднем уровне. Однако это не мешает игре выглядеть атмосферно и весьма самобытно, особенно на фоне современных новелл. Тот же планетарий от студии "Key" сделан в похожем стиле и оба труда являются культовыми. [i] 

[i] Важнейшей частью игры является [/i] [b] саундтрек[/b] . [i] Чрезвычайно тонкий, драматичный и всеобъемлющий, он буквально пронизывает тебя самыми разношерстными эмоциями, заставляя переживать, радоваться, смеяться, словно именно ты главный герой новеллы. [/i] 

[b] Текста [/b] [i]  в игре много и написан он хорошо, ошибок в английской версии игры я не замечал, а русского языка в самом стиме нет, но есть замечательный перевод от группы энтузиастов. [/i] 

[b] Narcissu [/b] [i]  - это алмаз среди визуальных новелл. При своём бюджете, сложностях разработки в данном сегменте и прочих трудностях на момент создания игры, Stage-nana удалось погрузить нас в замечательную историю, которая способна подарить вам целую жизнь, полную горечи и радости, всего за один вечер. [/i] 
[b] Рекомендую к прочтению. [/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=703257961

author: {'steamid': '76561198147976791', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1563226438}
review:
Una novela visual muy purista: No hay ningún tipo de toma de decisiones, no hay cambios en la historia, simplemente son un par de historias contadas de la mejor manera posible. Eso si, preparate para los "feelings".

Cualquiera de las dos historias que se incluyen son atrapantes, en algún momento se pueden hacer un poco largas y al principio cuesta distinguir que personaje esta hablando, pero una vez que te acostumbras te vas dando cuenta como todas las historias se van enlazando para explicar cada detalle de las mismas. La banda sonora logra de manera muy satisfactoria la inmersión en la historia que se te esta contando.

Es una lástima que no este traducida al español, pero si no tienes problemas con el idioma ingles, la recomiendo muchisimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1465114325}
review:
tldr: Narcissu is made of feels.

Do you wish to die alone, or to burden those who care about you with your passing? It is sad, but we are all mortal, and we will all die. This is the story of people waiting for inevitable death, their struggle and their heartwarming strength to try and accept this. It is a story of life, but not all lives are long.

Narcissu is not a story of tragedy: It is not a story made to hurt you but it will hurt. You will cry but they will not only be tears of sadness. It will fill you with (platonic) love, loss, and acceptance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121326457', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1583917778}

author: {'steamid': '76561198339841629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1527466133}
review:
在接触这个游戏之前我的人生都是白过的吧
大概
第一次接触是在某游戏网站下1st和2nd
那时候因为父母经常为了小事吵架
并且将事情的原委都丢在我们兄弟身上
有一天将一切怪罪到哥哥的成绩不乐观和学费上
也许是一时冲动脱口的吧
我们就开始自暴自弃闭门不出
拒绝和父母交流
这游戏也许是我人生的救赎
因为这个游戏我们开始愿意和父母谈话
哥哥复学了我因为跟不上课程虽然可以勉强及格
但是我明知自己的程度不想浪费学费而弃学
也想过出去打拼但是被十分反对现在留在了母亲的身边
水仙2因为乱码所以没能接下来看剧情感觉可惜
一开始比较自卑的我第一次觉得在这个世界上活下去
是多么幸福的事情
有种说不出来的感觉
就只是活着就感到幸福
故事不是很长游戏采用视觉小说的方式叙述故事
这只有不到500mb的游戏十分沉重
为了不涉及剧透我就不说明了
请不要为了一个免费的成就跳过
好好看下内容也许会改变你的人生
特别是姫子最后的一次旅程
开车到了非常非常远的地方
这段令人感触颇深
[被留下来的人应该怎么做]
这是每个想着舍弃生命的人都该思考的事情
不要对一切感到绝望
即使辛苦活下去总会有明天
最后是个人感想
BGM给我深刻的印象就是伤感和欢快的共鸣
我最喜欢的几个篇章应该是ver.2第18章的为了谁和19的魔法了
这个游戏的结局令人惊讶的鲜明
姫子为了被留下的人留下了愿望
这化为了濑津美的希望
虽然没接触3rd听说濑津美选择自杀了
但是那也一定是为了谁而选择的幸福的方法
留下来的也许不会是希望
但是愿望一定一定会实现的
总的来说这是前两章是作者对自杀者的感伤
而在末尾表示了期盼
而3rd应该是想给笔下人物一个选择的权利
也许不是一个好的结局
也许和第一二章的剧情出现了矛盾
但是这也是能接受的
在最后希望大家一直像濑津美一样能微笑着面对一切

author: {'steamid': '76561198121287343', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1527421793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041060283', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1629904551}
review:
淡淡忧伤触及心弦到想哭的作品！上古催泪弹
和星之梦同一时代的轻小说AVG，当时仅BGM无音效、无OST的遗憾现在也得到了满足。不得不说，看到标题的一刹啥是激动的，又有点感叹岁月时间流逝，现在很少时间可以尽情沉浸在这样淡淡故事中回忆了。
回到游戏，这部作品叙事风格比较清新，[spoiler] 主人公（还有世界？）虽然身患绝症，但仍然带有些许无奈暖的过着剩余的日子。有种对生命的向往和对自由的追求，看完之后嘴角带笑之余仍然有一抹无法擦拭的淡淡忧伤。[/spoiler]很喜欢的情节，整个小说剧情不长，差不多5个小时的文字量，没有分支可选、没有波澜壮阔的争执和转折，但不失为一份体验生活之美的作品。
1相对2个人觉得更为经典，但是2的剧情更丰富，而且这次2里面的插曲（在Chapter4最后，就是游戏介绍的那首曲子），简直完美！强烈推荐买OST。英语翻译只尝试了第一个，感觉已经很到位了，所以没有对第二个翻译版本进行确定，应该都是不错的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066319006', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1468130247}
review:
Bueno primero que todo, esta novela lo que tiene de bueno principalmente, es que es gratuita, ya que no hay que pagar absolutamente nada, y NO es una demo y un free to play, sino una novela visual completa. como es una novela visual, obiamente este clase de juego solo les gustara a los otakus o amantes del anime, que seria mi caso.

La historia es algo melanconica, pues no es una novela de comedia, ni de ecchi, sino una de del genero recuerdos de la vida, ya que es una historia nos puede pasar a cualquiera, y lo unico que tienes que hacer es hacer clip y dejar que los personajes te cuente la historia del juego, nada mas, esta novelas solo tiene una ruta unica, por el cual no busques formas de cambiar la historia, pues no se podra.

en cuanto la parte tecnica, lo nueno es que son 2 novelas en una, pero lo malo es que esta en ingles, por el cual debes dominar un ingles basico/intermedia para entender la historia, tambien sirve como escusa para mejorar tu ingles, aunque la comunidad tiene un parcher para traducir el primer juego al español, lamentablemete para el segundo juego no hay.

en conclusion esta novela se lleva una nota de 5/10 y nada mas, no es videojuego hardcore, sino una simpre novela para relajarse y difrutar de una gran historia y derramar lagrimas

author: {'steamid': '76561198348021250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1482247966}
review: 簡單樸實，沒有造作的虛偽，沒有假意的熱血，如同明信片般的風景畫佐以親柔的音樂，毫無疑問是視覺小說的上上之選

author: {'steamid': '76561198260381078', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1482569049}
review:
......就这样 这个12小时的故事结束了...对我来说半天 对她们来说则是一生的故事结束了 
她们拥有汽车 拥有药物 拥有地图 但却没有时间 没有未来 以自己的意识反抗现实 其他人只能以冷漠的目光来旁观 虽然不想承认 虽然很悲哀 也清楚的知道这是常有的事 不过也知道 这就是现实的一部分 只是觉得...这个世界很冷淡
非常致郁的一部游戏 两个身患绝症的人的在生命最后的故事 原本以为自己看过了各种类似的鸡汤了 不得不说这个游戏以另一种视角重新诉说了这个残酷的主题  原来悲伤的故事还能有这种写法   令人眼前一亮确实是打动我了 
不想对剧情本身做什么叙述 我也没有这样的文笔能写出来自己的所感 只能说一万个读者中有一万个哈姆雷特 能说出来的就不是感想而是浅显的评测了 2nd相比1有了更多的cg 人物画风也更好了 至于剧情既然是2nd肯定要与1st作比较 虽然两个故事都有濑津美然而我更倾向将这两者分离开来 比较在这里毫无意义 如果非要选的话 自然是1st中男女主两个人的气氛先入为主的感受比较强烈~hh   撇开剧情濑津美的cv在我看来也是一个很有魅力的地方 尤其是“じゃ”念得 听着对心脏不好

author: {'steamid': '76561198047249452', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1485821834}
review: I revisit this when I need to cry sometimes. It gets me every time for many reasons. I return after time has passed, and wonder, will I still cry? It breaks numbness. The plot is that deep; it makes you feel when you are so numb emotionally, you could pass as a robot. Highly recommended. Memento mori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079704709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1471654010}
review:
The game is amateurish if matched it to most modern VNs, but the story was strong and meaningful. The plot consists of two hospitalized characters, one whom is us (male character) and the other who is female. You really do get a feel for the characters as the story unfolds, and learn about the conflict and what course of actions the characters take, no matter how rash it may appear. 

Fun fact: the 2nd is actually a pre-sequel of the 1st. 

The arts and music in the game were harmonious, and really did set the mood in the story. I'm not to keen on playing it again, but it is defintely worth a try for anyone who hasen't yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219805677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1481627938}
review:
[h1]More the fool, I.[/h1]

So there I was in the wee small hours of the morning rubbing my sleepy eyes and thinking that maybe I'd spend a few minutes with a visual novel before turning in. That's right. [b]More the fool, I.[/b] I was still awake hours later with moist eyes and pondering what I'd just experienced. Narcissu 1st & 2nd deals with death and dying and the unfair fate of being terminally ill and expiring young before having much of a chance at living. It's also about those left behind. It's a story ( a group of stories, really) that is very complex, yet told in a very simple and endearing way. It's easy to see what a labor of love this is for the author.

A few small pointers:
[list]
[*]Don't rush this one. Set aside some time and take it slow.
[*]It doesn't seem to matter what order it's read in, but understand that Narcissu 2nd is something of a prequel.
[*]As mentioned above, Narcissu 1st & 2nd deal with death. It may not be suitable for small children.
[/list]
[b]TL;DR   A very moving story about the terminally Ill. Highly recommended.[/b] 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175164081', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1521192156}
review:
"Well then, one last thing"
"...Smile for me. Setsumi..."
-------------------------------------------
水仙是一部很出色的小品作，各种意义上。
它不是gal，没有华丽的cg，没有豪华的声优阵容，也没有丰富的可攻略的角色。它只是一个视觉小说，只有一些简陋的背景画，只有不算特色但是有在努力演出的配音，还有一个性格有些孤僻的女主，适合在安静的环境下慢慢看完。不过，它的音乐倒是相当出色了，甚至能算上这部作品的核心之一。
其实在我看来，水仙的剧情并不算得上很出色，从主人公的旅程开始到结束，有些地方可能略显突兀，叙述也算不上精彩，但是表现力并不差，甚至其带给我的震撼不亚于eden这种作品。我觉得很大程度上归功于本作的独特切入视角——医院7楼的人。对这些原本过着普通生活的人来说，任何的情感价值，任何的未来理想在生死门前都显得过于苍白无力，这种无力感和人类对美好生活的向往和对希望的渴求形成巨大的反差，在这种矛盾的情况下，人们会怎样想，怎样做是水仙的精彩所在。
用这种独特的视角，细腻的心理描写，水仙展示了在死亡倒计时的情况下，主人公言行、性格、甚至价值观的突变，其中包括对通常所认为的“善良”的否定，对生活和命运的思考等等。
这个问题并不只是病人的事，同样也是一个社会问题。作者从一开始就给出的社会背景自杀数据，以及始终贯彻始终的对病人身边朋友、家人和所处环境的社会环境描写，都赋予了这个故事一定社会意义。
整个故事有些浪漫主义的感觉，结局也是一个十分浪漫主义的结局，我个人还是觉得不错的，女主转过身回应男主，脸上同时带着泪痕和笑靥这两种最美丽的面部表情，这一幕在我玩完后一直浮现在我眼前。没有eden那样撕心裂肺的诀别，但是这样的平淡中带着无比的感伤和震撼，可以称得上一个普通人的悲剧。
2代作品是1代的前传，是对1代中一些背景和细节的补充，使得1代故事更加完善，女主更加立体，不过在情感和表现力上不如1代了，感觉或许核心部分还是水仙1中的故事吧？

author: {'steamid': '76561198238293872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1480828718}
review:
----------内含少量剧透----------
本评测仅针对于『Narcssu』，『SIDE 2nd』、『3rd-Die Driette Welt-』都逊色于初代作品。綦尽其力，片岡とも在之前之后都再没有超越水仙的作品存在了，其后的『雨之边缘』套用了水仙的O.S.T.，不过其脚本过于随意，难以比肩水仙。为不影响对优秀初代的评价，分开测评是合理的。
水仙是我接触的比较早的一部ADV，虽然全程都没有选项，原画少的可怜，而且缺乏后期，游戏性几乎没有，各方面都勉强及格，但依然不妨碍一个好故事撑起整个游戏，或许称不上神作，但依然称得上是部佳作，没有Ifinity系列的Ever17、Never7，Muv-luv Alt-带给人的震撼，但一如车轮般匀速前进的情节，在一种静谧中走向终结，这足以致郁人好久，由故事更引出的关于社会与生死的思考，使得脚本创作具有同类型巅峰的素质。
经过了几度的芟繁就简，水仙的文本容量可谓简约。总的时间不超过两个小时，如果看得快的话一小时之内都可以推完，少有的极短的galgame。从故事最初浮现的自杀人数。便注定了这会是个悲剧，全篇的基调也是充斥悲伤，沉重，凝重以致绝望。
故事中讲到希腊神话中Narcssus少年的故事，Narcssus因为自己的美貌而坠河，Echo因为无法表白，凄美的声音在树林中回荡成echo。这让我想起Paulo Coelho『牧羊少年奇幻之旅』在楔子中对水仙男孩故事的引用，引自Oscar Wilde，河水哭泣注视着Narcssus眼睛里自己的倒影而忘了记下男孩的容貌。与自恋无关，『Narcssu』的故事同样在一种凄美中走向自灭，不过去掉了“s”(suicide)，淡路岛上的零落的水仙花，都表达着这种美。悲剧产生自历史必然的要求与这个要求实际上不可能实现（恩格斯），不过水仙的悲剧更多的是社会在此之上推波助澜，两度进入7F，最终让瀬津美走向了绝路。在旅途上阿东优的陪伴无疑是全篇最温馨的部分，虽然故事中瀬津美孤独造成了她琢磨不透的心思和与年龄不相仿佛的成熟，使得她给人的代入感薄弱。不过依然能从细节处发现她对男主的好感，最后的微笑更是故事最美的瞬间，瀬津美在微笑中释怀，结束了旅行，是故事的又一次升华，也是一种遗憾，教人扼腕。
日语推不动的话可以选择gp32译的，因为其在agilis之后并参考改进了后者，当然我们也可以等待官方汉化，或者直接上民间汉化的。这里给出Sekai Project Narcissu 10周年纪念众筹：
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/sekaiproject/narcissu-10th-anniversary-anthology-project
片岡とも在游戏中推荐不要开配音，并不是本篇的配音素质问题，而是瀬津美的声音抑制了情感表达，而且语速稍慢。靠脑补的话或许会有更细致的感触。
btw：瀬津美所患的不是囊性纤维变性(cystic fibrosis)而是某种心脏病。

review:
All aboard the cry train, destination: tearsville!!
So yeah, it's a kinetic novel, about terminal illness, and how the sick people and people around them deal with this. Obviously you shouldn't go into this expecting to come out feeling all happy and carefree, but it does manage to touch on subjects that a lot of games would steer away from. 7/10!

review: narcissu is an absolutely breathtaking VN in an interesting style that keeps you focused on the story, providing atmosphere with stunning scenery and gorgeous music. the plot and the characters are touching in way that will be refreshing for VN veteran and get those new to the genre absolutely hooked- bring lots of tissues with you for this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093312686', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1482976191}
review:
Though bit old, Narcissu surely is timely classic that all Visual Novel fans should play. Beautiful cinematics, art, music, voice acting (though few and far between), and writing are all what make this an experience that will leave an impression on even the coldest of hearted.

The game explores the concepts of youth, freedom, illness, and [spoiler]suicide[/spoiler]. By the end of the game, the quiet atmosphere and story had me tearing up, with the game lingering on my mind for days on end. Simple, linear, and no decision making makes this a rather straightforward title, however this doesn't detract from the enjoyability by any means.

A great free introduction for those interested in the Anthology Project too! 

https://store.steampowered.com/app/426690/Narcissu_10th_Anniversary_Anthology_Project/ 

A MUST HAVE for both veterans and newcomers to the visual novel genre!
Thank you, stage-nana !

author: {'steamid': '76561198329526289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1480096109}
review:
因為可以免費遊玩，所以相當值得推薦跑一遍。

建議第一次玩時打開語音，比較容易知道是誰在說話。

review: Sehr bewegende Geschichte. Trotz Englisch erzeugt es mit der Musik und den japanischen Stimmen an den richtigen Stellen für eine sehr gedrückte Stimmung und hat mich sehr mitfühlen lassen. Eigentlich wollte ich nur kurz hineinlesen, blieb dann aber gleich für eine längere Zeit dabei. Die Geschichte ist sehr fesselnd und man möchte wissen, was die Darsteller mit ihrer Zeit noch schaffen wollen. Ohne Tränen kommt man hier glaube ich nicht aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173111531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1479993070}
review:
这款游戏我是初中才接触到的，从Keyfansclub的板块中看到了水仙
在结局之前我一直以为这是个从悲观中获得救赎的故事
但没想到是这么残酷的方式获得的救赎
但也许这是濑津美能从7F的生活中所能想到的最好的方式吧
960km旅途  15天的过程 22年的生命
都在淡路岛的水边
如水仙一样凋零逝去

当人生有了目标时，生命的意义就因此浮现。

但是濑津美她明白的太晚太晚了...
但也正因为这样  这个作品才让人这么难以忘怀

review:
I couldn't complete the game, it was very sad yeah, but that's just part of a reason. My aunt died at the same time I played this game, this is the biggest coincidence of my life. It was so sad game, and then I hear something awful as the tragedy was told. She died in a hospital. This game is about hospital..

...Anyways, as I saw the start of the game and no other game have yet gave me sad feelings (only tv series and movies), so I nominated this game as "The “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award " in 2016 Steam Awards.

review:
一个简单的故事，短短的篇幅中，只有生与死。在面对死亡的时候，生的意义是什么？或许，存在过，就是它的意义。
很久以前玩过的水仙，治愈我的不仅是它的故事，还有它的bgm。
水仙没有什么特别的地方，就是一篇简单的故事，但是是我一生的爱。

review: 涙なくしては読み進められないヴィジュアルノベル。そばに箱ティッシュ必須です。治る見込みのない病に冒された少女を取り巻く物語なのですが、恐らくこのような現状を既に知っている方は少ないと思います。ですが、いつどこで自分自身がこのような状況に陥るかはわかりません。とても悲しい物語で結末も救われたとは言えませんが、一読の価値はあると思います。それなりに長さもあるので時間があって元気な時に読むのをお奨めします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198315643604', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1647950709}
review:
已经过去三四年了吧，从把 Narcissu给下下来，起初因为听说是悲剧结局，但是有些抑郁的我没怎么敢玩，直到大概一年前打开了尘封的文件夹，点开了游戏，一口气通关了，可能我已经变了，即使依旧悲伤，但也坦然面对了。记得最深的还是那张照片和BGM,大概永远不会忘记。Narcissu，水仙，对自己的爱，濑津美最后究竟是怎样的感受，我不知道，但大概我永远不会忘记那朵美丽的水仙花。
[spoiler]“我有泳装，也有地图，但是，我却没有未来”[spoiler]
[spoiler]“但是。。。
为什么。。。就不能让我自由地一次呢...”[spoiler]
[spoiler]“我根本没有那么坚强，能够微笑地安慰自己”[spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198080248599', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1479933494}
review:
100/10 在那個降雪的寒冷夜晚 當年的我還是個孩子 極少的接觸到幾款AVG遊戲 其中之一便是水仙 簡潔的UI 並不華麗卻深入人心的作畫 一段段讓人憐愛與悲歎的話語 構成了這樣一部作品 那時的我第一次體會到了 什麼叫做絕望 什麼叫做人生中最後璀璨的時光 知道了人的一生是多麼的脆弱卻又強大 最後一幕的合影 標誌了主角生命的結束 卻又將她生命中所有的光輝 全部定格在了這張拍立得相片中 濑津美的一生 便迎來最後的幸福 水仙花盛開 花開一片 而今日花已非昨日花 相信體驗過本作的每一個人 都會留下淚水吧 但是真正的結局 是銘記的希望 .

2016年11月24日04:35:14 更新評測
願你提名steam最佳獎之一

author: {'steamid': '76561198026847982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1533776292}
review:
[b]Narcissu is a masterpiece among Visual Novels.[/b] To this day I’m saying this game made me sink into Visual Novels as a genre in general. 

It’s a narrative game in which you learn about a deadly disease and suffering of people. Given that’s a Kinetic Novel, there’s no choices or anything like that. But honestly, you don’t need any of that. That way is just perfect for it. The characters are amazing. Have their own personalities and see their diseases in different ways. Most importantly though – they make you (as a reader) realize how precious life is and appreciate things you have and take for granted. The whole story is followed by phenomenal soundtrack, which just adds up the value and heightens the feelings. And when it comes to feelings -> [b]YOU WILL CRY[/b].

I thought years ago this is a masterpiece and it still has not changed. If someone would ask me for recommendations of a Visual Novel, Narcissu takes the first spot. It’s free and delivers a serious blow to the gut that makes you fall in love with it and sink into the genre.

And when I said it will make you cry, I was serious. You can [strike]see [/strike] hear me cry on YouTube in videos, which are in [url= https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF6bMpb7g7_TrBmsqCEkRYAMzWNwZMEST]Narcissu[/url] and [url= https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF6bMpb7g7_Ta88dbJ_cUFGUmrv5_u5fW]Narcissu: Side2nd[/url] playlists. Oh yeah, this free game basically has two games in it!

https://youtu.be/MKh0atXbl14

https://youtu.be/-W6cXlYnMd4

author: {'steamid': '76561198061519611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1478526243}
review:
Narcissu is a kinetic novel (no choices, just reading) about several young people in a hospice (place for the terminally ill). As such, it is a fairly heavy story with none of the fan service/romance type of themes you might see in typical VNs.

I have to say that when I first started, I did not like the art and felt the game was confusing because you can't tell who is talking. The latter is because there is no sprite that shows up on the screen when someone is talking like in typical VNs. After finishing the game (about 4 hours total play time), those complaints are still there, but I was drawn in by the story. I think it is an interesting take on the philosophy of mortality. Just one of those games where you can think about it afterwards and decide whether it makes sense for you or not.

If you are into VNs I think it is worth a couple hours, especially since it is free. 

Tip: When you start a game, it will let you choose between launch screens. It is not obvious that you are actually picking between 1st or 2nd since there is no labeling. You should be playing 1st before 2nd for proper story continuity. You want the left screen for 1st, or right screen for 2nd. If you start the game and it talks about a boy, then you are in 1st. If you start and it takes about a family of girls, you are in 2nd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118301647', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1478201387}
review: This is a review for Narcissu 1st, I'll be doing 2nd later waiting until I recovered. But boy, What a emotional rollarcoaster. You are put into the shoes of a young man at the ripe age of 20 who was admitted to the 7th floor. Meaning he was 'awaiting advanced medical care" when in reality it just meant he was dying and no one could help him. There he met a beautiful women who was shorter but at the same time older than he was. From there bloomed a beautiful relationship. I won't go much farther because it's a story you need to experience yourself.  I do recommend playing through this Visual Novel. Not any choices but the story alone will set you along for a ride. Hell it's been two hours since I beat the game and I'm still crying. Narcissu 2nd Review will have to wait a bit for me to recover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098360244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1477749556}
review:
治愈系神作  水仙花=爱惜自己

游戏评价：
1代2代各1个小时的剧情，音乐和剧情都做得很到位。1代剧情男女，二代女女；
网上汉化很多，不用担心游戏语言问题，而且游戏价格不是很贵，可以得到五个成就；
结局不是很完美，不过确实很令人感动。如果是你，面对已经决定好的人生，还能做些什么呢？

女主曾经说过，我喜欢悲观，这样既不会快乐，但也用不着痛苦。我不赞同。
后来，我才知道原来她要把微笑带给其他人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198148536696', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1561954179}
review:
打通Narcissu1&2也是五六年前的事情了吧，那时正值抑郁症重度时期，
不得不说，濑津美和姬子某种程度上给了我继续活下去的东西，

回头想想当时轻生的自己，，，，舍弃生命什么的，我还不够格...

对我而言，这一定是的救赎

author: {'steamid': '76561198002578537', 'num_games_owned': 1715, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1477315631}
review:
A sad but powerful tale that describes the very real despair and pain of terminal illness patients who have to deal with their impending doom, their feeling of powerlessness, and how they hope to cope with it all.

I'd definitely recommend the first one, and even though the second one helps understand why one of the characters in the first story is the way she is, I thought it took way too long. I liked both, but if I only had Narcissu 1st I wouldn't have complained.

Yeah, definitely check this out. But if you're doing this in one sitting, like I have, make sure to lighten up your mood afterwards. And appreciate life and all it has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077090012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1475247312}
review:
Hace aproximadamente un año me leí la primera novela, y aunque en comparación de otras pueda pecar de "simple" es realmente bonita y emotiva, no es que se haya convertido de mis favoritas ni mucho menos pero es realmente recomendable de leer al ser corta y sobre todo gratuita. Este tipo de historia agradará especialmente a quienes busquen una historia cargada de sentimientos, y esta ocasión tambien con una pizca de crueldad, o dicho de otra manera, realidad.

La segunda novela visual (que viene a ser precuela de la anteriormente nombrada) si al principio me pareció aburrida en comparación con la primera, la segunda mitad me pareció muy pero que muy buena, incluso me hizo llorar en cierto punto. Es una lástima que la primera parte se me hiciera cuesta arriba en algún momento pero me alegro de haber continuado leyendo aún así. 

¿Recomiendo Narcissu 1st y 2nd? Sí, si buscas un tipo de novela visual tranquila y emotiva, ambas historias cumplirán bien su cometido, además de que siendo gratuitas no hay excusas para, al menos, dar una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979897991', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1467985387}
review:
무료에요. 한글패치가 있어요. 
 
조용한장소에서 꼭 비오는 날에  
 
창문을 열고 빗소리를 들으시면서 
 
하시는 걸 추천드려요. 
 
일본의 소설 "설국"에 나오는 그 유명한 첫 문장 
 
"국경의 긴 터널을 빠져나오자, 설국이었다. 밤의 밑바닥이 하얘졌다. 신호소에 기차가 멈춰 섰다." 
 (国境の長いトンネルを抜けると雪国であった。夜の底が白くなった。信号所に汽車が止まった。) 
 
같은 일본특유의 그 담담한 서술이 잔잔한 긴장감이 지속시키며,  
 
너무나 여리고 아름다운 여주인공 사쿠라 세츠미에 의식의 흐름과
 
맞물려 어느새 게임분위기를 지배합니다.
 
전 개인적으로 은색의 쿠페 챕터를 가장 좋아하는데요.  
 
그 챕터에서 흘러나오던 보사노바 재즈곡이 그저 너무나 좋아서,  

OST를 따로 구입해서 저도 차 안에서 운전하면서 가끔씩 즐기고있어요.
  
아참, 도전과제의 수선화 아이콘이 참 예쁜... 
 
이 키네틱 노벨이 당신도 마음에 드셨으면 좋겠어요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242438868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1530591199}
review: These VNs are great for beginners, and veterns of the genre shouldn't shy away from them either. The music and artwork fit splendidly with the narrative of the story. The 1st one I prefer over the 2nd, but this is not a nock on the 2nd. The feels are real, have your tissues ready. The text doesnt break immersion. The plot is mind numbly interesting. But neither is perfect. Both are kinetic novels (No choices) and Im not a huge fan of this. Also, the 2nd provides good backstory to the 1st, but the suspense and mystery are totally killed by the knowledge of the 1st. If you liked these, check out ChuSingura 46+1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008233712', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1474642978}
review:
누구나 한번쯤은 플레이 해봤으면 좋겠다는 생각이 듭니다
내용 누설 때문에 좀 내리겠습니다 아직 플레이 하지 못하신분들은 안보는게 좋을거 같습니다























사실은 저도 군생활때 다쳐서 군병원에 있었던적이 있어서 갑자기 그때가 떠오르게 하네요 
군병원 특성상 핸드폰도 못만지기에 죽을만큼의 지루함을 도서실이나 티비나 산책같은로 밖에 해소하지 못했는데요
정말 죽을병에 걸려서 병원에 있게 된다면 난 무엇을 하게 될까.. 또 뭘 해야만할까라는 막연한 느낌만 들고 
그 상황을 직면하게 된다면 나는 그냥 애초에 세츠미처럼 포기해버릴까.. 히메코처럼 할 수 있는만큼은 한다는 생각을할까..
아니면 그냥 자살을 하게 될까 인생이란건 무슨 의미가 있는건가 많은 생각을 하게 되네요 
정말 죽음에 대해서 여러가지를 생각해보게 됩니다 무조건 하세요!

author: {'steamid': '76561198324394537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1492606540}
review:
この話を読み終えたとき、すべての人が口をそろえて一様に名作だと言い切るかと言えばそうではない気がします、万人受けするとは言えない作品。しかし私のように気に入った人はとても強く、そして長い間忘れられない作品になるでしょう。
劇的な展開は無く、心が強く揺さぶられるわけでもありません。ただ静かで穏やかな気持ちで話を見届けることになります。ですが、ある意味でメッセージ性は強く、私たちに考えるべき課題を提示してくれるようです。この作品を通して自分のことについて考えなおしてみるのもいいかもしれません^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198318058463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1473349223}
review:
Wow okay, I am sure many people may see a easy game to 100% especiallly if they read the guides on steam and realise I quick way around reading it all out I urge people to at least read all of the 1st one; I wasn't too sure about the story at first but at the end I was left with tears in my eyes and on the verge of crying' such a beautiful story even if you do not get it at first. 

It is a simple read yoru way through it, no choice options or anything like that but to me that didn't really matter, that story touched me in such a way that as I said made me have tears in my eyes, while I can not recommend this game to anyone that is more into being active and doing things in what you do rasther than just read, I can recommend it to anyone that has see's a value in the beautifulness of a good story or has been touched emotionally by games or things in the past.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993514796', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1472328608}
review:
My stats seem to be a bit broken for this one since I didn't have Steam open while I read through it but, I truly enjoyed this VN.  I tend to like VN's that get an emotional response from me and, even though the author said that he was trying to avoid doing so, he got one from me.

I still remember when I originally read Narcissu 1st back in 2005.  It hit me hard (whenever a novel of any kind opens up with suicide statistics you know you're in for an emotional ride) but, Side 2nd really fleshed out Setsumi's character in a nice way.  The epilogue even gives us closure for our unnamed reader surrogate protagonist from the first novel which really helped me tie up the loose ends in my mind.

With this being free too, it's an easy recommendation for anyone who enjoys this medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170515406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1492235483}
review: Playing Narcissu is like entering a ring with a professional boxer. Prepare for emotional blow after blow, even when your eyes are swollen and weeping you stay in the ring until the very end. Better have the tissues near. Although the 2nd comes chronologically first I recommend playing 1st then 2nd. 1st helps get you into the world and tells a short sad sweet (albiet slow) story. 2nd is about twice as long and really gets you into the depth of the story of the true protagonists. Well written and nicely acted. Very nicely illustrated backgrounds and lovely if sparse character artwork. One minor complaint in the unrealistic nature of certain part (particularly the journey time in the first part) but if you can quiet the mathematical extreme logical part of your brain and just enjoy the emotional narative Narcissu is well worth the read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190998719', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1473137208}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038743618', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1485367555}
review:
It's very understandable why this game is highly rated and recommended for those new to visual novels. The two vns are free, although there is no fancy CG or dirty scences, you shouldn't find your time wasted on these vns.

Plot: Very well written, able to make you have feels. The story doesn't lie to you.
Characters: You're given just enough information for the characters to be real and the rest is up to you.
Time: You can play both novels in under 5 hours.
Music: Music is pretty and appropriate
Voice Acting: not usually something i review in vn's, but even though i don't speak japanese, the emotion is apparent.
Take the time to read through these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153957783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1521729285}
review: narcissu，一个这辈子都忘不了的名字，记得2015年暑假，玩完几款galgame后，偶尔在steam的推送上看到了它，觉得是什么治愈的作品，于是便去搜索它的汉化，水仙之旅就开始了。开始对这类平淡的作品并没有太大的好奇心，不过剧情以及小美对我的吸引越来越高，以至于最后结束的时候，一号线放了好一会才感慨过来：啊。。。结束了吗？刚玩完的时候，并没有哭，自己心中感受到了第一次沉重，想哭却哭不出来的沉重，它没有像CL的动画那样用实现幸福的光玉来圆一个HE，但是我觉得这种结局才是最好的结局，因为它相当的真实。从此之后narcissu的地位在心目中的地位就变成了第一，超过了CLANNAD。直至今日，它在我心目中神作的地位依旧没有变，当然，以后也不会。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198142447005', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1471714598}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073833195', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1534803974}
review:
Note: I've only finished Narcissu 1st and I'm working on 2nd. Will update review once I finish 2nd. 

This VN has surpassed my expectations, especially for it being a free download (a rarity on Steam and for a VN). Some people mentioned that it's really dated, and I do agree, but it's not a bad thing. The simple graphics and artwork make you appreciate the story more, and leaves everything more to your imagination. The soundrack so far has been amazing, and ties very well with the very melancholy/gloomy mood that 1st is set in. I have a feeling that the majority of my gameplay time will be just listening to the OST. The story was drawn out, but I think that was for the better as well. It allowed you time to connect and sympathize with Setsumi and the Protagonist. I knew what to expect with the ending, as it's typical with Japanese stories and VNs in particular, but man, that ending hit me hard. Tears weren't really shed, but the feels did hit me once I realized what happened. 

A very thought-provoking story, and I highly recommend it. Even if you aren't into the VNs, each story takes only a few hours to complete (Narcissu 1st can be completed in one sitting). Definitely worth the download. Read Narcissu 1st first voiced with English subs if you want to get the best experience.

10/10 would get the feels again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277931368', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1526062182}
review:
Narcissu
感人致深的一部作品，不需要过多言语去评价，只要在我的心中是最棒之一就足够了
建议先通主线[spoiler]濑津美和阿东[/spoiler]再通前传[spoiler]濑津美和姬子[/spoiler]
这样很多东西都方便理解一些
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
[spoiler]姬子：呐，就这样走进海里，会轻松的死掉么？濑津美：我不知道[/spoiler]
[spoiler]姬子：那，我走进海中的时候，你会拉住我么？濑津美：我不知道[/spoiler]
[spoiler]名字是姬子，辉夜姬的姬，小孩子的子，血型是AB，23岁，天秤座，女性，天主教徒，塑料识别手环的颜色是白色[/spoiler]
[spoiler]1999年，世界10亿天主教徒之一，从这个世界上消失了[/spoiler]
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
[spoiler]濑津美：呐，就这样走进海里，会轻松的死掉么？阿东：我不知道[/spoiler]
[spoiler]濑津美，那，我走进海中的时候，你会拉住我么？阿东：你希望我拉住你么？[/spoiler]
[spoiler]但是，在最后一次濑津美问这个问题并向海中走去的时候    阿东：你希望我拉住你么？她没有回答，脚步也没有停下[/spoiler]
[spoiler]她的血型是O型，名字是濑津美，22岁，女性，塑料识别手环的颜色是白色[/spoiler]
[spoiler]这就是她的一切[/spoiler][spoiler]但她也很喜欢比基尼和车，了解全日本的道路[/spoiler]
[spoiler]她也是个会害羞的可爱女孩[/spoiler][spoiler]她的最后的笑容，纪录在一张一次性照片里[/spoiler]
[spoiler]2005年，全世界自杀者中，多了一位[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067443098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1470689639}
review:
Nun wer schon immer keine Lust auf Reizüberflutung, fantastische Musik, eine berührende Lokalisierung oder eine optisch ansprechende Darstellung hatte, kann sich dieses Prachtstück von VN gönnen. 
Der Charakter des Protagonisten ist clichébehaftet, der von Setsumi geradezu beschämend mittelmäßig.
Zugegeben es ist kein Fanservice-Fest wie zum Beispiel Nekopara aber man muss sich schon Zurücklehnen und darüber sinnieren ob ein Spiel eine positive Bewertung verdient wenn der einzig positive Aspekt auf dem fehlen von Borderline-Hentai Szenen beruht.

Insgesamt brauche ich eine komplette Entgiftung meines Körpers und eine Möglichkeit mich um diese verlorene halbe Stunde wieder zu bereichern wobei mich ersteres wahrscheinlich in den Todestrakt der 7F zurückstauchen würdfe und mich zwingen wird mich aus einem 15cm Spalt in den Tod zu stürzen.

Wie man aus dem Gesamtbild meiner Kritik extrapolieren kann hat mich dieses Spiel so kalt gelassen wie eine mitzwanzigjährige totenstarre Leiche im Kühlraum eines Japanischen Salarymans.

Alternativ empfehle ich jedem der seine Dosis Narcissu 1st & 2nd noch nicht eingenommen hat ein Glas Eiter zu leeren.
Versucht nicht mich zu bekehren, 


P_Faktor

review: 早些年玩过第一部，没太多感觉。现在再玩，大概因为自己生了很麻烦的会伴随一生的病（虽然控制的好的话，也能一帆风顺的安度晚年），又在同层病房几乎都是老年人的地方住了一个月的院，所以心境不一样了，更有代入感。总之是一部深入心灵的作品，虽然悲伤但又充满温柔。就个人而言，第二部的触动更深一些。

author: {'steamid': '76561198017655609', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1469417195}
review:
(This review is only about Narcissu 1st, as I have not played the second one yet)

I went into this game with very low expectations, I believe because I stumbled upon a bunch of negative reviews that sounded really reasonable.

My criticisms are basically only about the presentation. Contrary to what you'd read in other reviews, it's not because it's too minimalistic: I respect a conscious decision by a developer, and some people (me included) might even like the approach. My problem is that whoever made this VN has contradicted themselves with weird design choices: judging by the in-game commentary, it seems that the intent of the game was to leave most things up to the player's imagination, and they couldn't decide wether the game had to have voice acting or not, so they gave you the option to choose.

This would have been absolutely the right choice, if it weren't for the fact that the game has the actual characters appear, even if just once or twice throughout the whole VN, which to me completely negates the whole "I want you to imagine it" experimental book approach. It's either contradictory, or I didn't get what the author meant, or he was just referring to imagining the characters voices?

Anyway, all of that is nothing more than a minor complaint: especially for a free game, the story dealt with such a heavy theme in a way that would result "boring" only to people who failed to read between the lines, and truth be told the story and character development is not even that subtle (including having some occasional moe-y tropes, but rare and well placed, and this is coming from someone who doesn't like that kind of thing), yet in its "light" approach it manages not to neglect the serious theme that is being used. In a way, the premise itself is what makes you see such a sequence of seemingly mundane events in an entirely different way. ...actually, that's probably pretty much the whole point of the VN and I'm just stating the obvious because I'm dumb.

Difficult to say why I liked it so much. I suppose the theme of what to do when going towards certian death has always fascinated me (in fact, I tried this VN to study how other authors approached this theme, since I am writing something with that theme myself), and that kept me in a constant state of... not tension, but something like that? Another term that right now I can't find, something that has more to do with dread and bittersweetness.

It's a small game dealing with a big theme and it definitely surpassed my expectations: definitely struck a chord with someone like me who is usually not very emotional, so I'd say give it a try. Best experienced when in the right mood.

Another minor criticism: the ending (when the male character speaks for the last time, not the "other character's ending" before that) was a bit clichè if not even cheesy, but at the very least still came off as emotionally touching as the rest of the game due to its context.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999346443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1469851743}
review:
Is this what "visual novels" are? Absolutely ZERO gameplay, just some reading over pretty panels and to some touchy music here and there?

I'm sure there are many people who would like this, but this is not for me and I don't recommend it to anybody really. If I want to read, I read a proper book, and don't need pretty pictures or music for that, either.

I gave it an honest go, though; I did actually go through each story (granted, second time around was just excercise in clicking fast without even watching, just to get achievements) and even there, for me... it's rather 'meh'. Slowly paced stories about terminally ill people. Touchy-feely-artsy, eh?

I would rather play something like To The Moon, where it's touchy-feely, too, but at least more of a proper game... Brothers: Tale of Two Sons another great touchy-feely game but leveraging the medium of a video game... Heck, I would even recommend more something like Dear Esther or Gone Home for walking simluations.

review:
Free to play, awesome script, short but touching story...

What will you do, if you know your life is like the sand in a sandglass?

There're no tears, no bereavements, but I feel so depressed when the story comes to the end

A splendid story, a tale in the winter

Please, bloom our life as a splendid blossom. 

One day we will finally come to the end of our life, but, we can do everything we can, to color the road we walked through.

12/10 Recommend for every adults.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143527640', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1675584936}
review:
请在一个人的时候，安静的时候，用心去感受，冬日的回忆。？？？？/10。仅剩的生命竟是如此的美丽，哪怕没有未来，那最后的笑容也会在那一次性相机的最后一张胶卷拍出的照片中生辉。     ----2016

毫不夸张的说，水仙是对我影响极大的一部作品，一部难得的，无关爱情，无关世界天翻地覆，在日常中阐述沉重生死的好作品。是我在玩了第一次以后，不到心境适宜，环境安静，不确认自己能够全身心沉浸其中时不敢打开的游戏。所以在第一部通关了，时隔两年的2018年末，在经历一些事情之后才又一次开启了第二部的故事，随后又是两年，2021年初，编辑评论的今天，才完成了第二部的故事。
水仙可以说是有些致郁的故事，沉重的生死和看似寻求毁灭的选择，但在其中仍有希望留下来的人能够带着微笑的善意，能够忍受自己的痛苦却无法忍受他人痛苦的共情。对于逝去的灵魂，留下的人能为他们做到的，或许是带着微笑活下去。----2021

author: {'steamid': '76561198198688187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1468331713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037850703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1468320482}
review:
Fantastic, nihilistic entry level visual novels. While available for ten years prior to this, the port is free of any flaws, has multiple translations available and has optional voice acting. The dojin group that made these games, “Stage-Nana” got a lot of mileage out of the relatively few art assets in the game, and tell an impact story without being pretentious (which, considering the subject material is damn hard). 

Unlike other visual novels, there isn’t really an option to input any “choice” in the story, there’s no interaction from the player. I wouldn’t consider this a flaw, as the stories are short by comparison to other VN’s and it completely works for the type of story they’re trying to tell. 

Oh, and it’s free. So there’s that. If you dig visual novels, or thought The Antler’s “Hospice” was a bit too upbeat for you, give this a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045173210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1468106170}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]

+ Great story which will make you cry like a bitch (Play this game at nights.)
+ Good soundtrack which fits perfectly to the story. (I even made a remix for one of the tracks!)
+ 1st story leaves you with lots of questions in mind. 2nd story is a prelogue, it answers all these questions and punches you right in the face with dem feels.
+ First-person narrative is a great choice for this game!
+ I managed to finish the stories without having any break. So the story is that good :)
+ It's free, it's not short and it comes with achievements.

[b]CONS:[/b]

???

? I didnt enjoyed the character visuals nor the voiceovers. But this might because im not an anime fan.
? The story wont tell you anything about the deadly disease. So you wont learn anything about it.
? At first you might get bored but some time later story will hook you. At the 2nd story you might get confused but things will be clear near the ending.

[b]VERDICT:[/b] Im depressed as fuck.

[b]STEAM AWARDS - NOMINATED:[/b] The “I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye” Award

author: {'steamid': '76561198236249694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1467715325}
review:
…一段灿烂的故事，一个冬日的回忆——
在这个这看到自己的世界里…
我送走了不知多少个季节…多少次下着梅雨的苍白天空…
究竟…是从何时起，我变得如此孤独了…伤越是深，越是重，愈合所需的时间也就越久…你想成为谁？或者说，你不想成为谁？
…到了最后…这样的我还能保持微笑吗…至少要让留下来的人…笑着活下去…人啊，遇到难以接受的事实的时候…也许就连自己本身的事情都能客观的来看待也说不定…(99/10感触挺深的一款视觉小说，ACG玩家绝对不可错过哦，至少是我第一个玩通了全成就并且写下一堆乱七八糟东西的游戏 滑稽~感慨什么的就罢了，评论区里也已经有许多老司机的总结了，具体的感受还是要自己去接触了这个游戏才能真正生刻的体会到，——短暂的生命，周围人熟悉而又陌生的面孔…如流星般绽放的生命是最绚烂的一瞬…在生命即将逝去的最后你会微笑着离去吗

author: {'steamid': '76561198143252360', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1543221060}
review: 没有过多的言语，也没有多余的情感。简单的立绘，好听的bgm，Narcissu就是这么一部既干净却又意味深长的作品。虽说是十多年前的游戏，但是感觉上并未差的太遥远。游戏本身就如作者所说，并未刻意传达太多东西，只是淡淡的在叙述一个忧伤的故事。剩下所有的感悟与触动，都是玩家的自我演绎。给游戏留出空白，鼓励我们去思考，或许就是它的成功之处。另外，推荐喜欢的各位购买ost专辑，音乐真心不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198118235261', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1471167274}
review:
I found my box of tissues.

review:
这游戏就是这样，没有耐心的话根本玩不下去。习惯了突突突的我居然能一字一句地看完这游戏都能吹两年了....
玩完这游戏，我没有哭，只是感慨了很久，也渐渐的平静下来了，不再那么快餐。
多的不说了，慢慢看完这游戏，肯定会有收获的。
不过比起游戏更像是电子小说的模式也会让喜欢的人很喜欢，讨厌的人很讨厌吧....

author: {'steamid': '76561198158536059', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1486786464}
review:
on that blindingly bright day 

on that very day of winter 

This is a story of disease and suffering

of medication and adverse effects

of thoracotomy scars and cellular poisons;

of the living who cannot help but to die and of the dying who cannot help but to live;

of a resting place other than "on 7F" or "at home".

This is a story of so many things.

But most of all 

This is the story

of a girl whose heart was standing still

and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,

both of whom die.

時々、これはギャルゲームでなく、ビジュアルノベルというのほうがいいんだと思う。
これはある旅行の記録だーーー人間の命は一つだけの話
「私…家は嫌…」
「だけど、ここも嫌…（病院7F）」
「あなた…私を引き留めたいの？」
「それとも…一緒について来たいの？」

そして、晴れし、短し冬の物語が始まった

author: {'steamid': '76561198065186307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1466955273}
review:
点数：10/10
日本語完備

公式サイトでDLしてプレイ。
ホスピスを題材としたノベルゲーム。ある意味では逃避行劇。
ストーリーと文章の巧みさから一気に引き込まれてしまう。
一作目と二作目が同梱されているが、どちらも面白い。
時系列的には二作目の方が先なので、遊ぶ順番は好きにして良いと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198263136721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1595750938}
review:
The hospice, when the life starts to wither and no ways back.
The hospice, when death is knocking the door and no ways to shoo it away.
Make it short, narcissu shows the relationship of dying people, the role they play (to be left, leaving, and bystander).
The story is so rich, so deep and give new meaning of regret, hope, condemn. pray, and helpessness.
And if, just if, your time is decided. What is your list of ten things to do before dying?
Is making peace with yourself included?

author: {'steamid': '76561198253263673', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1473416439}
review:
不经意间看到了narcissus,但是那一刻我就被她宁静的音乐吸引住了.
也许,我们每个人都对命运有过怨恨，也想过放弃.
但是正如男主的一句话"为什么不活的积极一点呢"
一边是七楼,一边是家,往返于两者之间,早已经放弃的濑津美还是最后对命运进行了抗争.
空想的世界,穿梭的车辆,带着两人走向了一段没有目的地旅途.
不过最后还是选择了水仙,选择了淡路岛,也许这就是两人心之归宿吧.
"呐,你希望我拦住你嘛,还是鼓励你呢"
"谁知道呐"
同样的大海,没有停止的脚步,这就是回答.
960公里的旅程,
22年的人生,
画上了一个句号.
但是那个略显僵硬的微笑,那个身穿白色比基尼的少女会一直被我们铭记.
