[url=steamcommunity.com/id/Urmodol/recommended/264380/]ПОДРОБНЕЕ[/url]

[u]Мартин Брест[/u]: [i]А... ха-ха-хах... Это твоё желание? Желание номер один?[/i]
[u]Руди Вурлитцер[/u]: [i]Согласен, это не так красиво как кадиллак для мамы, но…[/i]
[u]Мартин Брест[/u]: [i]Трахнуть сразу двух...[/i]
[u]Руди Вурлитцер[/u]: [i]Переспать с двумя![/i]
[u]Мартин Брест[/u]: [i]Это называется трахаться.[/i]
[u]Руди Вурлитцер[/u]: [i]Охх... Это на твоем языке![/i]
[u]Мартин Брест[/u]: [i]Да на любом языке… Спать… Спать - это закрыть глаза и баиньки, а ты хочешь трахнуть.[/i]  ([b]"Knockin' On Heaven's Door"[/b])

[quote=JC Wickr MAG]Плюсую. Эффектно, увлекательно, подробно, эмоционально. Жду такой же стильный обзор на [url=youtu.be/NREVDx_oXWo]триквел[/url].[/quote]

[b][u]ヘブンズ・ドア[/u][/b]
[quote=!groovy!]Несмотря на поэтичный формат изложения, видно, что автору больше по душе графонистый [url=store.steampowered.com/app/209160/?snr=1_5_9__300]КоД[/url]. К чему эти слова про сакуру, которую унесёт ветром в западных землях и ссылка на новеллы [b]Winter Wolves[/b], [b]Hanako Games[/b] и [b]Winged Cloud[/b]? Ещё не понял наездов на [url=www.imdb.com/title/tt0119472/]Достучаться до Небес[/url]. Сравните оценку с японским [url=www.imdb.com/title/tt1173947/]ремейком[/url] на [b]IMDb[/b] - небо и земля. Потом, неясны и придирки к музыкальной композиции в финале игры. У всех вкусы разные, понимаете? Кстати, Нарциссу ни разу не лучшая бесплатная новелла - в этом вы тоже неправы. Бесполезный обзор получился, если честно.[/quote]
[quote=ManificaR.u.S.]!groovy!, Вы невнимательно прочитали фрагмент: [i]Достойный ответ/Произведению Яна/Японцем был дан[/i]. Тут подразумевался автор "Narcissu" [url=anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=creator&creatorid=42056]Томохару Катаока[/url]. И, на мой взгляд, "лобовое столкновение" криминальной комедии и меланхоличной драмы в контексте обзора более чем оправдано. Попробуйте на секунду оторваться от своих предпочтений, взглянуть на вещи под другим углом и, возможно, тогда Вы заметите разницу между пошловатым "предсмертным мальчишником" и леденящей душу трагедией [i]Сецуми[/i], невольным свидетелем которой Вам позволили стать.[/quote]
[quote=SomberDesolation]У автора похоже творческий кризис: унылая хайку-клоунада вместо обзора, начинающаяся с пошлой цитаты из культовой картины [url=ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ян,_Томас]Томаса Яна[/url]. Собственно, дальше и читать не стал. Позорище.[/quote]
[quote=Purr]Лол, давно я подобной чуши не читала. Обзорщик не может ни в кино, ни в новеллы. Ещё зачем-то [url=store.steampowered.com/app/232430/]"Gone Home"[/url] обос*ал, хотя там геймплея-то побольше будет, чем в линейном "рёнае". О_о Типичный виабу-илитист. Тьфу![/quote]

[u][b]Looking down at the Narcissu[/b][/u]
[quote=英利 政美]Сразу оговорюсь, что моё мнение - это моё личное дело и оно может отличаться от авторского. "Глава" переполнена негативом, направленным на вторую часть. Полностью согласна, что музыка и сэйю подобраны довольно удачно (до сих пор вспоминаю голосок несчастной [i]пациентки Химеко[/i]). Но мысль о недостатках в лице графики и текстов не разделяю категорически. Первую никто подтягивать не просил (Катаока-сан работал на пределе своих возможностей), как не просил "похоти сцены", а что касается ваших обвинительных намёков на авторское словоблудство, то это вообще полный сипец! Простите, но графоман с "поэмой" здесь только вы. И, да, тема религии в игре затрагивается не просто так и несёт в себе глубокий интеллектуальный посыл. さようなら![/quote]
[quote=bestdiamond]Надо полагать, здесь должен происходить какой-то экзистенциальный эксперимент в лучших традициях Сартра, но на самом деле это наглый постмодернистский троллинг в виде хокку. Автор намекает нам, дескать мы играли лишь ради достижений, сюжета не видели и вообще идиоты. Минусуем.[/quote]
[quote=RAMBO]Ни карточек, ни графики, ни геймплея, ни хентая. Шлак!!![/quote]
[quote=Xenoblade©]Справедливости ради, Butters объяснил, что именно искусственное растягивание сюжета превратило драму в фарс (для сравнения привёл [url=ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Нелло_и_Патраш]роман XIX века[/url] и [url=ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanbun_no_Tsuki_ga_Noboru_Sora]ранобэ[/url], которыми вдохновлялся Томо), указал на отсутствие (подчёркнутое Катаокой) религиозного посыла, а также на стагнацию проекта и пришёл к разумному выводу [b]Начало дано // Не всякой истории // Обязано быть.[/b] :-}[/quote]

[u][b]TL;DR[/b][/u]
[quote=Дмитрич]Ni4ego ne ponyal, no mne ponravilos'. (;[/quote]
[i]Две сестры сердцем
Приняты быть не могут,
И плачут они.[/i]

review: No diré que el juego es malo, es solo que este tipo de juegos no son de mi agrado. Más bien es un juego dirigido para otakus amantes del anime y manga que les gusta oír y/o leer historias visuales. En mi opinión estos son videojuegos hechos para los típicos japoneses desadaptados sin vida social que les cuesta mucho trabajo hablar con chicas reales y conseguir una novia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185736551', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1447535919}
review:
É bem lento, algumas vezes cansativo, tem uma história melancólica e isso é intensificado por sua trilha sonora, é muito bonita mas bem triste. 
Acho que pra quem não tá acostumado com visual novel ou leitura não vai curtir muito, então seria mais voltado pra os que gostam realmente de visual novel, pois não tem ações e nem escolhas.

Mas eu indico porque a história é bem tocante e intensa, então vale a pena conferir ~crying intensifies~

review:
Game: Narcissu 1st & 2nd
Genre: Visual Novel
Developer: stage-nana/Sekai Project
System: Steam (PC)
Total Score: 72/100
Value Score: 7.2/10

• Story: 8/10
• Characters: 8/10
• GamePlay: 4/10	
• Graphics: 7/10
• Sound: 9/10
• Music: 10/10
• Length: 5/10
• Replay Value: 4/10
• Player Value: 7/10

Pros
+Touching and emotional storyline
+Fantastic Soundtrack
+A lot of extra features/extra side content
+2 games in one
+Free to play on Steam

Cons
-Completely Linear Visual Novel - no choices and storyline has one path
-Very short
-Replay value forces players to play the same story with only difference between having voiceovers on and off

author: {'steamid': '76561198177059907', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1612428128}
review:
Narcissu：自恋者，指世界与命运。
没有华丽的CG，没有庞大的世界观设定，没有背负宿命的主角，更没有意有所指的说教，只是平静地描述一个女子最后的人生旅程。 ----百科上看到的觉得写的很好。
bgm很赞。
全成就一路ctrl就行，最后一个隐藏成就是看完制作人员名单。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097348943', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1448911554}
review:
Prepare and enjoy the feels~ A good story with a good background. 

I like it when the characters doesn't do anything outside human normal responses to situation, like desperately finding a cure which will alter the story entirely. The characters still have objective, despite the atmosphere was rather gloomy and give the no hope vibe, the characters are seeking something which is just to let it go (to be realistic to wait for their end ) but doesn't want it to end like that so they wanna end it while living the last of their life in the fullest. As the story lacked direction to begin, little and little things add up, then gives off "I CAN SEE THE ENDING" full with hopes and feels which was awesome.

Definitely worth to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054542591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1428731040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004842640', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1447010710}
review:
Excelente título, mas não é algo que eu indicaria para todo mundo. Visual Novel, como gênero, já é um gosto adquirido - e esta, em especial, mais do que qualquer outra. 

Não espere aqui ação desenfreada e adrenalina. O que há aqui é uma trama introspectiva e triste, que a meu ver deve ser degustada aos poucos, para preservar o impacto emocional das duas tramas e de cada capítulo. Demorei quase um ano para terminar as duas histórias e digo que foi a melhor coisa que fiz. Se tivesse maratonado, duvido que a história teria me tocado como me tocou. 

Basicamente o jogo trata da morte. Não a morte como o destino inevitável de todo mundo, um acontecimento óbvio porém nebuloso, perdido no horizonte do tempo - mas a morte como uma realidade próxima e palpável, o caso dos doentes terminais. Porém, ao falar da morte, fala-se também da vida. A vida dos que vão e dos que ficam. E isso é feito com muita delicadeza, e sem se esquivar de temas espinhosos como religião e suicídio. 

Gostei bastante da versão dublada, só é uma pena que o protagonista do primeiro jogo não tenha sido dublado. A trilha é adequada e o tema do segundo jogo, em especial, é delicado e tocante. A arte é bastante econômica, focando mais em paisagens que nos personagens, mas atende razoavelmente ao que se dispõe a fazer. 

Enfim, um excelente sopro de criatividade em meio ao mar de mesmice que Visual Novels tendem a ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159901669', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1456218375}
review:
还没有通到结局，结局后更新，目前不推荐，玩的我一口气上不来，暂停缓缓。
从最开始玩到现在，经历了赞叹－抓狂－厌烦的过程。
[h1]1.人物[/h1]
故事中的女主角的口头禅是“Not particularly",还有“so Don't ask about it."刚开始还好，现在她一说这个我就抓狂。不管男主人公问什么，她十句有8句都要用这两句之一回答。表面上装作对任何事情都不关心，但实际了一方面因等死而心如死灰，另一方面却又有各种美妙的想往，通过与男主角的对话，加深他对死亡的恐惧，总是问他要死在哪里（汗）一步步引诱他进入黑暗的漩涡。事实上，男主角确实大受影响，呆在7层病房等死成了不可忍受的事情（日漫标准：我没有错，只是这个世界错了），最终走向了夺车，携女主角，开车兜风（大误）的前途。

故事中的男主角——更是让我服气。因女主人公对他讲的种种，再加上死亡不可避免的降临在这里，他与女主角一起出门享受生活（大误），因为没有衣服（走的时候穿的是医院的睡衣），钱不够，为了提供两人的食品和衣服，男主角进行了我们要死了，做什么都可以的偷窃道路。后来汽油也不够，男主角加完油想跑，这时候女主人公神奇般的拿出了信封，里面装有很多为了逃跑而积攒的钱。男主人公问，”我怎么不知道你有钱呢？“他一直以为她没钱，女主角回答，”because I was not asked."我真不知道她是真不懂得一切都要花钱，也没看出情况已经捉襟见肘…或许她真活在要死了的自我世界里，如果不是有汽油才能到想往的地方，她什么也不会提。
[h1]2.剧情[/h1]
颓废。死亡是如此可怕，要死的人是多么可怜，死前的放纵是多么的值得怜爱，为了这一切，只有两人，不考虑道德，不考虑任何其他事物，只求最后的开怀和心愿。
“我死后哪管洪水滔天。”
[h1]3.为什么不推荐[/h1]
这种病态的，追求某种美，不管不顾的，真是只有日本人才写的出来。
让我想到渡边的《失乐园》
整体充满着为什么这样不公平的命运降临在我们身上，为什么我们成为了7层永远的住民，不能回归原来的社会。
我看过很多种展示死亡的作品，有很多种展示死亡的方式，我非常不喜欢《水仙》中的这一种，颓废的，阴暗的，看似有光明和希望去追，却其实是另一种意义上的毁灭和放纵。

review: I wouldn't exacly call this a game but its great none the less, this 'game' is purely reading text of a story, click by click. Both these stories take a great deal of time to read fully, and for me personally i just dont have the time nor the patience but for those people who do get stuck into the story-line can finish it easily. For as far as i read, these stories will hit you in the feels but its great. Enjoyable background music that creates atmosphere and pretty scene artwork, For the achievevement hunters, these ones are easy to obtain and in a short period of time, read the guides. Its worth giving it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097669126', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1446982399}
review:
虽然已经在PSP上把主线三部曲都打完了，现在还是1在steam上面把这个下载了下来。真心推荐把三部都打完！！其实大可不必把这个故事看得那么悲伤。人固有一死，正如游戏里面所说，就像车站，死去的人一个个离去了，活着的人留了下来，将要离去的人想要在这个世界上留下活过的证明，水仙的故事按照我的理解就是如此，每一部水仙都是在围绕这个主题，
死并不悲伤，悲伤的是不再有人知道你曾经活过
打完第三部，你就知道，7楼其实也是某人活过的证明
无论如何，作为一个非AVG中毒爱好者，这实在是一部好作品

author: {'steamid': '76561198093955394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1445796489}
review:
[b]TL;DR[/b] This is an amazing game overall and it's great in most aspects. (Art is debatable)

Where to start....
I had played the first game a while ago, back when steam wasn't famous and the visual novel genre wasn't really famous, it was my second Visual Novel ever, Tsukihime being the first.
I replayed Tsukihime not so long ago and with a greater capability for analysis I found it even more enjoyable and noticed some stuff I didn't notice the first time. Not so long ago I told myself "Hey, why not? Narcissu is now available on steam, let's replay it."

Just as with Tsukihime, I enjoyed it even more this time, and it was way more painful. They present a sad reality and execute it really well, the inner conflicts of someone who knows they will die soon without a specified date. The OST just fits perfectly for each scene and makes you feel even closer to the character during their conversations, even cheerful conversations can feel painful at times because of the tone the characters speak with(The VAs do a pretty great job with this, I was amazed). You notice the pain they are carrying inside and you feel for them.

And then comes side 2nd, which expands into this topic by presenting you another part of the conflict: Those who are left behind. The trouble close relatives go through when someone they hold dear  is close to dying, and how they try their hardest to support them despite their pain. And not  only that, but they develop further the main character from the first game and it makes you realize how she turned out that way. Every little detail mattered in the development of her character. 

In the end, just like first, you go through a feelings roller coaster, the conversations tug heavily at your heart and the more you advance the more you know about the 7th floor and its patients. Each of the characters feel real and each of their interactions contribute to character development for every of them (This applies for both games). 

It's truly an amazing piece of work. Soundtrack, writing, conversations, voice acting, characters. Sure, the art may not be the most appealing, but the feel you get from it is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046521780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1460169401}
review: Though we'll never truly be able to understand those who are doomed to die and know so, we can try to empathize with them at the very least.  When your innocence is shattered by the very words of "You have cancer," what would you feel? Pain? Sadness? Anger? Rejection? Fear? All 5? Or simply nothing? The couple in this story represent the human last attempt at being free before death.  Do we choose to die free or die in the same old boring place that we so despise?  These questions are what made me love the story, and the facts that it reminded me of Thelma & Louise and Interstellar and that Hans Zimmer composed the music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115233021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1444754932}
review:
10/10
[h1]一段灿烂的回忆，一段冬日的故事[/h1]
[b]详细评测日后补充[/b]
剧情：流程大概4小时（1st1小时 2nd3小时）。[spoiler]1st讲述的主人公和濑津美的病友生活，核心为”生命的价值“。2nd则是以濑津美和姬子的相处的生活为主轴辅以姬子回忆，关键词为“传承”，1st的大量细节内容在2st中都能找到伏笔与传承。[/spoiler]
音乐：音乐真的不错，很耐听。BGM基本配合到位，尤其是在剧情的几个关键点和高潮配合上插入曲真的很能调动玩家的心情。愿意支持一下制作组建议购买下面的OST。
画面：2nd的画面真的比1st的精致好多，尤其OP居然有动画部分，真是惊到了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198109152724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1444460380}
review:
Even if you are not into visual novels at all, you should give it a try. Not only because it is for free, but because it has a great story as well as  beautiful fitting music and just let you think about life and its meaning. It`s a nice small story worth spending the time for.



Selbst wenn man nicht wirklich auf Visual Novels steht, sollte man es ruhig mal ausprobieren. Nicht nur weil es komplett kostenlos ist, sondern auch weil es eine sehr schöne Handlung mit passender Musik hat und einen selbst evtl. über das eigene Leben und wie man seine Zeit verbringt nachdenken lässt. Es ist eine nette kleine Geschichte welche es Wert ist seine Zeit für zu geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005079922', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1400051745}
review:
(Updated review at 28 years of age)

There's something about "waiting to die" in Narcissu that I deeply resonated with, even as a 18 year old when I first played this 10 years ago.

For aren't we all terminal?

Aren't we all in a waiting room?

(Original review, written at 18 years of age, reposted to steam)

Short and sweet, Narcissu is a sad, haunting tale accompanied by gorgeous music and beautiful artwork, and it’s a good example of the literary form of visual novels. It requires a little patience from the reader, but it’ll make you think, and unless you’re carved out of stone, it’ll make you feel, too. You may feel sad, you may feel confused, you may even feel outraged, but your emotions will be stirred, and that was the author’s sole intention. It’s a road trip worth taking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137524518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1523600500}
review:
这好像是我有生以来第一个（耐着性子）完整推下来的gal……
然后推完的一大早哭成狗啊真的哭成狗……

这么说吧……如果你知道自己快要死了，你会做什么？整天胆战心惊？大吃大喝使劲买买买？反正都要死了去做点作死的事？游戏里的主角妹子（对不起名字太复杂忘掉了）选择的是[spoiler]先看花，再自杀[/spoiler]。这选择好啊，同志们，这是美学的选择，这是艺术的选择，这是由日神精神通向酒神精神的一次自我涅槃式的选择！

我不贫了我好好写评测（。

总之，女主就这样[strike]诓骗[/strike]着头脑简单、四肢也不发达的男主踏上了逃亡之路。说是“逃亡”未免有些过分，但仔细想想，这本来就是一次从自己的生命中逃离的旅行。开着别人的车，吃着便利店买来的简单饭团，穿着不适合这个季节的衣服，在别人按下的快门声中勉强地微笑。人生这场旅行不过是用自己的生命过着不属于自己的生活，到最后终于可以在快要接近终点的时候赌上为数不多的仅有的一切，重新做回想要接近的自己。从“此”到“彼”，再从“彼”返回“此”，这确实不仅仅是具有美学意义的逃离和重返，也是涅槃式的死亡。
最近的神话课上刚好讨论到Narcissus的文本，也想了很多这个主题。卡拉瓦乔的那一幅真的美到哭出声，有条件的话真想看看原件。或许游戏所要表达的主旨也和这个有关联：在对自我的审问之死亡中重新寻找自我。
后来和三次元姬友提到这个让我哭成狗的游戏，姬友问我男主后来怎么样了。我仔细想了想，好像是没有交代。但我总觉得男主并没有死。目睹了美的人不应该死；但反过来，不敢追求美的人也根本不配死。

想开二周目。虽然我觉得，不管几周目我大概都会哭成狗。

author: {'steamid': '76561198109544950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1443943545}
review:
「笑一笑吧,濑津美……」

出门打工的妈妈，回来时常常带着说是剩下的可乐饼和土豆，在狭小的房间里，一起看起来很享受地吃着，很高兴地笑着……不过……很辛苦。这样的关怀，然我痛苦不堪。比起感谢和开心种种感到更多的而是愧疚。

“都是你的错。”一定…希望他们这样告诉我也说不定吧……

我……应该同大家是一样的……和过着普通生活的大家一样，应该是在“那一边”才对。

「这样的我……可以微笑到什么时候呢……」

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1554624658}
review:
ビジュアルノベル。
とある病院7Fのホスピスの終末医療での患者の心情をテーマとしたノベルだ。
エピソード1と2があり、エピソード1では7Fへと入室となった主人公が患者セツミと会いセツミが最期を迎えるまで、エピソード2ではエピソード1より前の7Fに入院していないセツミが7Fの患者姫子と会ってからのひと夏の交流を描いている。エピソード1,2後にエピローグがアンロックされる。どちらもボイス付だ。

エピソード1では病院7Fでの2人の出会いから淡路島を目指して病院を抜け出し、淡路島でのセツミの最期までを淡々と描写されている。
患者の心情として、避けられない死が待っている自分が家族に負担をかけさせたくない、気をつかわせたくない、気を使わせることにより疎外感があるのは嫌だ･･･といった他にぶつけようのない感情がある。淡路島への逃避行はそこにはなにか得るものがあるかもしれないという小さな希望を抱いたある種の現実逃避であり、淡路島に到着してしまうと死という現実が直面してしまう。結局のところは最後は自分でどうするかを決めるしかない物語であり、悲しいというよりはやるせなさや儚さが感じられる。
タイトルのナルキッソス(水仙)の花言葉は「うぬぼれ」「自己愛」であり、このエピソードをそのまま表しているように思える。

ところがエピソード2を読み終えた後ではエピソード1の印象が違って見える。このナルキッソスという物語はエピソード1を2が補間する内容で2つで1つだ。エピソード1を読み終えたらエピソード2も読むことを推奨する。
エピソード2では7Fの患者姫子を通してエピソード1で見送られる側だったセツミが見送る側へと立場が変化している。エピソード1では去るものの心情が主だったが、全編を通して去るものと残されるものの心情が主となっていることが分かる。

細やかな心理描写があり、エピローグ後の読後感の良い素晴らしいノベルだ。しかもボイス付で無料ということもあり、興味があるなら読むことをオススメする。

author: {'steamid': '76561198151223723', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1455620582}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161146321', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1451896596}
review:
До чего же ужасно даже на секунду подумать о том, что тебя уже может и не стать в ближайшее время, проводя в больнице изо дня в день в одиночестве с одной лишь этой мыслью. Всё, чего ты так упорно добивался, кого знал и любил, планы на счастливое будущее - всё это  уже в прошлом, осталось дожидаться лишь своей участи. Больница и то, что происходит за её пределами - это два разных, совершенно иных мира; в одном ты можешь позволить себе всё что угодно, не ставя себе запреты ни на что, в другом же ты просто страдаешь и смотришь через заляпанное окно на то, что уже никогда не увидишь своими глазами.. 

"Нарциссы" - трогательная история главных героев, которая наполнена печалью и тоской. Безысходность и мысли о скорейшей смерти - это всё, что их может сопровождать. Разработчики, без преувеличения, просто превосходно раскрыли чувства каждого персонажа - самому не составит труда прочувствать до самых костей ту душевную боль, терзания, ощущения собственной бесполезности и просто желание жить среди людей и двигаться в том направлении, что указала судьба - но она приотовила для них совсем другой путь.. Всё это украшает соответствующее музыкальное сопровождение, которое заставляет пролить хоть одну скупую слезу во время прохождения.

Также стоит отметить немаловажную деталь - рисовка вполне на уровне для бесплатной новеллы. Но, это не главное, так как в приоритете стоят настоящие, неподдельные чувства.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094430624', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1444189473}
review:
如果生命只剩下可能是最后一个夏天，我真的希望也可以一去不回地在海浪里和过往诀别。安静到要坠入梦境中的浅浅哀伤，像是阅尽人生一样的义无反顾，舒缓的语调和音色，细腻的心绪抒情，在接连涌来的、咸咸的结局里让我落下眼泪，这应该就是对生命最深沉的思索和反馈，普通人眼里的死亡和生存，定格在我未来铭刻不忘的那幅水仙花海里。

如果有来生，我希望

算了啦，还是先活好今世

author: {'steamid': '76561198026598110', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1441796571}
review:
(don't mind my time counter for this game. I played this long before it came out on steam)
A very sad story set in the 7th floor of an hospital. This floor is where terminal ill patients are sent for them to stay for their last moments and our main characters are the inhabitants of this floor. 
From this you can already imagine that this is not going to be an happy story (despite the 22 yo lolita)
You will cry. And a lot. The entire visual novel is a story about life and death, which puts in contrast the behaviour of Setsumi, whose hope is long gone, and Yuu, who just arrived and has yet to understand Setrumi true feelings.
This game comes with the second game of the series, that is a prequel, which explains some plot holes about the first one.
While the first part earns points for the originality of the story, the second one looks a bit like a repetition of the previous one so not everyone may like it: we again have a terminally ill protagonist, older than our previous character, who is going through the same that Setsumi  will have to face in the future. The second one is "lighter" than the previous one, and sometimes a bit easy to predict
 BUT
What you should notice is the completely different kind of ending (which I won't spoil) that they have, making the first one even more sad when compared. 
TL;DR
It's free, it's 2 in 1, it's beautifully sad. Read it
P.S. Since a lot of people don't seem to know... This is a KINETIC NOVEL, which means that there won't be any choices.
Yes, there are visual novel that are read-only. No, they don't suck for that (Higurashi and Umineko)
So quit giving bad votes for the lack of choices, that's not how you judge a visual novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165454165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1441509231}
review:
一款十分优秀的游戏，也是至今为止我最喜爱的游戏之一。
第一次玩到这款游戏是在10年的时候，可以说给与我前所未有的感动，之后陆陆续续重复玩了至少五六遍仍然让我有所触动。
留下来的人如何去面对即将离去的人？
即将离去的人又如何去面对留下来的人？
不要这样疏远我让我感到自己注定死去，不要突然对我那么好对我来说这不是温柔。
“神是不存在的，奇迹也不会发生”这样说好吗？可是现实竟是如此残酷。
即使是最后的时光也要踏上旅途去实现仅存的理想。留下来的人唯有选择祝福。
正因为是荒野，所以花才会盛开。
请原谅我的语无伦次，因为我无法表达出本作带给我的感动。
可以说本作即使卖到3A大作的售价我也会毫不犹豫的买下来！支持作者，谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198116428872', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1440773974}
review:
This's my first time trying a visual novel. It happens to be Narcissu as my first choice because it's free and among the free VNs, this VN's title interest me the most.

After I try it, I realize that I just choose such a good VN. Instead of cheesy anime girl story with "plot" just like almost every manga-anime this day, Narcissu offers a deep and touching story. The author lays out the one's life, who wants to live life to the fullest for one last time before facing their own death, beautifully in a simple VN. The story was able to make me shed tears. Still, could be heartwarming as well. Beautiful soundtrack, good dubbing and banner sized picture also strengthen the feel of the story.

For my first try, I must say that I'm impressed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045200324', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1439895331}
review:
[h1]"Só vou explicar uma vez, então preste atenção..."[/h1]

[i]Narcissu 1st[/i] foi a primeira "Visual Novel" que li, a alguns meses atrás já tinha lido mas não cheguei a terminar  segundo jogo na mesma época então a algumas semanas atrás baixei novamente mas dessa vez joguei novamente [i]Narcissu 1st[/i] em PT-BR e terminei [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i]. E caramba, escolha incrível para eu poder dizer: "essa foi a primeira Visual Novel que li".

[i]Obs: Se quiser ler o resumo da análise pule direto para "Considerações Finais".[/i]

[b]◄ Estória / Objetivo ►[/b]
[quote=]... Naquele dia ofuscante...
... Naquele mesmo dia de inverno...

Esta é uma história de doença e sofrimento; de medicação e os efeitos adversos; cicatrizes de toracotomia e venenos celulares; da vida que não pode ser ajudada mas morre e da morte que não pode ser ajudada mas vive; de um local de descanso diferente que o "7º andar" ou "em casa".

Esta é uma história de tantas coisas.

Mas na maioria...

Esta é a história
de uma menina cujo coração estava parado
e um menino cujo fôlego estava sendo roubado,
ambos os quais irão morrer.[/quote]
Já na descrição, já deixa explícito que a estória apela muito para o lado emocional. Na verdade seriam dois jogos, falarei um pouco sobre ambos.

Em [i]Narcissu 1st[/i], é contada a história de Setsumi e do protagonista, diferente de muitos jogos do gênero por aí, Narcissu não é uma história de amor, é apenas a história de dois pacientes, residentes do sétimo andar, lugar onde os pacientes com doenças terminais ficam.

Em [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i], abrange acontecimentos antes de [i]Narcissu 1st[/i], novamente apelando para o emocional mas dessa vez contando a história de Setsumi e outra personagem. [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] conta com alguns personagens extras, estória igualmente tocante porém possui capítulos muito massantes e desnecessários, teve momentos que não via a hora de terminar.

O autor recomenda seguir a seguinte ordem: [i]Narcissu 2nd, Narcissu 1st e o Epílogo[/i]. Porém eu não recomendo seguir essa ordem justamente por [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] ser massante, pode fazer você desistir antes de chegar no próximo então recomendo ler na seguinte ordem: [i]Narcissu 1st, Narcissu 2nd e Epílogo[/i]. Recomendo muito jogar as versões com voz.

No total você vai levar em torno de 6 a 7 horas para completar todas as históias e pegar todas as cinco conquistas.

[b]◄ Jogabilidade / Controles ►[/b]
Como de costume, jogabilidade e controles de "visual novels" são descomplicados. Teclas de "Espaço", "Enter" e botão esquerdo do mouse avançam os diálogos. 

Tecla "Ctrl" avança o texto em alta velocidade, recomendado o uso apenas para pegar as conquistas que envolvem completar o jogo "sem vozes" depois de completar o jogo normalmente "com vozes".

[b]◄ Gráficos / Visuais ►[/b]
Diferente de outras "visual novels", Narcissu não possui diferenciação entre sprites (personagens) e backgrounds (planos de fundo), ambos são desenhados estáticos na cena, quem jogou "visual novels" mais recentes talvez estranhe isso.

[b]◄ Efeitos Sonoros / Trilha Sonora ►[/b]
A trilha sonora é simplesmente sensacional! Se a estória dos jogos são tocantes, a trilha sonora ajuda e muito para levar o jogo a outro nível.
Uma pequena amostra:
https://youtu.be/qO0tEH-FZLg
Outra coisa que tenho que dar um ênfase, as atuações de voz! Cara! Difícil explicar em palavras o que o cara sente quando as personagens falam, meio que da para sentir o sofrimento que a personagem está passando. Realmente, difícil descrever em palavras, então recomendo muito que jogue as versões com vozes.

[b]◄ Multijogador Local / Multijogador Online ►[/b]
O jogo não possui nenhum tipo de multijogador, seja local ou online.

[b]◄ DLCs / Expansões ►[/b]
Ambos os jogos só possuem um DLC que seria a trilha sonora de ambos os jogos, não comprei mas uma hora dessas pretendo sim comprar e ajudar o autor.

[h1]Considerações Finais[/h1]
Prós:
+ Estória emocionante;
+ Duas estórias para leitura com um total de mais ou menos 7 horas;
+ Visuais diferenciados de outros "visual novels";
+ Trilha sonora simplesmente sensacional;
+ Atuação de voz incrível;
+ Gratuito;
+ Apenas 300 MB;

Contras:
- Alguns capítulos de [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] são um pouco massantes;

[b]Nota Final: 8.75/10[/b]

Na moral, para quem gosta de "visual novel", recomendo muito Narcissu. E novamente digo, é incrível eu poder dizer que foi a primeira visual novel que eu li. E para nossa alegria foi confirmado o remake de [i]Narcissu 1st, Narcissu 2nd e NARCISSU 3rd[/i] e espero que venha para a Steam!

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MestreJuninho/screenshots/?appid=264380]Clique aqui para conferir algumas Screenshots.[/url]
http://store.steampowered.com/app/264380/

author: {'steamid': '76561198192380330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1439892371}
review:
I finished the first story in voice-mode.
The reason I do not recomend this is due to personal reasons– I don't enjoy super depressing, sad and slow story-lines with a plot were you know everyone awaits death.

On the plus side: 
The art is pretty nice, even though I don't like the 'moe' -styled characters.
The music is calm and sentimental.
It has immersive stories that might bring you frickle little people into tears. I'm not excluded.

Downside as I said:
It's truly depressing, about ill people just waiting to die.
Moe characters x sad story? Personally? No thank you most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080755773', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1438835422}
review: This game is sad, very sad, there are quite a few moments that hit you right in the feels, and the story is very well thought out. Side 1: You play as a young male (I'm not sure of his name) who has just been assigned to Floor 7 of the hospital, where he meets a young woman named Setsumi who tells him the rules of 7F. One of them being "You have two choices on where you die: At home, or on 7F." Side 2 is a backstory to Setsumi from before she was assinged to 7F and is where the majority of the feels were located (for me anyway).  Overall, 10/10 Would definitly read again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154110885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1439137308}
review:

車好きだとなおさら楽しめるような、マニアックな感じがとてもたまらないです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198130932508', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1438372853}
review:
[h1]"Вот они - смертные. Все, что у них есть — совсем немного лет в этом мире, и они проводят драгоценные годы жизни за усложнением всего к чему прикасаются. Очаровательно."
- Смерть[/h1]

После прохождения (вернее после прочтения) Narcissu 1st & 2nd, у меня появились кое-какие мысли. С одной стороны, грустно, ведь все мы умрем (даже Габен(((, так и не подарив миру HF3), кто-то умирает от старости, в кругу семьи, кто-то на войне, под пулями. Это печально. Но с другой стороны, новелла призывает ценить жизнь, ценить каждое мгновение. Ведь как говорится "Есть только 2 дня, когда ты ничего не сможешь сделать. Один из них - вчера, другой - завтра".  В общем, немного отошел от самой игры, перейду же к описанию:

[h1]Что понравилось:[/h1]

♥ [u]Сюжет.[/u] Новелла повествует нам о тяжелобольных, о безысходности. Главный герой не захотел оставаться последние дни в больнице и решает выбраться на волю (вспоминаются фильмы "Пока не сыграл в ящик" и "Достучаться до небес").
♥ [u]Атмосфера.[/u] Игра пропитана безысходностью, печалью и т.д.
♥ [u]Саунд.[/u] Он превосходен.
♥ [u]F2P и достижения.[/u] Игра бесплатна, прочитать должен каждый, кроме этого в игре есть легкие ачивки.
♥ [u]Персонажи.[/u] Отлично раскрыты.
♥ [u]Картинка.[/u] В игре нет ярких красок, что дает ту же атмосферу "мрачности".

[h1]Что не понравилось:[/h1]

♦ [u]Перевод.[/u] Я так понял, что на второй эпизод перевод отсутсвует, во всяком случае я не нашел ничего. Пришлось использовать скудные знания английского.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Бесплатная визуальная новелла, с острой психологической темой (А о чем я буду думать перед смертью..?), с отличным сюжетом, хорошо переданной атмосферой. Рекомендую всем, потратьте вечер на прочтение, благо игра бесплатна.

С уважением, Aikiro, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators] Ораторы Ste@m [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025028109', 'num_games_owned': 2088, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1438558774}
review:
Narcissu 1:

I thought I was prepared to read this, but nothing can prepare you for this.

The story is about two sick patients in a hospital who have embraced their inevitable deaths. One day they both have a chance to escape the monotony of the life that they had forced apon them when they were young. Where will they go with no destination? What will they do knowing nothing but the life of a patient in a hospital ward?

There is no greater plot, there is no romance, and the relationship between the two main characters could hardly even be described as friendly, but the coldness of the cast and simple story both play very important roles in tying the incredible atmosphere of the VN together.

The game actually comes with two translations one of which focused on retaining the original script's phrasing (resulting in some rather poor grammar at times) while the second translation focused more on  shapng the script into something closer to what a native english speaker would have written. Both read surprisingly different, and neither is the wrong choice.

9/10 would piece together my heart again

author: {'steamid': '76561198052933734', 'num_games_owned': 4633, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1438423405}
review:
[h1]◆ 主人公とヒロイン､どっちも死にます（公式ページより引用）[/h1]
間もなく訪れる死を前にしてどう抗うのかを描いたノベルゲーム｡
自分は既に無料で公開されているウェブ版をやり終えていたが
一作目がちょうど10年前の公開だったということで､
せっかくなのでSteamでもプレイしてみた次第｡
内容としてはウェブ版に英語その他の言語対応が
なされただけのものだが､Steam実績に対応している｡
なので､プレイ済みだと特に真新しいところもないだろうが
全会話をすっ飛ばして手軽に全実績獲得済みゲームを増やせる｡

[h1]◆ 重い[/h1]
ふぇぇとかはわわとかうぐぅとか言うような変な子や
奇跡が起きてみんな元通りだヤッターみたいなご都合主義展開はなく
過酷な現実と救いの無い結末を淡々と突き付けてくる作風なので､
気軽に萌えギャルゲーをやる感じで始めてしまうと
ハートフルボッコ不可避な点に注意｡
一昔前の作品なだけにUI周りは必要最小限の機能にとどまっており､
内容としても背景と文字が主体で
かわいこちゃんの立ち絵の類はほとんど出てこない｡しかしながら
その痛切なシナリオと合法ロリなヒロインの魅力は印象に残るもので､
ノベルゲーとして必要十分なクオリティを有していると思う｡

[h1]◆ 救いが欲しかった[/h1]
作品自体への個人的な評価としては､
ご都合主義でも構わないからやはり客観的なハッピーエンドに
して欲しかったという点で､名作レベルとまではいかない｡
感動するというよりは考えさせられるゲームなので､
いわゆる代表的な泣きゲーをプレイした後の
しばらく魂が抜けてしまうあの感覚を味わえる感じではないが､
誰しもやり終えた時に何かしら心に残るところがあるはず｡
無料だし､時間がある時に気が向いたらプレイしてみてほしい｡

author: {'steamid': '76561198041940756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1437595837}
review:
A beautiful and sorrowful story of disease and learning to embrace your inevitable death. Very unlike other stories in general which are usually about trying to escape death or living out life despite the main character's illness. Also unlike other stories, this is [b]NOT[/b] romantic and instead the chemistry between the two main characters is very cold and somewhat uninterested, at least on Setsumi's part. Another thing to remember is that this is [b]NOT[/b] a visual novel, it is a kinetic novel. There are no choices and you just read on. 
9/10 only real problem was that the music abrubtly stops at scene transitions instead of fading out. The music is really good though and contributes immensely to the overall feeling of the story.
Remember to play side 2nd first as it provides the backstory for the 1st story.

TL;DR : Depression/10 It made me cry, and It'll make you cry to. It's free, so why not try it out? also has really gud music

review:
Free to play japanese Visual Novels.  Two very sad and long stories.   Spacebar to move through it.  No decisions.  Subject matter might not be good for little kids.
 Has nice background music, sound effects and voiceovers, has nice artwork, has steam achievements for reaching the end of stories.  On the second runthrough, you can start a new story, of the other version and pick the last chapter to get the other achievement. 

The Extras is the Sound mode, pick through the soundtrack.

If you like novels, give this a try.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198101566933', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1447935722}
{'steamid': '76561198117625637', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1437780076}
review:
Im going to try to be short and sweet with this one

first of all this is not your typical visual novel, you barely if ever see anyone and the images are very small stills unlike most you'll find in other similar games like katawa shoujo. unlike katawa shoujo there is no choices you only read, this is not a bad thing but if you expect to see multipule endings this will not be the one. The story is incredibly depressing there are very few feelgood moments and the dialouge is stiff and blunt most of the time. The writing makes it hard to follow sometimes as without any names above the words you may not know whos saying what until you piece it together. this had a hard time getting me involved with the characters as the main character you never even find out his name or what he's sick from. nothing from what he likes to what his life before he got sick is revieled leaving you fairly in the dark about anything other than what happens after getting sick. The story is rewarding to finish however it is far from something id run to my friends to tell them about. the music is good and fitting most tmes however none of it is memorible either. overall I give this a thumbs up to play but only for those really really wanting to play another VN after exausting all other options. if you have not played a VN before look elsewhere there are better done ones elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142584872', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1447721261}
review:
top be honest, I was making jokes about the game to my friends at first.
Then I fell in love. It's not like the kind of thing you'd find on steam, but it has a beautiful story, the game is a story. I was expecting more like an interactive game when I downloaded it, but then I realized that's not the point. The music is great, it totally helps set the tone for the game, but it's so sad, but yet so good.
10/10 Download this shit. 
[b]Plus it's free.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198076202767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1437389853}
review:
きっかけはごとPさんの絵が好きだったからといういわゆる絵買い、パケ買い状態でした。
いざプレイし始めるといわゆるギャルゲの立ち絵があるわけでもなく、サウンドノベルかな？
というようなゲームで、絵から入った私にはちょっと肩すかし。
けど、泣けるゲーム、切ないゲーム好きとしてはこの世界観はたまりません、と思って継続。

1st、2ndと通してプレイしましたがなんと切ない。
1stだけだとちょっともやもやしてしまうかも知れませんが、
なんとか2ndまで通してやらねば勿体ない。
本当に人を思いやることってなんだろうな、と。
去る者、残される者、どうしたいのかなんて、何が良いかなんて
難聴気味の神様に教えを請うても応えてくれないのだけども、
皆んなが精一杯優しさを考えてる。

久々に良作に、優しい世界に出会えて満足でした！

author: {'steamid': '76561198070299699', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1438234539}
review:
10/10 Would cry myself to sleep like a bitch again.
In all seriousness, though, I really did like this VN. Would I read it again? No. I wouldn't be able to take the sadness again, and it's one of those stories that is only really enjoyable once (imo). I wouldn't recommend it for people who are depressed, as it deals with extremely depressing and emotionally destroying subjects. So if you feel like you can handle some sadness and have a few hours of spare time on your hands, read it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066188729', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1436009932}
review:
Amazing. Let's just cut to the chase here... These VNs are ROUGH. Very well done, beautiful, engaging, and tasteful, but it's a tough one. After unlocking the dev's Notes, you know these weren't meant to be "tear-jerkers," but I just about had a fit after 1st.

If you have ever wondered about the world of chronic/terminal illness and the associated psychological warfare that accompany the regular symptoms, this is almost a case study. This game masterfully illustrates the inner workings of the minds of those essentially given a diagnosis of "IDK, good luck to you." It's about grief, guilt, and grace.

I appreciate the focus on the deeper questions people given a finite timeline to work with have to answer. Sometimes it's not just about depression or self-blame. Rather, it can be about feeling objectified and out of control, coupled with a deeply profound view on the long-term effects interactions will have on anyone involved in the health/well-being process. 

Focusing on how people in these positions can and will think about how to execute the "end-game" was extremely welcoming and refreshing to see explored, When the body fails and is beyond personal control, most people don't know the internal struggle that ensues in trying to be resolve the situation and re-align the bodyand mind in the most peaceful way possible.

I unintentionally played the game 1st and 2nd, without knowing the developer wanted it to be played in reverse. However, I enjoyed the juxtaposition of the stories, and the conclusions that can be drawn by revisiting the first part after completing the second are very eye-opeing. I was happy that the subject of religion and morality was brought up in the 2nd, because it is a deep and frustrating struggle that people really wrestle with in the medical world (and will continue to do so).

Overall, highly recommended, especially if you or someone you know is going through a similar fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116897732', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1435960127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199505427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1476067747}
review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd is not just simply a good visual novel, but rather an unique lesson and even a simulation of life and death. Imagine lying on a hospital bed, with your friends and family slowly but surely moving further and further away from you until the day you become truly alone. What will you do then? What will you make of a life when you cannot help but to die, and even while dying you cannot help but to live? Narcissu answers those questions while teaching you about the meaning and value of life and death itself, 

"This is the story
of a girl whose heart was standing still
and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,
both of whom die."

Just because it is certain that you will die, it does not mean it is certain that you cannot live. Being able to break the so-called fate of having your resting place be on 7F or at home and being able to be truly alive even as your life is slowly being taken away.

Taking all of the clichéd expectations I had of this marvelous experience and going into the story with a naive mindset, I was blown away by the amount of feeling and depth that went into this wonderful creation. It really struck to me that even in a situation where one could only await death, these characters were still able to continue being able to smile. 

I will not go deeper into this review for the sake of having to spoil more of this bittersweet and overwhelmingly blissful experience.

10/10

Замечательная новелла. Красиво нарисованная, по-своему, как ни странно, динамичная, с красивой музыкой и прекрасно выдержанной сюжетной линией.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116754087', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1475268314}
review:
Excellent story with decent soundtracks.

SPOILER ALERT

[spoiler]This game is a must play for visual novel gamers because of its deep plot about a girl suffering from cancer. Our story starts with a protagonist, a young man who is admitted to a hospital with lung carcinoma. He eventually meets another girl who has the same diagnosis as him. She indicates that they are slowly dying and the cancer may returns after therapy. She is in her final stage of cancer as she may pass away at any moment. As the cancer progresses, they will eventually die at the seventh floor of the hosptial at the palliative unit, or at home with family. The girl calmly expresses that she doesn't want to die at the hospital nor home. She wants to escape and asks the protagonist to come along her. That's her final wish... to die alone without her family and friends... because they are the ones that suffer more.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198094987101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1435237979}
review:
Сразу скажу, что жанр игр "Визуальная новелла" на любителя. Но как ВН эта игра шикарна во всех планах. Сюжет этой новеллы наверняка тронет вас своей историей. Музыкально сопровождение так же стоит внимания, в основном состоит из композиций исполненных на фортепиано, как, собственно, типично для такого жанра игр. Многие любители подобных игр могут заметить, что тут нет спрайтов персонажей. На протяжении всей игры вас будут сопровождать только изображения окружения, ну и, разумеется, музыка. Огорчило только то, что она короткая, проходится где-то за пару часов.
В общем любителям подобного жанра игр советую. 10 нарциссов из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137417160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1452332807}
review:
难以忍受的病痛、无聊以及重复的生活、只能打开15CM的窗户，在束缚住自由的7F掰着手指等待死亡的那一刻到来，其实这种煎熬的痛苦已经超越死亡了。
完成一次旅行、吃一次特大份冰淇淋、或者只是想游玩学校的单杠，在被死亡下了诅咒之后，最渴求的并不是自己能否活着，而是希望能够笑着面对死亡。毕竟对于死亡，我们毫无抵抗之力，但若能坦然面对死亡而笑着死去，也不枉活过。
生命难能可贵，活着的人，也请笑着继续活下去。

author: {'steamid': '76561198154154050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1418260727}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069844628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1435250533}
review:
A great and emotional free to play game. 

The game's art style, characters and soundtrack is really good 
The story can make your heart all tingly with the help of some really good voice acting and instrumental music playing in the background to set the mood right.

On the downside however, I kinda wished there were more images of the characters and some choice sequence so players can have a little bit of interaction in the game. 

But all in all, if you're looking to kill time and just relax or read something that can make your heart feel really heavy, then you should definitely try this out.


2nd was even better. I swear my eyes got watery quite a few times. Definitely not forgetting this game anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104582224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1451654399}
review:
相当棒的作品 

无选项，游戏只需要不停点屏幕或者自动播放就好

整部作品都在极力渲染着对命运的无奈感无力感，以及孤独感

等待死亡的少女什么的，总体偏压抑了，但是，7楼的规则，就像最后一条所表达的那样。没有对世界的怨恨，只有对留下来的人的祝福。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053570068', 'num_games_owned': 1777, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1434973125}
review:
Если не относится скептически к жанру новеллы, и не рассматривать ее с позиции игры, то продукт получился достаточно годным. Новеллы в игровой индустрии, та ячейка, которая в первую очередь должна затрагивать самые острые вопросы психологии, что тоже было достигнуто. Незначительное количество иллюстраций, и краски, в которых они оформлены, несомненно придали опрделенный грустный контраст. Являясь ярым сторонником того, что все книги должны быть сделаны из бумаги, и прочитаны не с экрана монитора, все же подниму палец вверх, за сюжет и его битную интерпретацию.

7 слезок из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196373755', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1433349440}
review:
The first one was a bummer, but the second is worth it. For me, at least.

[spoiler]Although I know this game is made to show suicide rates in Japan, one does not simply kill themselves because there were no hope. The girl on second series is stronger than the first one.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075597069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1434921005}
review:
If you knew you were going to die, would you cry? or would you curse your fate?

Narcissu is the story of two terminally ill patients of the 7th floor, that decide to leave the hospital for a trip.
We follow their journey through Narcissu and in Narcissu 2nd, a prequel to the first, we witness a similar story.

This VN is short, in around 5 to 6 hours, I finished both games and the epilogue and acquired all the achievements. 

The story is very beautifull, but somber, which is expected when the main protagonists are barely hanging on to life.

The style is very minimalistic, most of the art is scenery. A lot of people complained that the art style was not to their liking, but I think it's very pretty, serene and delicate. It's definitely better in Narcissu 2nd.

The music is wonderful and calming, I love it and bought it instantly. If you like relaxing piano tracks, it's worth the listen. You can access it in the extra menu of the game.

I recommend playing this VN, it's free and it is short enough to occupy you on a rainy afternoon. Though the themes explored in the story are daunting and heatbreaking, it still touches upon something we can all retale to, death.

review:
When I first tried this Visual novel, I had no expectation, because it was "just a free game, it wouldn't be free if it was that good". 
And I was wrong, this kinetic novel (you don't make any choices) is really great.

It's really poetic, and sad,the music is awesome.... 

I've only finished the first one (the 2 chapters are independant) but i'll start the second soon, when I'll have a whole night to spend. 

Yup, I'd pay money for that; it was a good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966822988', 'num_games_owned': 3763, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1433672409}
review:
[Play Time] : 8시간 내외
[게임장르] : 비주얼노벨


[게임의 장점]
1. 무료게임
2. 비공식 한글화 패치 (예전 한글 패치도 잘 됨)
3. 게임이 다루고 있는 주제
4. 무료게임에 비해 퀄리티 높은 배경음
5. 게임내 더빙.


[게임의 아쉬운 점]
1. 약간은 공간되지 않을 아쉬운 스토리 라인.
2. narcissu2 에서 주인공의 약간 아쉬운 더빙.


[게임소개]
 : 자신에게 주어진 시간이 얼마 없다면??

게임의 장르는 현재 결코 신기한 장르는 아니다. 또한 많은 게임들이 다양한 주제를 가지고 있지만 나르시스수 만큼 플레이어가 주인공의 입장이 된다면 과연 자신은 어떻게 행동하게 될까? 라고 생각해 볼만큼 무거운 주제를 가지고 있는 게임은 많지 않다고 본다.

이 게임의 배경음 그리고 미소녀가 나온다 하여 가볍고 즐겁게 즐길만한 게임이라고 생각한다면 큰 오산이다 CG 및 배경음과는 전혀 맞지 않게 매우 무거운 주제를 가지고 있다고 볼 수 있다.

가볍게 즐길만한 게임을 찾는 플레이어라면 이 게임은 전혀 어울리지 않기에 플레이 할것을 권장하지 않는다. 또한 무거운 주제로 인해 결말 부분까지는 어느 정도 게임이 루즈한 부분도 있다고 보인다.

하지만 게임을 하면서 약간의 철학(예를 들어 책 중에 도덕/정의/죽음 이란 무엇인가? 라는 철학책)적인 부분에 대해 한번쯤 고뇌 해보는 것을 즐기는 게이머라면 한번쯤 추천해 볼 만 하다.

게임의 더 이상의 설명은 해당 게임의 많은 스포를 담게 되므로 스토리가 아닌 게임적인 면에 대해 평가 하자면 해당 게임이 무료인 관계로 많은 플러스 점수를 얻었지만 게임의 완성도는 약간 미흡하지 않았나 싶다.

해당 게임에 대해 완성도가 약간 떨어질 수 밖에 없는 미흡한 점을 설명하자면.
(게임내에서 게임 제작자가 이러한 면은 양해해 달란 부분은 빼도록 하겠다. 그 이유는 게임 제작자가 설명한 내용을 읽어 보자면 나름 타당한 면이 있기 때문이다.)

(1). '나르시수스2'에서의 약간 아쉬운 더빙 (해당 캐릭터의 감정이입)
 -> 1편은 나름 더빙이 잘 되어 있다고 생각되나 2편은 더빙이 좀 미흡하지 않았나 싶다. 후반부에 부드러운 말투 였다가 갑자기 약간 차가운 말투로 바뀌는 부분이 있는데 대화를 읽어 봤을때 따로 태도가 바뀌어야 할 입장은 아닌거 같으며 그 대상이 잘못되어 있다라고 생각되어 지는데 이는 해당 대사에 대해 감정 이입이 부족하기 때문이 아닐까 싶다.

(2). 납득하기 쉽지 않은 게임상의 설정.
 -> 이 부분에 대해서는 게임을 완료한 인원들 각각 생각이 틀릴 수 있으며 내가 내린 평가에 대해 반대적인 입장을 가질 수 있을 수 있음을 먼저 이야기 한다.
 게임을 평가하는 필자는 게임에서의 주제를 현실로 겪어 봤기(주인공 입장은 아님)에 해당 게임상의 설정에 대해 약간 납득하기 어려운 부분이 있다. 물론 해당 주제에 대해 직접적으로 현실상으로 겪어보거나 체험해 보지 않은 이상 잘 모를 수도 있고 또한 나라간 문화 때문 일 수도 있겠으나 필자의 가장 가까운 인원과 또는 게임상의 입장에 놓여 있는 인원들 몇몇을 지켜 봤을 때 게임상의 설정은 현실과 매우 괴리감이 있었으며 그에 대한 조사는 많이 이루어 지지 않은거 같다. 만약 조사(사람들과의 인터뷰)가 이뤄 졌다면 좀 더 깊이 있는 스토리와 해당 게임의 설정이 많이 이해가 될 수 있을거라 생각되며 좀 더 게임의 집중도가 올라갈 수 있었을 거라 생각한다.

그 외 몇 가지 자잘한 아쉬운 부분이 있지만 그 부분을 떠나 나르시수스 무거운 주제지만 철학적인 부분(고찰/고뇌) 있으므로 한번쯤 플레이 해볼 것을 권하고 싶다.


[도전과제]
 - 비공식 한글 패치를 설치하여 플레이 했다면 도전과제를 얻을 수 없다. 해당 게임을 삭제 후 재설치 한 뒤 Ctrl 신공을 이용하여 나르시스수 1&2 보이스/비보이스의 엔딩과 프롤로그를 보게 되면 모든 도전과제를 얻을 수 있으니 참고하자.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031505961', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1434204112}
review:
События данной новеллы происходят в городке Мито. Протагонист — молодой человек 20 лет — попадает в больницу, а затем в хоспис с неутешительным диагнозом. Там он встречает молчаливую девушку Сетсуми, которая старше его, что не особо заметно, с такими же шансами на выздоровление. Отчаявшись находиться в этом пристанище последних дней, они решают выбраться на волю и впоследствии попасть на остров Авадзи, на котором есть что-то дорогое сердцу Сетсуми…

Новелла скорее заставляет бережнее и внимательнее относиться к жизни (чего только стоят слова героя в самом конце), чем, наоборот, думать о суициде и прочих депрессивных вещах. За что собственно она мне самому так понравилась...

author: {'steamid': '76561198065717178', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1464285511}
review: So I've played through the 1st game and probably halfway through the 2nd. So I felt like I should state my opinion. First I love the game (err visual novel) some dont like to just read but I do so this linear style suites me. Second the atmosphere of hoplessness you can really see and when people say a lot of it is pretty bland in hontsty they were pribably going for that. The whole process of sitting infront of a boring TV waiting for enevitable death fits that. Third to me its one of those games that for me didnt have a lot of emotion every time but when it was needed it really hit me like a train now I wasent curling up in a ball crying like when watching clannad but it really had very strong emotion behind it  if you are a very imaginatinve reader and the texts becomes almost like a movie in your head. All and all I rate it a strong 8.5/10 for the first game, the second game as of now is a vast improvement of visuals and even including a sort of music video makes the overal package 9.5/10 (I wont give a full rating for the 2nd game since I havent completed it fully)

review:
Pure Visual Novel Game no choices & puzzles etc. It just like im watching drama than playing game
Well i don't know how to say it but yeah ow yeah well... WOW NICE BLABLABLA (that is my experssion)
I don't realize that i dont even blink my eye until my mother snap me out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1431502347}
review:
[b]⊕[/b]Different subtitle sets are available. The environment is very pretty. For taking place mostly inside a car, Narcissu 1 is engaging. Peaceful soundtrack. Surprisingly Fulfilling for a Free to play game! Several key/mouse options to click to progress, allowing you to alternate how you're positioned while reading.

[b]⊖[/b]The sequel was pretty weak and droned on aimlessly. All of the game's visuals are trapped in an uncomfortable little letterbox. This is a unique stylization, but a little annoying. There are no character sprites, you see the female lead perhaps 4 times total in the first game. At times, it is nauseatingly melancholy. Voice option is bad.

[b]✎[/b]It’s free, so why not? it's a nice little ride. If you're looking for a peaceful, satisfying read with a nice conclusion then this is a great F2P story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113300023', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1434436989}
review:
There is no fourth time, the third time you are admitted is the last, so prepare yourself.
Narcissu 1st and 2nd is a kinetic novel (Without choices) that portrays the lives of young adults living in the 7th floor of the hospital, the floor in which its residents awaits their deaths. Narcissu 1st and 2nd is a very well made visual novel with highly emotional and wonderfully written storyline, together with the marvelous soundtracks. It puts you in the perspective of people who have a limited amount of time left, people whose future had been denied, people who have nothing left in life, people who live their lives everyday thinking about the day when they will pass on. This Visual Novel is able to invoke a series of emotions and feelings that will linger around even after you completed the story. It is also free of charge, I highly recommend Narcissu if you are a fan of tragic stories or Visual Novels. Definitely one of the better made visual novel there is on Steam. 
Right now, do you want me to pull you back, or instead, do you want me to give your back a push?
10/10 will climb Mt Fuji to complain to god again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069059526', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1433534905}
review:
22 minutes in the game and listening to the soundtrack just makes me cry. It's beautiful Q.Q

And finally, after 1.8 hours, I finished the Narcissu 1.

I have to say, I really like this VN and how the development of the characters.

It has a good plot and character development, but Setsumi's is the most apparent. Sense of mystery is nice and the fact that their time is really limited to an unknown amount puts more feeling to every moment.

The soundtrack is absolutely beautiful which adds to the sad (yeah, I have no other synonyms for sad) atmosphere of the story.

10/10 would cry again.

Except I didn't shed a tear (almost tho). I have no soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1189, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1433382038}
review:
Well written but I could only make it about 1.2 hours, or up to chapter 5. It was just putting me to sleep. I enjoy reading books, but this story was just excruciatingly boring and uneccesarily detailed. We don't need to have details of them getting gas and eating rice balls. I've read in the forums what happens in the end and I just did not feel like if I had kept reading that the outcomes of the story would have been worth my time. Not sad or depressing, just rather dull and sleep inducing. It is also not exactly a visual novel. Just widescreen still images that are well drawn but also boring to look at and add nothing to the story.

However it did get me curious to know if there are actually any good visual novels out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085709842', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1433190860}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050922291', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1433281843}
review:
Absolutely brilliant. Two heart touching stories very well attached with an amazing narrative, simply but effective artwork and a nice soundtrack. Dubbing is sensational, even in japanese or whatever, it makes you to know how they felt in every conversation.

Worth reading. The first one is a main story about Setsumi and the second one is the prequel of the first one but with another character, Himeko... longer and with many more details that explain to the reader why Setsumi behaves in that way.

No choices, even a game, nor the typical an audiovisual novel, is just like a book so there is nothing to do except read, listen and feel.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1433089147}
review:
First thing you need to know is.. 

This is NOT a game.  There are visual novel that have game choices and etc and that would be a choice and decision game...

This is not NOT a game. It doesn't have choices and the only thing you need to do is once a chapter end click the next chapter and you can press space to speed things up.

That being said.. 
This is FREE. 
This is a beautiful book with a wonderfully touching story.
This "Game" have achievements.

Despite being a girlish book it have some nice plots and fun to read. 
I enjoyed both 1 & 2.

IF you bored from gaming want sometime off reading book go for this one.. Again it's free.

IF you just want boost your achievement ratio. 
Turn this game on. Change speed to auto-read to high. 
Start this game "unvoiced" then press "A" to start auto-read. 
Watch some TV with this game on. Click A every once a while at stuck point or mouse click to chapter change.
Once your unvoiced achievement Pops just go to the menu and this time select "Voiced" then click last chapter.
Keep mouse clicking or space clicking until achievement.
Move to second book. Do the same thing.
Move to Extra ending. Do the same thing.
You just got another 100% game...

For review wise.. 
1/10 as A game.. 7/10 as a Book.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198185747370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1432671725}
review:
First, probably important for you to know, I read the [b]unvoiced 1st season[/b]. 

So lets start: It's a non-optional visual novel, in other words, just mashing your mouse button / return key and reading is all you'll find in this game, paired with some sounds and pictures, suiting the story, and a soundtrack, supporting the actual mood of the story. The soundtrack contains - at least, as I guess, after playing for almost 3 hours - probably only two songs, but I didn't recognized this as a problem, yet it worked out really well, since you got to know whether that scene was sad or just glumly just by recognizing the right song. The sound effects also were fine, even if I got somehow scared, hearing - the first sound of a human, not a car or the waves - a girl crying and sobbing. 
Coming next to the pictures, I'm somehow unimpressed. I got the impression, that there are too less pictures. Plus pictures barely showed humans, making it very unlively. Also more than a few pictures were used too often. The effect, the soundtrack, containing only a few songs, had, reaches here for the opposite. It formerly tells you "yes, in the car again, nothing new, nothing exciting at all" and you may come to think it's really boring, not worth going on with reading. That somehow got to be my case, but there are also a few other points according to that.
The text itself is written from a to the protagonist limited narrator, containing very much dialogs. 
[i] And here comes the reason why I wrote "unvoiced" in bold in the first line:[/i]
It's unbelievable hard to follow who is saying what. When it was almost over, you could tell from the way the characters speak, who just said that, but in the beginning, it's a real pain and it confuses and makes the story incredibly boring.
Honestly, I was close to quitting the game mid-way. 
Well, I continued till the end, always thinking "no matter how sad it is going to be, since I was so confused in the first part, I won't be affected that badly (meaning I won't show any emotion like setsumi)". But I have to say, I was at least a bit wrong. It didn't got me that hard, but it [i]was[/i] somehow sad.

[spoiler] There is another problem, I had with the story: WHY THE HELL IS THE PROTAGONIST A GUY??! Either I missed that part, in the first few sentences or it was supposed to be like that. But now, I have a different view on everything what happened. It confuses me even incredibly more. I somehow dislike the protagonist being a guy, I would prefer that story, I already imagined all the time, dealing with two girls. [/spoiler]

If you wanna give it a try, being interested in this visual novel, please, for your own sake, play the voiced version.
I started the second season just yet, this time voiced, and until now, nobody except the protagonist - [i]a girl[/i] - was dubbed. I have no idea, if that's the same case in the first season, I won't try. I also won't go on reading the second season, because I don't think it's worth anymore, confusion being the cause.

I hope I did help you, deciding whether you should give this novel a try, since it's for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113610511', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1420567759}
review: Narcissu in a nutshell: an [b] emotional rollercoaster [/b] of a visual novel that will surely leave an emotional mark for hours after finishing it. Like any other visual games, this one is predicated on reading long blocks of text, accompanied by [b] beautifully-composed [/b] musical score, and some drawing. Not really fond of the art style, but the story more than makes up for it. Would [b] NOT [/b] recommend to anyone suffering from depression, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148120781', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1527410531}
review: Narcissu 1st & 2nd are focused on the theme of death from the perspective of terminally ill patients. This may not be a comfortable subject for some people. However, as everyone blessed with life must have a death, I encourage you to give it your time and consideration. My play time appears low because I finished them offline and Steam didn't log the hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029293012', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1432552703}
review:
Невероятная история, которая читается на одном дыхании. Порой темная, порой светлая.  Порой заставит улыбнуться, порой - расплакаться.  Её смело можно вставить в один ряд с to the moon (лидером душещипательных историй) : по сюжету, по музыке. Действительно вещь, которая заставляет задуматься. Очень о многом.

К игре есть отличный руссификатор, и я надеюсь, что о ней узнает все больше и больше людей. Поиграйте, я абсолютно уверена, что вы не пожалеете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148058140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1424039305}
review:
I read a different version that wasn't on Steam. Thus low hours. 

It was very sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022133561', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1433513682}
review:
Eine sehr bewegende Storry mit viel Gefühl und eine die beste Visual Novel, die ich bisher gespielt habe.
Bei einigen Szenen habe ich mich selbst mit Tränen in den Augen ertappt.
Die musische Untermalung ist spitze und unterschtreicht die einzelnen Szenen noch.
Die Geschichte hat, wie ein gutes Buch, einen Wiederspielwert.
Ich hoffe wirklich noch ein paar solche Perlen an Visual Novels zu finden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015893040', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1432440194}
review: Read the first one, not eager for the second. Painful story of death and suicide, and how we allow immovable realities to dictate our lives, and how we might change them a little by doing ridiculous, risky things. It's not an ineffective novel, but it is a bleak one. I don't come away from this book feeling I know much more than I came into it with, nor will I remember the characters. Nevertheless, it was poignant throughout, and well written. I would say that the author is talented and smart, but this book itself is a well illustrated process of slowly dying while grasping at the last few straws of life, and that is what reading it feels like. I simply can't recommend the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129215290', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1432310688}
review:
The Visual novel for Narcissu is great and highly emotional one. It is engaging made me want to play straight without stopping and in the process I started to ride the feel train. The story plot is decent about people who are terminally ill and was on the verge of dying. I somewhat could feel the emotional connection between the characters and made me feel sad that the game was over. The Narcissu 2nd is basically answering some of the questions raised in the Narcissu 1st. I wished there is more of it. 

If you are not looking forward for emotional and dark story, then this is not the game for you :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999205069', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1453710990}
review:
Normalerweise kann man von "free to play" Spielen nicht zu viel erwarten. Dieser Visual Novel stellt jedoch eine krasse Ausnahme dar.
Man trifft keine Entscheidungen, bekommt jedoch eine tiefsinnige und herzergreifende Story, die einen nicht mehr loslässt.
Vorwegnehmen möchte ich nichts, es kann ja jeder selber schauen, ob der Inhalt einem zusagt, kostet ja nichts.
Wenn es einem gefällt, so wie mir, endet es sicher nicht selten darin, dass man den Soundtrack (hier als DLC erwerbbar) kaufen möchte, um den Entwickler als Dank für diesen kostenlosen VN zu unterstützen. Gut anzuhören ist er zudem auch noch.
Win/win.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028609055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1432470779}
review:
This game was my first touch in a world of visual novels and I was instantly carried away with the story.
Very tragic and sad story, which makes you think about those who are suffering on a hospital bed, filled with guilt about being treated well by their relatives and giving up their hope about future.
The story line keeps you in touch and guides the reader through thoughts and feelings of a young dying person.
This novel is a must-see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137412986', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1483120522}
review:
One of the games where I felt guilty for not crying.

Narcissu is different then anything I ever played or read. It has a similar theme like my favourite VN - Katawa Shoujo, but what sets it aside is its handling of matters of death.

Narcissu is like Fault in our Stars for grown ups, and yet different in its approach. Thanks for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13195, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1431550138}
review:
This horrible, horrible visual novel made be cry! As its intention was evoking emotions, it did the job.

Let's get down to business (I will keep this spoiler-free). Narcissu visual novels (VN) are not strictly games: they have no interactive parts whatsoever. You can just click away and the story continues linearly with no choices. Even the achievements are just reading the novels to their ends.

Narcissu (both of them) is a story about people [i]living with[/i] a terminal disease. Note the emphasis. It's a highly emotional and tragic story, with death being a constant theme. Nevertheless, the characters lives are what's important.

Curiously, the type of the disease is left unrevealed in all cases, emphasising the life of the person instead of the sickness. At all times the story follows one of the protagonists from their perspective, revealing what goes through their head. (Most) Protagonists and some important characters have voice-overs for their dialogue. Scenes are covered by nice, melodical piano songs and occasional other instruments.

Apart from many other visual novels, the visuals are very simple: usually there's just a serene scene that depicts the place where the events take place e.g. a kitchen or a countryside. There are very few scenes with people. The style didn't appeal to me strongly. However, I think that at important (i.e. dramatic) times the scenes were well done.

A couple of things about 1st and 2nd novels separately. In my opinion Narcissu 1st begins slowly, with the protagonist being admitted to a hospital and angsting away there. In Chapter 1 it seems like nothing is happening and frankly I was bored while reading it. Fortunately, in half-way through Chapter 2 it finally begins happening, so be sure to endure until that time. Narcissu 2nd is better in this respect as it has a branching story line from the beginning with several characters.

While both VNs are originally Japanese, there are fortunately two English translations of Narcissu 1st. The Agilis translation (the one I read thoroughly) has rather lot of typos and in some small parts it is left unfinished. To me it felt rather clunky. Only afterwards I briefly checked the gp32 translation and it turns out gp32 is a more polished and "proper" translation to English than Agilis. Narcissu 2nd has only Agilis translation to English that was fortunately a lot better and more polished than the one in Narcissu 1st.

For me, Narcissu 1st was 3-hour read and 2nd a 5-hour one. While it's possible to skip through the story by pressing CTRL for achievements, I can recommend reading through the story: it's an emotional and even revealing experience to issues and thoughts of people suffering from difficult diseases. As such, it provokes one to think about life perhaps from a new perspective. To me, that makes it worthwhile a read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056671990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1454976302}
review:
NOTE:Review is personal. Don't be a dick please. 

This novel is disturbingly sad and metaphorically makes perfect sense to me which touches me, and so far has hit me very hard as I suffer from dissociation on a daily basis, 

and have spent most of my days inside my own 7th floor staring at my pc screen listening to music doing nothing thinking nothing, strugging with addictions and health problems and dying on the inside and out 'trapped' in my home because of anxietes and fears, from past and semi recent abuse. no hope because no jobs.  In my room where i'll probably die. Abandoned, begged friends to be there but noone cares anymore. Faded, forgotten. Accepted it and gave up. Sad life. I don't wanna die but. It's impossible to truly live.

Don't play if your not already/don't want, to feel sad/depressed because trust me your about to be crushed. 

:) I'm only on the second chapter but will update about how I feel about this. sorry for bad review skills

review:
Was soll man dazu sagen es ist ein Novel das einem zum heulen bringen kann.

Es ist Free 2 Play mit einer sehr Emotionalen geschichte die richtig einen ins gesicht schlägt sag ich mal mir ging es auf jeden sehr na, ich werd nichts zur geschichte schreiben da es sich sehr lohnt sie sich selber durchzulesen, da auch der Soundtrack sehr mitbewegt das erste Lied in (1st) was man hört ist das übelste in sachen traurigkeit immer wenn das kommt ist man fast denn tränen nah.

Es ist aber leider ein wenig schade das die schönen Bilder nicht in voller pracht gezeigt werden da sie sehr gut sind und mehr Tiefe geben.

Ansonsten sehr Empfehlenswert für jeden der eine schöne traurige geschichte lesen/spielen wollen ich freu mich wenn der 3rd teil auch erscheint will gern mehr wissen.

PS an die Entwickler stage-nana : Please make a Anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101362468', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1590217690}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060628914', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1431741780}
review:
公開当時は大いに話題になった、日本製同人ノベルゲーム「ナルキッソス」の1・2抱き合わせバージョン。
シナリオ・音楽・声優全てプロによる作品なのになんと無料。

【Narcissu 1st】
ある病院の7階－ホスピス－に入院することになった主人公は、そこで全てにおいて無関心な少女・セツミと出会う。
ある日、偶然のチャンスを利用し父親の車を盗み出した主人公は、
7階でも家でも死にたくないというセツミを連れ、病院を飛び出す。
一号線をひたすらに西へ、水仙が咲き誇るという淡路島を目指して・・・

【Narcissu SIDE 2nd】
1stよりもさらに昔のお話。
まだ病状が比較的軽く通院しているセツミと、7階の住人・姫子の交流を描いた物語。


時系列的は2→1だけど、普通に公開順に1→2とプレイしたほうがいいかと。
後付だとは思うけど1におけるセツミの行動原理や、車や地理に異常に詳しかった理由も2をやればその背景が見えてくる。

個人的には2の方がかなり心を抉られた。
7階住人、つまり「去る者」のみが話の中心だった1と違い、
2はセツミを始め、姫子の妹・千尋や親友・優花、
そして[spoiler]かつてヘルパーだった姫子[/spoiler]といった、「残される者」の心理描写が濃密に描かれている。
大切な人が死にゆく時、「弱っていく姿を傍で見ていたい」か「知らぬ間にいつの間にか亡くなって欲しい」か、
逆に自分が死にゆく立場だった場合、大切な人に「最期まで傍にいて欲しい」と思うか、
それとも「自分のことなど忘れて欲しい、自分のせいで悲しまないで欲しい」と思うか。
そういった究極の選択を、様々なキャラの立場から、真っ向から描いていく。

このゲームはいわゆる「泣きゲー」ではないと思う。
あからさまに泣かせようとする描写はないし、ただ淡々と、会話が繰り広げられていくだけ。
しかしプレイ後には心に大きなインパクトを残していく、そんな作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072443220', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1448666006}
